Reviews.Title: “Silver Lakes Resort”
Reviews.Author: bearmde
Reviews.Content: I just left today (4-20-2012) from a weeklong stay at Silver Lakes Resort. I was in the 900 building on the third floor. I honestly thought the resort was very nice. It was clean and very well kept. The location is excellent and makes getting to the Disney parks or Rt 192 very easy. The pools are all heated and were very nice. In fact while we were there they were building a new gazebo like structure made out of solid cedar. The rooms were very nice and well maintained. It was well stocked with everything you could need. The TV's were not of name brand and the picture quality was less than stellar, but we did not watch tv that much. The one in the bedroom was NOT a flat screen and a little old. With that said, it was very nice to have a full kitchen, and a washer and dryer. MY ONLY COMPLAINT, was that you DID NOT have wireless access without buying some sort of activity card that was 25.00 for the week. They masked it by offering some discounts on services, etc...but COME ON...give everyone wireless. Motel 6 has wireless. Honestly that was kinda cheesy I thought. If you want to sell an activity card, then do it, but give me wireless. To be fair, they did have two computers that you could use if they were not busy, but were limited by time and depending on who was waiting in line.. Front desk, and personnel were very friendly. Yes it is a Time share, but we told them we were not interested, and we were not hassled at ALL. They told me that the owner would not allow high pressure sales. Which I did appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Silver Lake”
Reviews.Author: kunkel5250
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to mention that this is a review for a condo, not a resort, as I don't feel that this place should be considered a resort. We stayed in a recently renovated room and it was quite large and nicely decorated. We had a 1 bedroom and it was plenty of room for my husband, myself, 19 year old daughter and 6 year old son. We stayed here for 1 reason . . . to go to Disney. We were in the room very little and did not use any of the amenities except for the pool on 2 afternoons. The kitchen was stocked with plenty of items to cook with. We went to the grocery store the first day and stocked up on essentials. It was nice to have a full size fridge. We only cooked breakfast a few days so we did not use the oven or microwave, just the stove top to cook eggs. We did notice grills available to cooking, but did not use any. There is no real restaurant on site but did see people ordering pizza by the pool and having drinks. I would recommend eating at nearby places such a Sweet Tomatoes, Chevy's, Carrabba's, etc. I went online to each of those restaurants websites and was able to sign up for coupons which were a great money saver. We also used the back gate to travel back and forth from Disney. Very convenient and easy to navigate. The closest park is Animal Kingdom. There is a McDonalds that you pass on the way to Disney through the back gate that made for a quick breakfast but also allowed us to stock up on packets of salt, pepper, spenda, ketchup, jelly, etc. Saved us from having to buy this at the store. Parking was the only issue we had. We were never able to park in front of our building. We usually had to park around the corner, which is not a huge deal, but at Midnight you wish you were able to park in front. If you are looking for a resort, I don't feel this is the place to stay. If you are looking for a clean, spacious, condo then I would recommend it. I was the perfect place to fit our needs for this trip, which really was just a clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “nice price and location!”
Reviews.Author: creekmom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week at the end of March in room 523. There were 5 of us. Our room was a 1 bedroom with a King sized bed and there were two pull-out couches out in the living room areas. The couch beds were uncomfortable- that's why I gave Sleep Quality the lower ranking. The condo itself was clean and huge. Full kitchen with dishwasher, dining room, two living room areas and a two full bathrooms. We had a washer/dryer in the closet too. The back patio balcony was fully screened with a table and 4 chairs. The bathroom off the living room area was smaller - just enough room for a shower/tub, toilet and sink. The bathroom off the 1 bedroom was huge! Huge jacuzzi tub (which we didn't get a chance to try), a huge walk in shower, long vanity with two sinks, a closet, and a separate toilet room. We arrived at 3pm, but they would not check us in until 4pm. So we went grocery shopping while we waited - two grocery places close by! The main pool was huge but it was a little dirty on the bottom. We only had time to go twice during evening hours and it wasn't crowded then. They had movies and activities planned but we didn't try those as we were out and about most of the time. Animal Kingdom is a 5 minute drive away - go the back way to the parks! We only called down to housekeeping once to get more laundry detergent. They brought it to us within the 1/2 hour. They don't clean rooms daily, so hang up your towels for reuse. You also have to take out your own trash. They came in once during the week to replace all our towels and took the trash, but didn't do any other cleaning. Some pros: Huge condo nice price convenient to Disney parks security lots of pool space Some cons: couch beds are uncomfortable you have to pay for wi-fi/internet access that is slow the tv in the main bedroom was old and the cable would go in and out not many places to eat close by. places seemed to have been closed down. you can hear your neighbors (but it wasn't bad enough to bother us) observation: the girls behind the check-in desk I think were more interested in talking to each other than wanting to help you check in. I felt like I was "bothering" them for showing up! Also they didn't mention anything to me during check-in about the wi-fi/activity card - if I didn't know about it ahead of time from these reviews I would have had to make another trip to their counter! Overall I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: jghenmar
Reviews.Content: This is quite long review so I ask for your patience :) Called the front desk to inform them we'll be checking in late, the person who answered the phone can't find our reservation and she seemed starting to get frustrated. My wife asked for the supervisor then she finally found our reservation. Upon arrival at 10pm, I spoke to Nina, everything was going well until she asked me to write the names of people who will be checked in so I wrote my name, my wife, and my 4 yr old daughters name..that's when it all went downwards. Her response....we have a problem, I can't check you in. You reservation is only for 2 persons. I told her this was a timeshare gift from my dad. She responded well you can get an upgrade for 150 bucks good for 4 people with kitchen and that depends if there is a room available or else you have to call RCI. At this point I was already frustrated so I told her do I have a choice? And she never responded. She finally got us a room and I paid the additional 150. When we got into the room 524C to my surprise there is only a full bed so I had my wife called Nina asking why there is only one bed. She explained the room is good for 4 people. The other 2 can sleep on the rollaway couch. My wife asked if there are other rooms available and Nina said all RCI rooms are the same. At this point we are both frustrated it's almost midnight so I told her we'll just deal with it. How can you have a room for 4 people when there's only one bed good for 2 persons? I had to sleep in a rollaway couch for 6 nights. Springs are so uncomfortable. My back hurts until now. The room itself has an adjoining door to another room and we can hear the kids in the other room. We can also hear the footsteps above our room. We saw 2 cockroaches on the outdoor stairs to the parking lot (left in the morning and when we got back in the evening it's still there) The rooms are very clean, pool is heated. Well maintained grass. It's secured and the security people always smiles everty time we get back from the parks. This could have been a very good resort except the front desk lack basic customer service. Nina I'm sorry if I gave your name but a simple "SORRY" would have been nice. Even if it's our fault for not confirming our rooms it would be nice to hear "sorry if there has been confusion" words like that makes customers feel at ease. You want to leave a lasting impression to customers and our experience talking to you wasn't pleasing at all. My comments hopefully can be taken with a grain of salt. By the way my dad called RCI and complained about our experience in Silverlake..when he reserved it he mentioned we have a kid so RCI will give us a 150 credit on our next vacation. This is my honest review of the resort and I hope yours will be a good one thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dawn27reed
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several time it is so enjoyable and relaxing. You can walk to and from your room to the pool unlike some other resorts.The pool area is nice, big and open and not crowded, The pool is heated which is a bonus. Parking is not a problem either. Only thing is that they dont have WiFi in the rooms. They have a business room which is free.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gunney8
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 bedroom condo/room in building 900. Upon entering the building we were at bit apprehsive about how the room would be. It looked rather dated with narrow hall way and sorta dark. The entry door actually opened to a foryer shared with another room. We opened our room door and was pleasently surprised at the layout of the room, and the accomodations. The furniture was better than adequate, the kitchen was well equipped, the bath was large and had the washer/dryer unit hid away in a closet-like room. It was veary clean and (considering it was Florida, not a bug to be found... wife looked closely). The ground has 3 pools (1 adult pool just outside of building 900) and a large pool area with a snake/bar area at the main pool location. Also a great fitness room and a just so-so arcade for kids (older video game machines and a couple of fun pin ball machines... remember those?). Security was not an issues as there are only 2 ways to get in and they are monitored 24/7 with gate guards. The resort was about 3-4 miles from Disney and/or Universal Studio theme parks and easy to get to. They offered discount vouchers to local golf courses and tours... We didn't take those so I cannot comment on them, but we saw many folks in the main lobby waiting for the buses. Many stores, resturants close by and grocery stores as well. For the money, this was a great stay and we will be going back again next year. Don't expect a Ritz-Carlton atmosphere, but if you're looking for a clean, safe and much better than "adequate" accomdation, it's a place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Made a silk purse from a sows ear...”
Reviews.Author: kitten50
Reviews.Content: We stay in one of the king "hotel" units in Feburary. We've stayed in time shares before but the 9000 building was the first time we encountered the two unit in one system.We shared an enterance way with the main unit that had a condo style set up..maybe one or two bedrooms. Which wasn't a problem at all but it was impossible to close the enterance door without a loud bang (Im sorry if the people next to us were bothered by this..I really tried to be quiet even if you werent) Anyway...the sows ear thing...the unit was builder grade...nothing special at all...the bathroom fan was so loud you couldn't hear yourself think.One towel bar that was to hold towels for the whole week.(4 bath 4hand 4face cloths)Cheap shower head the ones you have to move around just to get a good soaking.One very small vanity with no room on the counter.The plastic vertical blinds wouldnt darken the room and kept falling off the track,Im sure they would have come to fix them but we didnt call.The enterance to the room had an electicial box in full view..(tacky)..could have at least painted to blend in with the wall...dark green carpet that was worn with traffic..and those gawd awful mirrored closet doors that let you have a real good look at the beauty you are first thing in the morning, right beside the bed..And The oldest tv I have seen in a long time.... Now the Silk purse thing...The towels in the bathroom were thick and wonderful, they have Bath and Body Works toileties..always a plus! The king bed and duvet..well it was top of the line Loved it....Enjoyed the screened in balcony. The pools and activity areas the very well kept.The grounds were beautiful and we enjoyed walking them every morning.The staff very friendly.Restaurant was abit expensive but we didnt use it. Nicely located to everything but it was alittle hard to find...thank goodness for GPS.Meet a gentleman in the elevator that drove around for 2 hours looking for the place.He was alittle cranky.... Our unit had a bar fridge,mirco wave,dishes for two and a coffee maker..it was all we need.The little store in lobby had groceries and sundries. Would we stay again...yes!! So for what we paid it was great....

Reviews.Title: “no patio table poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: softballstay
Reviews.Content: Check in - We requested a newer unit & we were told none available. We did check in early at 2. Unit - The unit was in the 1800 building no flat screen tvs, old formica counters, small bedroom,screened in porch with 2 cheap lonely chairs & no table. We did face the pool which was nice & we could hear the entertainment. This was a 1 bedroom on the 4th floor. Pool - The pool area is nice the hot tub very large the food at the cabana is tasty & priced right. Our toilet was clogged 2 days in a row what a pain. I complained about not having a patio table that is what started the poor customer service. They were very nasty & uncaring of our wants & needs. Timeshare talk - Our salesman was very nice but we were told it would take 90 minutes it started going closer to 2 hours. We did not buy our salesman was also very surprised that the unit did not have a patio table, & he also told us that we would never have been given a newer unit because we came in under the sales program. That is a lie we were told when we booked the package. I did not like the customer service & the lies told by both sides at Silver lake management & the timeshare people who do not work together. It is possible that we were spoiled last year we stayed at Star Island Resort & it was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KathyYoung49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 days in March 2012, nice large resort. Many amenities. Drawbacks were in building 700 all balconies face the woods. Also costs $26.75 for week for internet if you bring your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 4 times and excellent!”
Reviews.Author: fireguy9
Reviews.Content: This trip my son and I booked a 1 bdrm unit and they put us in a 2 bdrm suite ground floor condo unit. It was a handicapped equip unit. Only thing different was the counters were lower, and wider doorways and one bathroom was full wheelchair accessible directly into shower. We had two full baths and king beds in each room with flat scrn tvs. Flat scrn tv in spacious living room/dining. Kitchen was large with mose utensils you need for your stay and cooking meals. Laundry was a stackable unit in kitchen closet. Pool was warm and large. A smaller pool was across from our building but we always went to the larger pool which also had a hot tub, and bar. Internet wifi for our room was a extra $25 for the week. Great condo for families going to disney or whatever your doing. Our trip was strictly golf and some pool time. Will stay again and actually came back 3 months later with my brother and his family in dec 2011 for a week which will review as well. pics to follow. Any questions ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Disney with family”
Reviews.Author: G B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silver Lake the week of March 4th. We stayed in the 1800 building that had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a pull-out couch that was perfect for us with our two boys and my in-laws. Our unit wasn't "renovated" but was clean, had a washer/dryer and was close to the pools, game room, and activities at the pool which was perfect for the kids. We took the back way to Animal Kingdom and also close to grocery stores and restaurants. We participated in some of the activities including ice cream at 2pm. bingo, and karaoke at the pool Friday night. We loved the location and the reasonable cost booked through Veterans Holiday. My in-laws attended the sales presentation and found it interesting and not pushy. Would consider booking here again if we want to do Disney again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating & Close to Disney Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: Nicole H
Reviews.Content: My parents & my family (including ages 6 & 10) stayed in Room 224 (200 building). 2 bed, 2 Bathroom condo. Master bed had a King-sized bed - perfect for the grandparents and a huge bathroom. My family of 4 slept together in the 2nd bedroom: 2 double beds. The location of our condo was great - walking distance to the pool. Our screened in patio overlooked grass and trees. Very quiet and private. Staff was VERY accommodating. Whenever we asked for something - they were there within 30 minutes - ie: shower curtain, dishwashing detergent (we used up the initial 2 packets of detergent and needed more), towels. We went to all 4 Disney Theme Parks. What was so surprising was how close and convenient the parks were to the condo. Animal Kingdom is the closest. We timed it - it took us 3 minutes from the Animal Kingdom parking lot to our condo. Magic Kingdom is probably the furthest - but it only took us about 10 minutes. The Hotel staff will give you directions for the shortcut to the theme parks. We rented a van - which is a must. Super Target is within 10 minutes of the condo if you plan to make your own meals. I have to admit...I read the reviews before booking the place and I was a little concerned by some of the poor reviews. I called a week in advance to request a specific building to stay in. They said they could not guarantee it - but it certainly help. I feel we were in one of the best buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Keep up with the times!!”
Reviews.Author: Guycroteau
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this resort in February 2012. The room was great... huge two-bedroom with a screened porch. The pool area was large and well maintained. What surprised me was that I had to pay almost $27.00 to get access to WIFI from my room from one device. There was also another charge of $5.00 for each additional device. I can FREE WIFI at MacDonald's and other places. This is supposed to be a Silver Star Resort in RCI, but I wonder if the rating should not be reviewed. Get with it Silver Lake, keep up with the times!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: jessiebc
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort, stayed 2 weeks in a one bedroom(full) it had everything you need. Very clean. The resort is kept very clean. The grounds are very nice. Pools are heated and very clean. I would have rated it a five, but the internet is awful. It works about 50\% of the time and the other 50|% is slow. It is expensive $26.75 per week considering the quality.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort but poor location”
Reviews.Author: Sarajevo1984
Reviews.Content: Resort is quite ok, but the terrible location in relation to all but the Walt Disney World, do not come without a car or be prepared to pay a taxi a lot. Resort has no transportation to theme parks or the airport as it is for me a great disadvantage compared to other resorts in Orlando who offer their guests shuttle transportation. The rooms are ok (except my room was located right next to the lake so every morning a variety of ducks and birds woke me up at 6 or 7am), as well as other facilities that the resort offers...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: petcat47
Reviews.Content: I love Silver Lake Resort!! Great location, clean, huge pool! This was our 4th visit to the resort and I will definitley go back! There is small movie theater that seats around 100 people, they have movies for children at 5PM and families at 7PM. Every day they have an ice cream social ($3.00) Every Friday they have hot dogs/chips for $1.00!! The staff is wonderful, (Especially Front Desk: Nina and Alex ) always ready to help with any kind of problem! The one bedrooms are spacious with a full kitchen, washer/dryer too!! The two bedrooms are big with two bathrooms. Great location, plenty of parking spaces. You won't go wrong staying at Silver Lake!!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat deceived”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: We bought a 2 bedroom last july.Beautiful resort. Gorgeous rooms. We were told we could stay there for a week by not using any points and "buying" our week for a $250.00 fee plus other small incidentals directly to the resort, not through RCI. That is a complete lie. The points that came with the purchase is not even close to the amount needed to stay there. Now we pay a yearly maintenace fee for a place we can't go to. We really felt lied to and wish we would have purchased somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “location location and ahhh pool”
Reviews.Author: maddogcrabs
Reviews.Content: We stay thru RCI in oct.This is our 8th trip to florida and we have stayed in many different resort. This resort by far is the closest to the parks using the back road takes you 2 min to animals kingdom parking lot no kidding.a lot of choices for family dining around the resort . The room was a 1 bedroom but sleep 6 huge 2 pull out queens size and a king bed in bedroom 2 bathrooms not spectacular but clean and well serviced had washer dryer in unit and normal size kitchen. The pool area was great our girls 13-14 loved to come back each night for a swim and hot tub. they had kareokee at the pool side bar but none of us are big singers but had fun listening to the songs anyway.Have an onsite store fully stocked even had fresh baking wach day although we went to grocery store down the street for most things.Was clean and well maintained we would stay here again so convient

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice resort”
Reviews.Author: joe_b_88
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with fiends in February 2012 for 1 week through RCI. The resort was clean and the staff was friendly. The location was centrally located for the Disney attractions. Our unit was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath luxury suite (unit 134). The unit was comfortable though dated (old TVs). The pools at the resort were excellent. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is that our 3rd floor unit did not have an elevator and I had tons of luggage. I suggest staying there and requesting a ground level unit. Not sure if the other buildings had elevators.

Reviews.Title: “jennor12”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three weeks at the resort. Our one bed apartment was comfortable and spacious with a full kitchen, large washer and dryer and a jacuzzi bath that proved to be excellent for our aged aches and pains! The staff were friendly and efficient, any problems were dealt with speedily. The whole resort was kept very clean and the pool areas were never crowded and the water warm. The apartment was cleaned weekly and all paper towels, coffee, soaps etc. replenished whether we had used them all or not. WiFi cost $26.50 a week but proved very useful to find local amenities. Very close to Disney World and the GPS we brought from the UK proved invaluable. We are members of RCI but were subjected to no sales hassle. There appeared to be a good programme of activities for children. One tip, if you travelled with Virgin, you can check in your luggage and get your boarding cards in Downtown Disney, West Side, next to the Cirque du Soleil building on your last morning. Didn't want to come home, especially to temperatures of -10C!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Relaxing, Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: I totally recommend this. Its right next to many attractions including DISNEY AND UNIVERSAL. The 3 pools are amazing and fun, and my sister and I had a blast. Great customer service, VERY clean rooms, great shower. Its also very close to an amazing mini golf place, AND the golden coral. A++++ Tons of activities including; Ice Cream Day, Root Bear Float night, etc. Late at night when you're in the pool, you can see the lights in the sky from Universal. SO COOL!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed as a guest of a time share holder, won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Gunner0812
Reviews.Content: As they are in the business of impressing people with the property to encourage the sale of time shares, in my case they failed. I only stayed overnight, and only experienced one of the small hotel-style rooms, but since first impressions are always critical, I will most likely not be back. The check-in process was relatively smooth and the young ladies at the front counter were very pleasant and friendly. The first two things that annoyed me for a resort of this alleged caliber was an additional mandatory $16 housekeeping fee and WiFi you had to pay for ($10/night or $40 a week, with limited devices allowed to connect - are you kidding me? There are $40/night motels that offer free, unlimited WiFi). The young lady apparently detected my displeasure at this revelation and since I was only staying overnight and had one laptop, gave me the access codes gratis. We were then directed to another desk to get our parking passes and directions to the building. On the plus side, there was no attempt or mention of a timeshare pitch, probably since we were guests of a club member. Oddly enough, when I asked this young lady where was a good place to eat, she directed us out into town, never mentioning the very nice bar/grill right there on the property, poolside! Although it was a bit pricy (as to be expected) the food was very good and the service was quick and very pleasant. The pool complex was very impressive and was probably the nicest part of the whole resort (there was also a theater, game room, golfing simulator, and other value added features, but I didn’t try any of them). There were 3 of us traveling together so at booking time (on the website) we had requested one room with two doubles and one with a queen. It wasn't until we dragged all our stuff up to the rooms (on the 5th floor of the 7000 building - at least they had 3 elevators) that we discovered A) there was only one queen bed in the rooms and B) the key for the other room did not work. Thinking there was a mistake, we hauled everything back down to the car and went back to the front desk. This is when we were introduced to a young man who appeared to be some sort of shift supervisor. The shortness of his temper appeared to match his stature, as the young ladies were all taller then he was. His attitude quickly grated on me, as he explained that our request for double beds at booking meant nothing, and there were no such rooms available, but that we could upgrade to a suite for $400+ dollars a night. Looking at the other reviews, do you see a recurring bait-and-switch to a more costly room thing appearing here? We finally decided to book a 3rd single room and they recoded the key for the ones that did not work. These new keys also did not work, so we had to make a 3rd trip to the front desk. Finally in our very small rooms, the first thing that struck me was the beat up furniture (the night stands had chunks of lamination missing off the top), the tiny TVs (I think my laptop screen was almost as big), and the over all cheap look of the cabinetry. There was a microwave, a mini-fridge (empty), and an odd assortment of dishes and cups, yet no coffee maker or ice bucket. The only apparent ice machine was on the ground floor outside, near the pool, and I had to use a soup bowl to take some back to the room. The WiFi login/password given to me at check-in did not work so I decided to call the front desk. There was nothing resembling a facilities phone book to be found so I took a chance and dialed 0. Good guess, as the altitudinally and attitudinally challenged young man answered. After explaining my troubles, I was put on hold for a few seconds and when he returned, I was given a new login and password. On a whim, I tried the old login name and the new password and viola, they worked. Signal was weak and not very fast, but it was enough to check email, Facebook, etc. Overall the room was clean, the bathroom was large and well provided (although the only horizontal shelf in the tub was barely big enough to hold the complimentary bar of soap – I paid a $16 extra housekeeping fee so yes, I used the complimentary toiletries). The bed was firm, clean and comfortable. On the very small balcony was two chairs and a small table, perfect for a couple to relax (although on the backside of the building the only view consisted of the parking lot and undeveloped scrub land – sort of fitting for my visit up to that point). The guard at the front gate provides a increased feeling of security, like a gated community (the one on duty when we arrived had a heavy Scottish accent and was very pleasant) First impression summary for the “single bed, hotel-style rooms” and short term exposure to the facilities: Great potential, less than adequate execution, lack of attention to detail. And give that shift supervisor an attitude adjustment or reassign him to a position that doesn’t involve guest interaction. I won’t be back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome until the 2 roaches.....”
Reviews.Author: Beerpolice17
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice place, we stayed Monday through Friday in January. Everything was great until we found a roach in the bathroom, we tried to look past that and blow it off. Then the next day we found another one in the living room, totally ruined my experience there. We were scared that we might have gotten roaches into our stuff, so we had to go through all of our clothes and suitcases and just HOPED we weren't taking none of them nasty roaches home with us. Its abhorrible feeling having to go through each and every item of clothing and belongings to look for roaches or worst some type of roach egg! Needless to say we will NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Way better places to stay in Disney area!”
Reviews.Author: kelnron05
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying we have been to Disney 10 times in the last 7 years. I have stayed at the following timeshare properties: Vistana, Westgate, Orange Lake, Mystic Dunes & now Silver Lake so I know what I am talking about! :o) I will start w/ customer service! As potential owners (and Silver Lake must know that every single guest walking through the door is a potential owner!). We completed check in for our 2 bedroom room and were sent to get a time for our 90 min. timeshare presentation at 5:02pm. As we approached a women starts literally flipping out saying "I close at 5pm, I close at 5pm ... " "I can't help you, I close at 5pm" she then angry tells the people at the front desk she can't help us. Again "it's 5pm, I close at 5pm" OKAY we get it you close at 5pm! To us it's no big deal and we can come back but really you have to throw a fit and that is our 1st impression of Silver Lake. We are excited to be there after a long day of traveling. We get to our room. We are a family of 6 ... mom, dad & 4 children ages 2-14. According to the Silver Lake website and to our booking agent we booked a 2 bedroom ... one King bed in master bedroom and 2 double beds in 2nd bedroom which is standard in almost all timeshare resorts!!! Well we get 1 king bed and 1 queen bed (+ sleeper sofa) well that isn't going to work for us! My 13 year old son & 14 year old daughter are not going to share a bed! The other two are little girls and are fine in one bed. So we call down and this is where it gets horrible! Get the run around w/ the girl at the front desk. If we want two beds in the 2nd bedroom then we have to pay $175 for the other bed! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!? Searched high and low and nothing on their website says such a thing! She promises a manager will call us back. 45 min. later we get a call from a very cocky male manager. After arguing with us says that our 6 person that fits in the room like the website states says that we can upgrade to an 8 person room for the $175 more. 0_0 Then says and I quote "you didn't find the need to call back and verify your reservation and the bed situation" Ummmm no. We vacation all the time and never once have called back the hotel, after they stated we would have two beds in 2nd bedroom, to verify that fact. I mean who would? They had no 2 beds available (so they say) and we could call back the next day. We decided at this point we would not change rooms. We needed to grocery shop that evening and repacking it all and moving was more then a hassle at this point. So our vacation started off bad. :( The 3 girls shared a bed for 7 nights! I will add that another manager did call us a few days later to apologize for our problems we encountered. Of course b/c of this we in no way intended to buy with this company! We did do the timeshare and our representive said this manager was in trouble for the way he treated several guests! The tour was 90 min. as promised and they did not hastle us in any way to purchase. As for the room .... it was nice and clean. We were in the 1000 building. Things I did not care for that may or may not influence you: no counter space in kitchen. We stored most dry goods in microwave. My biggest peave is there is NO table on patio! We love eating breakfast at the table on our previous visits to Disney! They have to two chairs a snack table out there. The kids like sitting out there also but with only 2 chairs you can't really do that! Bed soft enough, pillows comfortable enough. Master bathroom shower was kind of inconveniant. There was no space to put anything but a small bar of soap! I think they would be able to put one small shelf in the corner to put shampoo's etc. They do have Bath & Body Work products which was nice! Bathroom big and roomy though. Pools nice and big and warm. They have fun activities, live singers etc. A very nice ice cream bar at 2pm. We enjoyed that. The property was very small and in my opinion aimed for the older crowd. There seemed to be a lot of older couples there. The unit was nice, besides the bed situation, and we ended up having a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: LilyWhite74
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this place for a weeks stay, checked in and found out you have to pay for WiFi which is okay if it actually works, kept kicking us off all the time, had t call down and get new codes, same thing happened. Got to the room which was not very clean and in shabby condition, called front desk tontell them and the offered not to have the room cleaned oh no, I could move to another room for a 150 dollars more. I said no want the room to be clean and in good condition, no furniture all scuffed up, ceiling tiles falling down in closet and bathtub to be usable, he puts me on hold for 20 minutes and does not come back. Next day customer service calls to see how we are enjoying our stay so I tell them what happenedvthe said give they a few minutes and they would speak to the manager and call me right back, needless to say I never heard from them again, cleaned the room myself and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Caskar
Reviews.Content: Check in was not long. The thing that was different was after I checked in at the front desk, I was sent to another desk in the lobby to pick up my room keys. I thought that this was when I was going to get the timeshare talk. But what happened was I was given my room key and shown on a map how to get to my room. The lady asked me if this was my first time staying here and asked me if I had any questions. That was it. I kept waiting to tell her politely I was not interested in listening to a timeshare pitch but nothing was ever mentioned. 3 days later I had a message on my room phone. I thought here it is the timeshare pitch. No, it was a message telling me that housekeeping would be around to exchange my towels the next day. The 2 bedroom unit was spacious and clean. All the staff I had contact with were polite. The only complaint I had with the resort was the noise from the unit above was noticeable during the evening. It bothered me a little but didn't continue too long. The other was that TVs didn't have hd cable feed. For a nice resort, this really bothered me. The TVs reception even had shadows so it wasn't enjoyable to watch. Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom are 15 minute drives. Epcot 10 minutes and Hollywood Studios less than that. Animal Kingdom is less than 5 minutes! Easy to get to the parks and back to resort using the back entrance. Never had to use I-4.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice with Sour Notes”
Reviews.Author: LarryLorenzo
Reviews.Content: Had large 1 bedroom, 2 bath condo, Very nice layout and furnishings. The onsite, 2 movie a day (4pm,7pm) theater was a plus. Well located on ,commercial westerly end of hwy 192 near hwy27 (on which there is there is a wal-mart, lowes, & library) and next door to Disney. Sour notes: Local calls 50 cents, WIFI $40 week (in a world where many cheap hotels have it free), free activity center has only 2 internet stations, no telephone directory, frying pan not stick proof so bring your teflon one. Free welcome onsite breakfast was really sad and turned out to be timeshare introduction. However, not high pressure and got good ticket discounts after saying "no thanks" for ONLY an hour. Stayed following week at Wyndam Cypress Palms up the road on 192 and liked it better (free WIFI and local calls) even though unit was smaller 1bed/1bath.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: darcibuoy
Reviews.Content: Probably won't check you in until 4pm but efficient & friendly. Timeshare desk was quick if you're adamant about not being interested in the talk...our name taken off list & not contacted all week. Two bedroom was spacious, clean and comfortable, hugs full kitchen, washer/dryer, jacuzzi, patio and mirrors everywhere. Maintenance quick, friendly, efficient when called re air conditioner not working and trouble unlocking in-room safe. Fee for wi-fi in unit however, included in activity card ($27.95). Clubhouse has 2 free computers/free photocopies and if you have ethernet plug you can use their plugs for free. Well equipped fitness centre, movie nights, games room $, very large main pool/hot tub + 2 others. 12 buildings scattered throughout property with most being 3 story and no elevators. Located just off Irlo Bronson/192 where you will find everything you need. Theme parks are short drive away and for $15. shuttle will pick you up at resort. Cheaper to drive if you don't mind traffic and parking fee of approx. $15. Would definitely return to Silver Lake and only complaint was noisy, inconsiderate guests..pick up the chairs rather than scraping along floor. Stayed Dec. 10-17, 2011

Reviews.Title: “Returned after a few years to discover - no change”
Reviews.Author: EricToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here several years ago over a long weekend. This was our first return to Silver Lake and were surprised when the room we were staying in, hadn't changed. But lets start at the beginning. Check-in was a very lengthy process. As part of a timeshare sales pitch, you first have to sign in with the RCI sales people. Then with the front desk. Took a good 20 plus minutes to get through it all and I was the only one there. We had requested a crib in advance. Called a few days before to confirm. And arrived to our room with no crib. Called down to dispatch who sent security. They couldn't help and contacted housekeeping. After 20 minutes, called the front desk again. And then waited another 20 minutes. Called the front desk again before finally getting someone. The gentleman who came to set up the crib was very polite. But he brought the wrong frame. Needless to say, after several attempts and trips back to housekeeping, almost an hour and a half after check-in, we had a crib. The room, as I said, was dated. Apparently, some have been upgraded, but not the one they gave us. Funny that they want to make a sale and they don't put their best foot forward. Spacious main room, with decent size and equiped kitchen. TV could use an upgrade, especially the second one in the bedroom. The bedroom has very little room left since the bed takes up most of the space. Had trouble fitting the crib in and took out some of the furniture from the room. The bed was comfy but we slept on the pull-out couch so my son could sleep in the bedroom. Very old couch and not comfortable at all as a sleeper. Bathroom was nice but also dated. The jacuzzi jets needed some cleaning and they had done some damage control to the jets. The shower head was at about 5'8" level so I had to duck down just to wash my hair (I'm only 5'10"). The pool area is nice and somewhat heated. The Europeans and British guests seemed to enjoy the water. It was a little cold for us Canucks. We had a room facing the pool and it could get a little noisy at times. They run some activities like a Caribbean resort, even in the evening. Not so good with a little one that goes to bed by 7:30. But it didn't seem to bother him. Carpet in the hallway was nasty and needs to be redone. We were in 1800 building, which is older, and could use a lot of work. The timeshare pitch was horrible. They hadn't even changed their pitch from the previous visit. Even with my 1 year old being cranky, they "had" to keep us the full 90 minutes. The salesperson had the nerve to tell us, "don't do a timeshare again if you have no intention of buying". I wasn't the one offering the promotion. I understand you work off commision but if I'm wasting your time, give me the tickets I was offered and send me on my way. She said she closes 30-40% of her pitches. I don't see how. The resort is located near Animal Kingdom and is great if you are going to Disney. At Xmas however, traffic is horrible in Orlando. Going anywhere else, especially to the other side of the city where Mall at Millenia or The Florida Mall are, is atrocious. If you are already a timeshare holder, this is a decent place for you to stay. It has its issues but you've already paid to stay here in some form. If you are not locked in, there are better and just as affordable options.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with your family.”
Reviews.Author: REMJR
Reviews.Content: With pools, tennis, basketball, arcade, and kids activities, it sure made for a fun and relaxing break from the theme parks. The 2 headroom units provided a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “$27 for internet usage”
Reviews.Author: boru27
Reviews.Content: C'mon. $27 minimum to allow one single device in your unit to access the internet up to a week is pathetic. I would not stay here again just based on that.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: As I “former Owner” of Silver Lake Resort for the last 15 years, I can say that I am extremely disappointed with this resort. I can also comment without a doubt in my mind that getting involved in this resort was the worst decisions ever. It was unmistakably a bait-and-switch! This resort no only has this ruin several days in my live, but it also ruined many family vacations. In the beginning everything seems ok, ok services, ok location, but never a 5 start resort as they claim to be. In my last visit, this past December 2011, we were staying for seven days by the six days we left the resort. When we first arrived, we were excited. The website (and other travel websites) shows new furniture, elegant cabinets and granite counters in the kitchens and luxurious baths - they actually read "luxurious" on the website. Of course, why not after paying thousand and thousand of dollar in maintenance fee over the years, just to be “Owner of a 5 Star resort” and only able to use the resort about 4 times in the past 14 years, I was ready to enjoy my so call “Investment”. I could not be more wrong. The Resort looks just like always. The same furniture, the same cabinets nothing is new, like they show on the website not even the new buildings. To make matters worse! They charged for almost everything if you used more than their rationed amount of toilet tissue, paper towels etc. you will be charge. For example, .95 cents for every additional roll of toilet tissue. We were given 2 rolls for 1 week. The master bath shower door (sliding) was unclean. The cleaning items seems like they bough it from the general dollar store (everything cheap). The fact that we when to the front desk in an effort to get a simple mop to clean the floor and were told that the sponge mop for wholesale dollar store was the only thing available. Should give you an idea of how this place operate. I still have the pictures with my wife cleaning the floor with a dirty towel using her feets “old school”. What a fantastic memories for family vacations. There were no housekeeping offered, fresh/clean towels every 4 days, and not even change the dirty ones. They just enter the room put the towel on the kitchen counter; that is it. Ha! Ha! As an Owner, I get to carry out my own garbage - I might as well have stayed home with all the house work we had to do. Oh! and honestly had to pay $31.25 to use Wi-Fi for the week, even at the cheapest hotels it's free! This resort has become a huge joke. I requested a 2/2 unit that hold at least 8 persons as I am entitled to on my contract and when I arrive I was informed that I was going to get a 2/2 unit, but I was only allowed to accommodate 6. They could explain this when I made my reservation, but NO! The waited until I showed up on the front desk to tell me, even when I called a week prior to confirm my reservation. So, here I was, in the front desk force to rent an extra room in a nearby hotel to accommodate the rest of the family. You can imagine how upset (for lack of better words) I was. In top of all that, the unit was not a real 2/2, it was 2 connecting rooms. Of course, we made a complaint to the so call “manager” in the front desk, which was non-responsive and could not care less about costumer service protocol. The manager at the front desk was extremely rude, and in my opinion, she needs to rethink her occupation. They all seemed to HATE their jobs! Bottom line, Service is non-existent from the front desk, management and housekeeping. I was extremely disappointed with just about everything in this resort. If you have read the testimonials, you will notice that I am telling the truth and that not much has changed at this resort in the last 14 years. You will also, notice that the “excellent” reviews are from peoples that just visited this resort once, probably spend more than anybody else, because they did not know any better. The Silver Lake Resort in Orlando, Florida had become something more akin to a decaying Cheap Motel; and I wish I were exaggerating here, after all I am an owner, but sadly, I’m not! This resort had never been a Gold Crown Resort not even 15 years ago, now is just an hack and run-down eyesore. I am warning anyone considering doing business with in this place please, Please, PLEASE, STAY AWAY FROM THEM. After this last episode, I will never stay here again and will never recommend this as a place to stay for even my worst enemy. I would rather stay in a $30 dollar a night hotel than this JUNK of a "resort" again. DON'T LET IT HAPPEN TO YOU. Nothing neat I can say about this "resort".... would not recommend to anyone. I 100% sure that the real owners had no sympathy for what they did to us, just like I have no remorse for writing this review.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Treker650
Reviews.Content: Everything was fabulous. Service, rooms, pool, activities!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: loves2gamblenj
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Very close to restaurants. Best if you rent/have a car to get around. Close to Disney Parks. Wi-Fi available for $26/week or $10/day. If staying 3 or more days, your best deal is to buy the $26 weekly package. Very nice pools.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Very clean and comfortable for our family!”
Reviews.Author: MyRally123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting the Disney parks and thought that it had a great, laid-back, family feel. Our rooms were very clean, modern and spacious. We had a one bedroom, but there was ample space for my husband and I and our 3 and 4 year olds (they slept on the sleeper sofa). I would definitely recommend this resort to friends. It's a stone's throw from restaurants, stores, and the theme parks. The staff is friendly. We attended the timeshare presentation and felt no pressure to buy. Silver Lake also had several pools, a hot tub, tiki bar restaurant and gift shop. It was a lovely place, and we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - better than our own home!”
Reviews.Author: Gizelle_Paiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week and we simply loved it! The Resort is not exactly well located (it wasn't so easy to find it the first time we arrived there (even using a GPS), but it doesn't really matter at all, as everybody drives car in Orlando. Well, since the beggining, we could see that we would have a pleasant time. The resort has a huge area with pools, apartments and gardens. Our apartment was nothing else but perfect. Large, clean, comfortable. There were two great bedrooms, two bathrooms (both with tub and one of them with whirlpool), a kitchenette, a nice living room and two balconies. The pool area was very clean and nice to relax in (it wasn't crowded). They offer pool towels, which is very good. They also offer buses going and coming from Disney theme parks (with the payment of a tax) and they sell tickets at discount prices!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Phil N
Reviews.Content: My adult family of four stayed the first week of Dec 2011 and found the service to be excellent and accomodations to be very roomie and nice too. We stayed in Building 600 which was completed renovated. I want to recognize Denise Rivas at the front desk for her attention to details and customer service. My only OFI (Opportunity For Improvement) would be to update the security cards/locks for the rooms. It took us 3 trips and multi cards and a security person to finally get in our room. We did finally get the hang of how to swipe the cards to get them to work. Denise informed us that the Mgmt Company is looking to replace the cards key system. We are timeshare owners and traded to get in... Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Britt_10
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacy flats, with everything you need for cooking, nice big heated pool, lot to do just a few minutes away, need a car

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to stay in the whole world”
Reviews.Author: m k
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at this resort for my birthday/anniversary. Upon arriving we thought WOW this is going to be great, but all that soon changed. When ever the words "Time Share" are written in your reservation..run!! We never really had a problem with the room it was the staff. We were called "liars" to our face because we didn't want to disclose our annual income. Also because of this we did not qualify for the tour therefore we could not stay at the resort unless we wanted to pay $395 a night. We had everything unpacked and we were all settled in our room when they proceed to tell us we either had to pay to stay or leave. Not only did this ruin our day but it ruined our vacation. We spent a whole day trying to find a new place to stay and repacking and unpacking. I will never ever stay here again and will never ever recommend this as a place to stay for even my worst enemy. They had no sympathy for what they did to us and I have no remorse for writing this review. Let the truth be known that "You get what you pay for"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week Spent Here”
Reviews.Author: kabmomma
Reviews.Content: I walked in and pretty much just said Wow upon seeing our Condo for the first time. It was wonderful! Roomy, clean, amazing. Exceeded my expectations! We were in the 500 building with a view of the fountain pond, which is low due to minimal rain, but it was nice to sit out on the screened patio and listen to the water in the morning with my coffee. Kids got a hide-a-bed in the livingroom which wasn't too comfy, but for a 4 and 1 year old it was perfectly fine! Downside of our condo-no pizza pan or pizza cutter--so hopefully we didn't leave too much of a mess in the oven! And knives worked fine for cutting! Loved the huge tub--able to soak 2 times with the wonderful jets for sore feet after walking all day. My 1 year old loved the mirrors on the doors. Very close to dining and stores like Target and Publix for supplies. We used the pool one morning. The kiddie pool was great fun and heated so the water was excellent too. I used the computer room--they have 2 computers for use just sign in and out. I waited one of the three times I used them otherwise was able to get right on. My wait was less than 10 minutes-which I took to lounge next to the pool. We used the game room once too--lots of variety. Would have attended one of the movies, but the ones geared toward our kids were on during dinner time or we hadn't returned from Disney yet. Speaking of Disney-seriously less than 5 minutes to Animal Kingdom and for December it was less than 20 minutes to even Magic Kingdom! Staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. Small store at the resort was well stocked with items we needed and prices were comparable for the Souvenir items to other places (cheaper than the airport). We sometimes could hear a chair move or noise from a TV as we were falling asleep, but I am sure people could also hear our children scream at bedtime too. (sorry if you were there and next door for one of those nights!) Overall we couldn't have picked a better location for our First Family Vacation. We we would for sure return here!! Ps-I have photos to share-but will at a later date)

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: padres888
Reviews.Content: Hello'' We have been staying at Silver lake Resort for more than 8 years in the winter.. We have stayed in many of the buildings and each one is as nice as the other,.....Yes, they are renovating some of the units so to keep up with the times..... II think it is the BEST resort near Disney, The place is clean,nice pools, nice rooms... Would reccommend this resort highly to anyone who would like a nice vacation in the Disney Orlando Area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Derek7373
Reviews.Content: Got away to Orlando for a week of Mickey & the gang. Stayed at Silver Lake & was thoroughly impressed! Big rooms! Great pool! Friendly staff! Our kids had a blast at the pool during downtimes, We had amenities very close by like shopping, groceries, restaurants and theme parks. We lacked nothing! If you need a place & you don't want to give Disney any more of your money that you have to, stay at a place that has everything you could possibly need, Silver Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice -YOU WILL LIKE IT !”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine123WWJD
Reviews.Content: It's all the positive things said ! Very Nice, clean, friendly...and the sales pitch was NOT a hard sell push...We survived it easily and the day was not wasted !

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: auntykaz
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in the 300 building, we had large apartment and the adjoining flat as we were a party of 6. There was loads of room and the jacuzzi in the bedroom was brilliant. The beds, although high, were really soft and comfortable. A full kitchen including dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer topped it nicely. The staff were really helpful and maintenance came immediately when we had a problem with one of the toilets. The onsite shop is very good, open long hours and well stocked with almost everything. The pool is very large and very clean. The only complaint I could have about the resort is the lack of entertainment and restaurant, although the poolside bar is open late and does a range of food. The resort is perfectly placed for all the Disney parks, Universal Studios, Sea World and Aquatica. A great place for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - affordable, comfortable, looks as in photos”
Reviews.Author: Sheri R
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a one-bedroom unit in the Silver Lake Resort in late October 2011. After reviewing all the bad experiences of others staying in the so-called "resorts" in the Disney area, I was a bit nervous about staying in one. The Silver Lake Resort turned out to be wonderful. Firstly, the traveler photos posted on TripAdvisor are accurate. I didn't take any (sorry!) but if you look for the photos from user namer "godzpeach", our unit looked identical to this. It was in building 900, one of the newly renovated units. (Thanks to the reviewer who had suggested to call in advance to request a newly renovated unit -- I did, and they gave us one. It was great!) Our one bedroom consisted of a bedroom with king size bed and flat screen TV; a large bathroom with shower and tub, and a washer and dryer; a full kitchen kitted out with all the basic cooking supplies (pots, pans, cooking utensils, flatware for eating, plates, coffee maker and some very mediocre coffee (but no tea!), paper towels, garbage bags, dishwashing detergent, etc); and a living room/dining room area with comfortable sofas and another flat screen TV. The apartment was clean and very comfortable. The Resort asked us only twice if we wanted to participate in their sales pitch, which seems to be a relatively low number of requests as compared to other Resorts in the area (according to Trip Advisor reviews I read). Both times we were asked, a polite "no thanks" from us was graciously accepted and respected. This Resort is very close to Disney properties and is about 10-15 minute drive to I-4 and International Drive. So if you want to be in the thick of the activities, restaurants, etc that is International Drive, this may not be the place for you. For me, as a native Floridian, staying 15 minutes away from that area is perfect. Silver Lake Resort is near the Disney properties and is 2 minutes from a supermarket and several good restaurants. The other thing I really liked about this place -- besides being great value for money (was cheaper than most hotels!) -- is that there were no hidden fees as there were in nearly all other resorts in the area. (Read the fine print closely on all the booking advertisements!!) Wi-Fi was $10 for first day, then $5 per day after, but only for one device (i.e. laptop). You have to pay again for a second laptop. But this was not a big deal to me. If you are looking for a relaxing, clean, and affordable place to call home for a few days in the Kissimmee area, you should come to the Silver Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Formyjoy
Reviews.Content: This resort is very close to Disney and all the new restaurants along 192. We were less than 5 minutes from Animal Kingdom. This is such a family friendly resort, the activities were fun and the activities staff were very nice. The room we were in has not be refurburshed and it was old, the furniture was beat up and the formica countertops had been painted but it was clean and it was so convenient. We were on the ground floor, just across the street from the pool. We could walk right out our door and into our car, no waiting for an elevator or walking to a parking deck. The beds slept great and it was quiet by 11:00 every night. The only drawback is that darned fee for internet, these places need to quit trying to make a buck off of us and just do what the rest of the world already does, give us free wireless. The fee for the week was 27.00 so it's not as bad as some. If it were not for the old room and the fee for wireless I would have gladly given this place excellent. And some of the rooms have been remodeled but we had a recovering knee surgery so we needed to be close to everything. So just ask for a newer room. Elden at the front desk was amazing to work with and they even gave us a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: alohatravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a resort very close to the Disney Attractions as well as restaurants and shopping. The suites are clean and well maintained. The suites all had full sized kitchens which were a bonus. We were in town for an athletic tournament and used the kitchen to store our supplies. The beds were comfortable and the resort was quiet and peaceful. The pools were beautiful and there were lots of chairs for everyone in our party. Only small issue was the smell in the elevator was pretty bad. We thought it may be from the trash chute next to the elevator. Other than that the trip was absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families! We will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: reyes4818
Reviews.Content: I heard a LOT of great reviews (and a few bad ones) and I was optimistically cautious about staying here for an entire week with my family. Well, WE LOVED IT and let me tell you, the staff went out of their way at ANY request I had, to make us feel at home and welcome! I must say that a smile and a friendly tone goes a long way with people! We had a one bedroom unit in the 500 section that slept 6. It was WAY roomy, nicely decorated, and filled with everything I needed for the week! The screened patio was a VERY nice touch for evening drinks with my hubby while the kids watched movies. The Bath and Body Works products were also a nice touch! I was cautioned not to keep my room keys next to cell phones or credit cards or they could get deactivated so I was careful, and they all worked just fine the entire time! The bed was extra comfy and the sofa sleepers were just fine for my kids (no complaints!). The kitchen was immaculate and had every cooking utensil I could have ever needed! I was offered a presentation once upon check in (we declined), but was never bugged about it again! The front desk staff (Tara checked us in :)) was exceptionally nice and even helped me print boarding passes for our return home. There was live music on a few nights which was nice when hanging out at the pool. My kids did not participate in the activities because we were busy most days. I didn't mind the pool towel card, because clearly it has been an issue of people stealing them in the past (why???? no clue!). It just made me aware of turning them in instead of just leaving them all over. I already was prepared for the WIFI fee, so it didn't bug me, and not being a slave to my computer was welcome since we WERE on vacation after all, plus I could use my smart phone whenever I wanted to! The resort was close (10-20 min. drive) to grocery shopping, restaurants, downtown Orlando, and every sightseeing place you wanted! I loved the security there and felt very safe. The pools were very clean, and the playground was very much enjoyed by my 4 year old! We can't WAIT to return and my little guy cried when we had to check out! I would recommend this resort to everyone looking for a nice place to stay for a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property but felt nickel-and-dimed”
Reviews.Author: nc6
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a LOT of RCI points for this resort and got a 3bedroom unit, which is really a 2BR+1BR lockout for 4 nights in October. This is more points than I'd typically pay for a week for a 2BR at most resorts. I assume their $ pricing is similarly on the high end for condos in Orlando, which tend to be cheap and plentiful, especially in low season. The 1BR unit has a small LR with sofabed and a BR with king bed, and a small kitchen +w/d. The 2BR unit has 2 BR each with 1 King bed, 2 baths, and a mid sized LR with sofabed and a larger kitchen +w/d. We thought we'd have more people coming - with the sofabeds this place can hold up to 10 - so we have plenty o room with the 5 people that we brought. The unit is furnished nicely and the countertops are all granite. Beds are comfortable and there are tvs in all the bedrooms + LRs. The 2BR unit also has a DVD player. The units have a locking outerdoor that goes to a tiny foyer with locking doors into each unit. We had to get furniture to prop the 2 inner doors open so that we could move freely back and forth across our 3BR. Each unit has a small screened porch with 2 chairs, and really no more room than that. We were very pleased with the unit once we got our doors propped open. The units come with the standard accessory pack for a condo of coffee packets, a couple diswashing detergents, and such. They have upscale soap/shampoo/lotion/conditioner from bath&body works. There are no coffee filters, so if you want to brew something besides their maxwell house packets, bring them. Check-in was not a problem. We were offered a sales tour ($80 cash or similar value to various venues), but declined. They seem to have a very large condo sales operation going on with a HUGE room dedicated to this activity and a side room for kids, plus golf carts going to and fro. We were glad they let us through with minimum hassle on the check-in and no follow-up phone calls. There are 3 pools - the main one is awesome and has a little snack shop there. The pool seemed to be very highly chlorinated. My husband suffered with eye drops the whole evening after we went there and he said the chemicals were off. There is an arcade with video games, pool tables, etc. My only complaint here is that I felt nickel and dimed. After exchanging for so many points, I was surprised at how many other things they try to get money out of you for. There was an extra "cleaning fee" of something like $75, and we had to pay $27 or so for getting wifi access the 4 days. (and even then, it only worked on 1 device). We asked at the activities center to use a volleyball for the pool, but they required $5 cash deposit and would not take the hotel card for that - we had not brought cash over to the pool so the kids couldn't play. Even little things like popcorn with the movie were for extra charges, the video game room required 2 25c tokens for each game - nothing is included. They bring out big buckets of cheap ice cream by the pool and charge kids $3 to get some. Others have mentioned the towel card - you exchange the card for the number of towels your room sleeps, and then exchange the towels back for the card. If you are unfortunate enough to misplace either the card or any of the towels, the charge is $20 per towel or $20xoccupancy for the card. These pool towels are nothing special and would not cost $20 new, and this is just another example of giving you some stress or hassle where you don't need it. I just felt that all these extra charges were unnecessary and a hassle when they are already a high charging resort. I'm still giving it 4 stars because the units and pools are really nice. I wish I could have given it 3 1/2 however, because I think they could go further to make us feel welcome and not treat us like towel-stealing deadbeats at this high end resort.

Reviews.Title: “A few flaws, but not bad overall”
Reviews.Author: seeking_seashells
Reviews.Content: I chose this resort because we were traveling as two couples and each wanted their own bedroom with a minimum queen size bed. You would be surprised how many Orlando condos have twin beds in the second bedroom to accommodate families. We arrived at midnight from Seattle and the front desk was very cheerful and attentive at check in. We went up to our unit and after the first three key cards failed, the fourth finally worked – not a good start. We stayed in the 1000 building on the top floor. The condo was spacious with modern finishes and furniture (mostly – but old box TV sets in the bedrooms). The living area was in the center, with a bedroom/bath suite on either side providing privacy to both couples. Kitchen was furnished with essential dishes but as I started to cook more and more I wished I had brought some spices. We had a small screened in balcony overlooking the “Lake” which is actually more like a swamp, but at least it isn’t a parking lot. Both couples agreed the beds were super comfy. Good air conditioning kept us comfortable, especially when temps outside were in the 90’s. We continued to have problems with our keycards. After 3 complete replacements in 24 hours someone from security took pity on us and issued us “special” keycards that worked about 75% of the time. At one point the front desk told us to keep our keycards above 70 degrees in order to keep them working. What a joke in air-conditioned Orlando! I don’t know why management doesn’t just step up and replace the door locks. We used two pools at the resort and enjoyed both. The pool next to our building was ‘self-serve’ with towels and fairly quiet. We went to the main pool and enjoyed drinks from the bar and canned music. Watch out for the bar – we ordered Happy Hour drinks and were charged full price until my husband pointed out that their clocks were set 10 minutes slow. One couple ordered food and said it was just okay. The towel card others have mentioned is annoying – puts a little damper on your day for sure. We were asked twice to participate in a time share presentation. The first was when we were issued our parking passes, which I declined. The second was during a phone call to check up on our stay. By then two of our three phones weren’t working and the hallway leading to our unit hadn’t been vacuumed in four days…on top of the keycard drama. I declined and explained that I wasn’t interested in purchasing a property that had these maintenance problems. I wasn’t asked again. Our condo had a lock-out unit which meant that the door from the hallway entered a very small box with two doors – one to our unit and one to a separate unit. There were guests staying in the lock-out two nights of our visit. They had problems with their keycards (no surprise) and they spent a lot of time outside of our door trying to figure it out. It was very loud. I’m not a fan of the lock-out format. The best part about this resort was the location. We were minutes from Disney parks using the back gate which links directly to Disney roads. You need a car here – it isn’t safe to walk to the nearby stores and restaurants. Go out the front gate, turn right, then turn right again on 92 and drive about a mile to get to a large Publix grocery store, Super Target and yummy restaurants like Bahama Breeze. Bottom line - I would stay here again, especially as the price for a two bedroom condo was cheaper than one night at a Disney resort traditional room. We didn't miss not having maid service. But I would demand keycard issues be resolved immediately.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: kkatula
Reviews.Content: Great location, Close to all attractions, pools are awesome, three bedroom condo is roomy. Gated resort. I would like to come back yearly if possible. Great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price and location.”
Reviews.Author: dyej
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great stay. The rate of $340 for the week with air forces vacation club can't be beat. Location was perfect. Rooms were a little worn but spacious and clean. Did not have to sit through a time share sales pitch. For this rate would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, will return again”
Reviews.Author: chocolatestranger
Reviews.Content: we were givin the large section 3br 3ba 1900sq ft and it was great. staff took care of us. It was about 16 of us, mostly kids about 5 families. there was room for all of us. the pool was great, game room was great and if you leave out of their back gate you would be right there to connect to all disney parks. short ride, no traffic going out of the back gate.. I will be there next year. We did not have enough towels, we called they bought a hugh bag and dropped them off. There was a washer and dryer in the resort, hugh kitchen, pots pans dishes included.. the price is right..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, love to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna2226
Reviews.Content: Really good location for all of the parks. Lovely pools and the apartments were huge and well equipped. Great for families. Lovely jacuzzi! Well recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: travellover5704
Reviews.Content: This condo was an excellent value. Our 1 bedroom/1 bath home was perfect for my 10 year old daughter and I. The jacuzzi was a nice luxury and the equipped kitchen and washer/dryer saved us LOTS of money. The security was professional and we felt very safe. I couldn't give it 5 stars because we had to rent a car to go to the parks and it cost $14 a day to park. A shuttle would make it a perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: jodyz04
Reviews.Content: Was travelling with my husband and 2 sons. We did not arrive until midnight and the security and check in staff (Stacy?) were great. Smoothly check in and we were in our one bed apartment (533) . Apartment was great. A large kingsize bed in the bedroom and two pull out sofa beds in the living room. Bathroom was spacious and the kitchen well equipped. There are a washer and dryer which is great. The screened in balcony was also very nice. Because my sons wanted their own bed, I asked the staff to get extra blanket and liners. They were very friendly and asked Security to send them over immediately. The resort is in a great location, near to restaurants, supermarkets and Disney but is till lovely and quiet at night. There was no noise from other apartments or outside. We did not get chance to swimming in the Pool. But the pool areas looks great. We declined the timeshare presentation and there was no pressure so all good there. We would defiantly return. There are extra charge for the internet access and resort restore charge. But the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: stabard
Reviews.Content: Was travelling with hubby and son and we exchanged into the resort with our RCI week. We did not arrive untill midnight and the security and check in staff where great. Painless check in and we where in our one bed apartment in no time. Apartment was great. A large kingsize bed in the bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living room. Bathroom was spacious and the kitchen well equipped. I was pleased to see a washer dryer as I hate to travel back with dirty clothes :-) The screened in balcony was also welcome for the morning coffee. The resort is in a great location, near to restuarants, supermarkets and Disney but is till lovely and quiet at night. There was no noise from other apartments or outside ( and I am a very light sleeper so this is important to me). Pool areas where great and my son soon made friends with other kids and was playing water polo every evening. Pool towels are available - just hand in the card when you take them and get it back when you return them - what is so hard about that??? Hot tub was just that - Hot! :-) There was free movies every day and a nice games room for the kids and some activities every day. We declined the timeshare presentation and there was no pressure so all good there. We would definatly return - in fact have booked it again for my sister and her family next year.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming/Unpleasant/ Nickle and dime resort/ Not staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: MRSBUTLER10
Reviews.Content: We took the great deal of 3 nights and 4 days and had to take a time share. As soon as we got to this resort we were not happy! Its in a bad location, we had to take our own trash out, no cups in the room, the towel situtation is TERRIBLE we ended up buying our own towels to use so we didnt have to worry about lossing that STUPID card and having to pay an additional $40, speaking of charging for additions. WELL to use the internet u must buy a activity card for $30 somethings dollars and the internet is EXTREMELY SLOW~ Now on to our timeshare salesmen... he got angry with my husband and i after 2 mins of talkin to us and wouldnt give us a business card, or contact number, he was rude and told us just to take this paper to the desk to get whatever it is they offered us. I would rather stay in a $30 dollar a night hotel than this JUNK of a "resort" agian! They charge u for breathing, we also had to pay an additional $30 because of some housekeeing fee or something to clean our room after we leave. The pools are also only 4 ft deep and were not heated... WE ate at the cabana grill and got SUPER SICK we just ordered a pizza and it was like rubber. I wouldnt recommend this to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Bryan L
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at Silver Lakes and had a brilliant holiday in a fantastic resort. We arrived, delayed, at 2 a.m. and were greeted by very friendly and efficient security and front desk staff. The check in process was swift and painless and we made our way to our apartment, in block 600. We opened the door and were absolutely delighted by the size, layout and decor of the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. We had used RCI points for this trip and chose Silver Lakes as our base for 2 weeks visiting the theme parks. I was little apprehensive about being asked to give up our time to attend a RCI event but I needn't have worried. We were invited to a short breakfast meeting which I declined and that was it, no pressure to attend whatsoever which makes a pleasant change. The resort has everything a family needs and one great thing is that the massive swimming pools were open until 11 p.m. each evening so it was great to spend all day trudging around a theme park and still having time to relax in the pools and (very) hot outdoor jacuzzi when we arrived "home". The staff were always friendly and our only problems were with our electronic apartment keys which failed a couple of times but each time, someone arrived to help within minutes. Housekeeping was fine and unobtrusive and everything in the apartment was new and in perfect working order. Would we go back ? ....... tomorrow if we could !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If You want a Large Condo, this is it”
Reviews.Author: Vanderneucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights. It was a large two bedroom and two bath condo unit. It had a kitchen. large living room and a washer/dryer. The master bath was large and had a nice jacuzzi bathtub. It was a great value for the $400 that we paid for the week. The resort had a large pool. activities center, free nightly movies, a cabana bar next to the pool and a small grocery store. It is located less than five minutes from Disney's Animal Kingdom Park. There was also a pullout couch for added sleeping space. If you want a large space at a good price then consider Silver Lake. This same kind of space on Disney property would cost $800 to $1000 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Silver Lake”
