Reviews.Author: traceface411
Reviews.Content: Silver Lake is a great spot, especially if you are doing a Disney-focused vacation as my family did. We stayed at Silver Lake through an RCI trade, and with a few tips, you can have a great stay there too. I did my research on Tripadvisor ahead of time and learned that some buildings were renovated and some were not. One of the few criticisms that I have of Silver Lake is that when I called a few weeks ahead of time to see if I could put a note on our reservation for one of the renovated buildings, the employee I talked told me that was not possible and I would have to ask RCI. Luckily, a few days before our scheduled visit, a very helpful employee called us to confirm our reservation and answer any questions and helped me to figure out which buildings were available for our check in day and we were able to request a renovated unit! At Silver Lake, buildings 100-600 are the originals, I believe, and have the largest units. Of those, only 300, 400 and 500 have renovated units (I think! I'm not entirely sure on 600 and 700), while anything above 700 are renovated but smaller. Our unit in the 300 building was great! Very close to the main pool, perfectly cool and shaded well from the hot Florida sun with all tile floors and granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathrooms. The main pool complex is huge and well maintained and a great place to relax after all of your crazy Disney adventures. This location is especially great if you are intending to go to Animal Kingdom as it is only a 5 minute drive at most. I loved that we were so close to all of the Disney attractions (Magic Kingdom was the farthest away, and I think it only took us 15 minutes to get there), but I also enjoyed that it was easy to do things offsite, especially grocery shopping and offsite restaurants. However, you really should have a car to stay at Silver Lake, as they don't have much in the way of transportation for non-Disney destinations, and it costs extras for the Disney shuttles they have. We didn't use them, so I really don't know all that much about the shuttle options. Overall, we had a great stay at Silver Lake and a fantastic time in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed, staff is rude & incompetent”
Reviews.Author: lydia1989
Reviews.Content: we stayed in building 18, July 24-31st and was not impressed at all. We were given this timeshare week from our boss, and we've definately stayed at better RCI resorts. There is no housekeeping offered, fresh/clean towels every 4 days, and the master bath shower doors (sliding) was dirty. Must take out your own trash.......... i might as well have stayed home with all the house work we had to do. We sigend up for a "timeshare" meeting and was told it would take exactly one hour. The sales rep was RUDE, ARROGANT, OBNOXIOUS! I'm 40 years old, and said that my daughter was 17.... he had the nerve to ask if I started having children at the age of 12.....to me that was not a compliment of how well i've aged. Tiki Bar was closed every night before 10:30pm. Our "luxury" view that we requested and was promised was of the parking lot...... and they would not change our rooms. We left an item in the room after checking out, and I have called for the last 3 days.....last night I was told by security to call today, that they hadn't picked up lost items from hosuekeeping since Satruday......... when I called today, Charles from security was rude, and wouldn't give me his name...... i had to call the operator to get his name. Management & Supervisors are only there between 9am-5pm, needless to say, regardless of the many times I called and left messages while there, they were not returned........ and i seriously doubt the message that was left tonight will be returned. Nothing nice I can say about this "resort".... would not recommend to anyone. Oh and seriously.......... had to pay $31.25 to use wi-fi for the week........... even at the cheapest hotels it's free!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: TravelMore2
Reviews.Content: This resort was perfect for our needs and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We went as part of a package that we were a little nervous about taking up (sold to us through Special-T Travel - a timeshare vacation sales/marketing promotion company). Had a fabulous 2 bedroom apartment with a well-equiped kitchen and laundry, 2 bathrooms and a large-sized living room/lounge and dining area. Small balcony as well. Air-conditioning worked well and was definitely needed in the Florida humidity and heat! No road noise and no noise from other apartments. We were on the top floor so this probably helped. Excellent pool and bar adjacent to the pool. The obligatory time-share presentation was perfectly bearable! Took the promised 90 mins and when we said we weren't in a position to purchase now they accepted this without a problem. The manager came over and double-checked that our salesperson had 'done his job' and offered us a couple of 'sweeter deals' which we also declined. This was it - we were treated well. Nice breakfast beforehand as well and if you take your kids with you they'll get fed and can then go off and swim or be entertained! Perfectly located for Disney - right on the back boundary!! Simply drive out the back driveway, turn left and you're almost there! It really is a perfect location for a family stay. We'd recommend this resort without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: CVCinVB
Reviews.Content: The unit was a 2-bedroom and huge with large living/dining room and kitchen, two baths. It was very clean and well-appointed. The people helping us with reservations couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. Outside grounds were beautiful and manicured. Pools were clean. We ate at the poolside restaurant/bar. They offered specials intermittently around the pool, like $1 hot dogs, which was great. Everyone we came in contact there was very pleasant, helpful and friendly. We stayed in the 600 building, newly rennovated and beautiful. Some buildings don't have elevators, so if steps are a problem, be sure to mention this when making your reservation. We were on the first floor, which was great. Kristi Dimaio was a wonderful help in seeing that we were in the right unit to suit our needs. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Medoc
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 year old son and myself stayed in a 2-bed apartment for a week in July. The apartment was very nicely furnished, with all the bits that we needed for our stay. There were 2 king sized beds and 2 bathrooms - 1 en-suite. There were many positives and a few negatives for this resort. Positives included welcoming staff, lovely environment, close proximity to supermarket shopping and restaurants, free wi-fi, free gym, free activities including tennis, table tennis, shuffle board and basketball, a large (busy) pool area and a smaller (quieter) pool area. Negatives include a lack of walkways to the local facilities under a mile away, so a car really is needed (although we did eventually discover a cut through the car park of Congo Golf which would have made a much safer walkway); the entertainment provided was aimed almost entirely at children, with hardly anything in the evening for adults; there are no balconies or patios to sit and relax outside each apartment; there is no daily or twice-weekly apartment cleaning - just a towel change half way through the week. Overall though, an excellent choice for a comfortable and relaxing stay with plenty of space in the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: snglygrl
Reviews.Content: My entire family was so impressed with Silver Lake. Our room description was: 1 room Standard leisurelink rates 2 bedroom 2 bathroom lock-off villas. I am wheelchair bound and did not request a hanicapped room. We were told that if i had a handicapped room it wouldn't have a jacuzzi. We stayed in the 4th floor, elevator in building. We were 5 in our party. My kids ages were 4, 12, 15. The room was like a condo. The kitchen and dining area was open with the living room. Beauitiful and clean. The kitchen had granite counter tops. All the amenities needed in the kitchen: pots, pans, blender, toaster, coffemaker,cooking utensils, plates, cups, wine glasses, shot glasses, eating utensils, garbage disposal, dishwasher and a over and under waher/dryer. The two bedrooms were on oposite sides of the condo. Both rooms had king size beds and box set t.v.s. The master bedroom had a beautiful spacious bathroom with a stand-up shower and a jacuzzi. The second bedroom had a bathroom just across the hallway. There was a screened patio with lawn chairs. The recreational area had a game center, and a fitness center and a free movie theater. The pool was beautiful and clean with mini island in the middle. There was a bar area beside it that made it convienient. They also offered masssages for $10 in your room, I just didnt have the time to take advantage of that. The only thing that would have made Silver Lake better in my opinion was that they provide shuttle transportation to popular tourist attractions. We had to pay $14/day for Disney parking fees. I wouldn't have minded to pay an additional fee for shuttle services. We did though have to pay $30 for wifi and $5 for every aditional electronic device. All in all we were very pleased with the value of Silver Lake and all its amenities. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: coolmom02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an RCI traded week. It was wonderful! We checked in relatively quickly but they had a balloon guy and magician in the lobby entertaining kids. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a washer and dryer in our one bedroom which was very useful!! It is located across the street from Disney World property. Just down the street there is a special back entrance into the parks that is very close to Animal Kingdom. We went at an off time so the traffic wasn't bad which ever way you entered Disney. The pools were large and creatively laid out. There is a pool side bar and evening entertainment. There is a game room and you can rent stuff but we did not use those amenities. There was also an evening kids movie most nights but we didn't do that either. We will definitley stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “I was absolutely impressed!”
Reviews.Author: tnanny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in bldg 900 from July3-9. Located right at guard shack off Sherbeth Rd. I spoke with the staff a couple times prior to our arrival with my concerns and everything she assured me of was taken care of, One minor issue I had was black debris spewed from jacuzzi, so I opted out of using it. I didn't make a big deal of it-just used the shower. Our villa was stocked with new towels and bed linens, the grounds are well kept, pools weren't overcrowded. Sales resentation wasn't too bad, no pressure but rep became choked up when I asked a few questions he obviously had not prepared for. I had an awsome experience @ Silver Lake Resort! Im gonna try to attach photos, they may or may not load

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: den979
Reviews.Content: Outstanding in all cases. Friendly staff, nicely-equipped units, great location (use back entrance for shortcut to Disney parks), shopping and groceries nearby, activities for the kids. We had one-bedroom unit and it was perfect for the 2 of us. Furniture will need replcement shortly but overall we were very happy with Silver Lake.

Reviews.Title: “We will definately return.”
Reviews.Author: julienkelley
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. We stayed 3 nights before a wedding on North Captiva Island, and 1 night on the way back. We can't wait to return for a full week. The pool was beautiful, the atmosphere tranquil and the resort had numerous amenities. We had plenty of room in our 2 bedroom and it was so nice to relax in the giant tub.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back!!”
Reviews.Author: aprilonthego2007
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Silver Lake Resort on vacation for a week. I booked this resort on afvclub.com (Armed forces vacation club) We are active duty. The prive was amazing $299.00 for the week . We stayed in the new building(building 900) We had a 1 bed room condo. It was very nice the kitchen had granite countertops and new appliances, the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, there was a king size bed that was fairly comfy, however the sofa sleeper was pretty terrible it was like sleeping on springs but most sofa sleepere are that way anyway! One of the best features was when you go out the back gate and turn left you are literally 5 minutes from the parking lot of Animal Kingdom! The staff was super friendly, the kiddie pool next to the new building was nice and most days because most people hang out at the big pool where the lobby and the bar is. They have free movie nights in th emovie theatre for the kids with popcorn too! We enjoyed our stay and will return again . We did sit through the sales presentation but when we told them no, they didn't pressure us and we got free attraction tickets anyway! It's not a 5 star luxury resort but it's definitely a 4 in my book!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Places”
Reviews.Author: robynzechel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family vacation, it was a really great space. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms. full kitchen, washer, dryer. it was quite enjoyable the only thing is we were put in one of the rooms that needed a bit of a reno, it was dated but really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ecmodad
Reviews.Content: My family is hard to please. The start of our vacations are usually made or wrecked at check in. Chwck in was a breeze. Felt like they had been waiting for us to get there. Similar to the welcome we got when we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. Definately not the rtiz...but I was impressed. Rooms were brand new. Pool was large and not overly crowded. Fitness room has plenty of equipment. Kids activities were fun. Location was perfect. From our room it was 4.5 miles to our parking spot at disney, 3.1 miles animal kingdom, 6.4 epcot, 7.5 hollywood studios. Very easy access to everywhere Timeshare tour was pleasant, very professional. No pressure. The type of people id want to buy from. 15th time to disney. Wish I knew about this place a long time ago. Highly recommend. Didn't have one bad experience. Felt very safe. Security was highly visible and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to come home to after Disney”
Reviews.Author: DGeorges
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Silver Lake Resort twice, through RCI points, with our family (2 adults, 1 10 year old boy, one 13 year old girl). This is a nice resort - very clean and spacious condos and grounds. It has an entrance to Sherberth Road, which ends at the main Disney entrance road, so no need to battle the big traffic. Its location is close to the main Kissimmee drag - Publix (supermarket), Super Target, Olive Garden, Chick-Fil-A, and other restaurants. We had a two bedroom unit that faced the parking lot - which I believe was much quieter than if it faced the pool. But not a great view... The unit was very clean and nicely, if sparsely, appointed. We didn't see any bugs at all. The Master Suite had a large closet and dresser, as well as a large whirlpool spa tub and huge shower. The King bed was comfy as well. The 2nd bedroom was quite small, with a single queen bed. There were no twin bed options. The 2nd bedroom didn't have a dresser, so our kids had to use the closet shelf. Each room had a smallish TV, and the living area had a large 32 inch CRT television - a throwback (what with the cheap available LCDs out there), but serviceable. The kitchen was well-appointed and clean - it had everything we needed except for a non-stick pan. The in-room washer/dryer was a nice feature, so we didn't have too many dirty clothes to haul home. The main pool is quite large and meandering, and the cabana played pleasant music (none of the typical "rap-crap" you may hear elsewhere). We liked the game room and took in a movie at the theater. Nice... The only downside was that we had to pay for a slowish internet connection - $27/week for just one device. Extra devices (like an iPod Touch) were $5 extra per device. At the prices we paid, I would expect wi-fi to be included. TIP: if you have a laptop, bring an Ethernet cable and plug directly into the wifi router. Ours was in the master bedroom. I'm guessing you can bypass the Wi-Fi...just a thought. Overall, our week-long stay was very enjoyable. The staff was pleasant and accommodating, we felt secure, and we like staying here. After a long day at WDW, it was nice to come "home" to a place where we could spread out, have dinner or a snack, watch TV, swim, play video games, shuffle-board, etc. We'll definitely stay again on the next Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth37
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 and my mom stayed in a two-bedroom, two-bath unit in the 500 building from June 4-11. We found the location superb - being so close to WDW. We also spent a day at Universal & it was not a bad drive. The unit was spacious and clean. We enjoyed a nice view of the lake from our screened-in porch. The pool was huge, and the little store on the property is available if you need anything. We got a great deal through RCI, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ggomes
Reviews.Content: Went to Star Wars weekend. Just me and my son. The suite was perfect, comfy and very clean and modern. Nice big TV. Resort is 5 minutes from disney. I was very happy with the atmosphere. The resort had alot stuff to utilize. The courtyard/ pool area was nice and big and not crowded. I drank pina coladas while my kid found kids to play with and I had an open view of entire area, so I could actually relax. If you go to disney, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are in a new building”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: This timeshare resort has at least 3 different phases of buildings. After a couple days in the older units, we moved to the new building, which was extremely nice, spacious, and modern. The resort is in a great location as it is very close to Disney property (Animal Kingdom). The pool is big and there are tons of activities/games for kids. However, I expect that most people will rarely be at the resort, except to sleep. I have stayed here 4 times and always find it to be consistent and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with all amenities!”
Reviews.Author: brookerwarrior
Reviews.Content: We stayed through the RCI program and found the property to be very well managed with attractive landscaping, clean resident areas, a beautiful main pool area and many activities to keep families and visitors busy and entertained. Our room was wonderfully prepared for us and stocked with all we would need for our week-long stay. It was cool and comfortable. The staff were most helpful and friendly. Disney is literally out the back gate and only a several minute drive away. We are hoping to stay here again on our next visit to the orlando area, and will recommend this resort to our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room / poor service”
Reviews.Author: friendlytraveler1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in March. The first night I pulled out the sofa sleeper. Without looking, I sat on the mattress. When I stood up, I noticed that the sheets were stuck to the matress. It appeared that a bodily fluid had been expelled onto the sheets and then the sheets were not changed. I e-mailed the General Manager (Scott). The next morning the GMcalled me and offered a free week the next time I came. He stated that a letter for the free week would be at the desk when we checked out. It was not there when we checked out and the GM was not there either. I came back to Orlando in May and sent the GM and e-mail to folow up. I did not get a response, so I stoped in. The Manager on duty (Amanda) told me that the GM was no longer there and they could not do anything for me. This was after I showed her pictures of the sheets stuck. I would not recomend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alicia513
Reviews.Content: I requested a 2/2 unit. The unit was not a true 2/2. It was 2 connecting rooms. One room had queen bed and mini fridge. The other unit was a true one bedroom with a kitchen. One of the beds was made with torn sheets. When I called to complain, I was told they would be right up. I went out to get something to eat to find the bed wasn't made. In fact, I found sheets in a bag on the floor. I called the front desk and was actually asked if I paid for housekeeping services. Can u believe it? They wanted me to pay to change the sheets they should never have put on the bed. I told them they this and was told housekeeping supervisor would be right up. 30 mins later still no one and I haas to get kids to bed. RIDICULOUS! Oh and if you lose the paper they give you when you check in then you have to pay twenty dollars.

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort with all comforts”
Reviews.Author: KarlXII
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my father and my 10-year old son. Great value for the money. The resort has everything and is close to many good restaurants, minigolf, supermarket and Disney. A car is needed, but I guess that goes for most of the Orlando and Kissimmee area. The apartment was big and roomy and the staff was friendly. We enjoyed our stay even if the weather went from sunny and warm too rainy and chilled. Plenty of things to do on rainy days as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but too far away”
Reviews.Author: SusiDee
Reviews.Content: The resort is a nice place to stay but too far out of town. It is a great place for families to stay if you will be going to the theme parks, but not for someone like me who likes to get out & explore the city. They don't even have a day spa! When we arrived I asked one of the staff there (Elden was his name) about buses to Florida Mall etc. He said that buses would take me there. When I went to book I was told they don't go there. They only go to the theme parks. Not happy. The rooms are nice, they have a business center but you can purchase an activities card which will give you internet access to your room. One of my travelling companions had a package sent to the resort which unfortunately didn't arrive whilst we were there. However we had plans to come back & get it. When ringing the resort to ensure it arrived, the staff advised that it wasn't there & my friend was transferred around to several different people. We then asked to speak to the manager who eventually advised that it was there. So I think customer service overall could certainly be improved at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: OhMyCheese
Reviews.Content: We got this place through RCI. We stayed in a one bedroom, one bath, full kitchen, washer/dryer, and a screened in porch. The pool was next door. Never crowded. This place was quiet, clean, and near-by parking was never a problem. We came during our kids' Spring Break to visit all the Disney theme parks. I didn't realize how close we were to all the Disney theme parks. It was great! We were practically across the street from the Animal Kingdom properties. Two minute ride from our place to Animal Kingdom and less than 10 mins away from the rest of the Disney theme parks. Since we were so close to the theme parks, we would start the day by going to the theme parks early, and when the park started to get crowded and hot around 1pm, we would head back to our place for lunch, cool off at the pool, have an early dinner then head back to the park to finish it off and see the evening shows. Supermarket, super Target and super Walmart were near by too. We really enjoyed out time here. Better than staying at the Disney Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GoofyMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with young kids and gradparents! It was wonderful place. Nice and quiet and very clean!! Beds where great!! One of the best places too stay! We booked through AFVC and was awesome!! We stayed in 1800 building on top floor! Would stay away from buildings next to the road! Lot of traffic there. Called many times since I had a few request and staff was great. We got there late and very easy ck in. Was not asked once to do the time share thing. We did get Magic Kingdom tickets there was 5.00 more but did not have to wait in line. Only bad thing and was not a big deal dryer took forever too dry and shower drain was slow and the jet tub would turn on to do the cleaning cycle so just had to flip the breaker they told us. Not thinking they even cared for those tubs must happen alot. We did have serurity called on us the lastnight! We got back from Magic Kingdom late and made some dinner and the people below could hear our chairs on the tile. We where on top floor which I would suggest. Pools where great. Hot tub was too hot!! We walked too the zero depth all the time. Kids loved it. Drinks where pricy at the bar!! Only 5 min away from super target which was awesome!!! We will stay here again!! Not too big but was nice and quiet!! Thanks SILVER LAKES!!!! Was the best vacation ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Value”
Reviews.Author: razzyfrazzy
Reviews.Content: Visited with my then 1-year old daughter and my husband for a week and it was an all right stay for the value. We got it through RCI Endless Vacation Rentals and the price was pretty good. The location is great, but a little difficult to find (as far as we were concerned). It's a very nice place as far as the buildings and their locations relative to the pool. I prefer Orange Lake but there you have to drive to the pool to use it (and that was really tiring) while at Silver Lake it was right there outside our building! I absolutely loved that because we got to get up, have breakfast and go for a swim! There were a few things I didn't like-- bathroom was a little small, the room was a little dusty. It was overall pretty clean other than that, but the dusty was a weird thing because how can a hotel room get dusty? Anyway, they also require you to take out the trash when you leave which i thought was a little weird. They let you rent movies at their small clubhouse which was a little pricey, but okay if you're on vacation and really just want to hang out. The food there was horrible, but there's ten million places to eat in that area, so I suppose it was my fault for wanting to eat at the hotel anyway. Overall it was a good value, but I probably would not stay again unless I got a cheaper deal.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return Soon”
Reviews.Author: MamaPGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week in April (1-8). We didn't know what to expect since we were renting through the AVF Club. We had a two bedroom, one bath in building 900. We had such a great time. The pools are the reason to come to this resort. We stayed at the main pool practically every day from sun up to sun down. Our rooms were great too. We had a washer and dryer, dishwasher,and jacuzzi tub. Will definitely return here soon. Absolutely great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, calm, clean resort”
Reviews.Author: littlelamb814
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. It was me, my husband, 9 year old, 4 month old, mother and her friend. The room was nice and clean. It had everything we needed except an extra blanket for the pull-out couch. The pull-out couch mattress was very springy, and the mattress' in the 2nd bedroom weren't that great, but the master bedroom's mattress was great. We only went to the main pool and the tiki bar and they were both great. Not over crowded and we stayed during Spring Break. Now Magic Kingdom was packed and had rude people working there.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for disney, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: all4thesmile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at sliver lake april 2nd through the 7th, we had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo in building 800. We were on the 2nd floor and had a view to the lake, it was beautiful and so peaceful sitting on the nice screened in porch. The room was very nice and we are picky people, we had 4 adults and a 3 year old and had plenty of room. My only complaint was that the bathroom floors were dirty, i just got a broom and cleaned them myself, no big deal. They bring you fresh towels on wednesday and ask if you need anything. The kitchen was great, we packed our lunch for the parks everyday. The pools were very nice as well, we liked the smaller pool just because it had a wade in area for toddlers. We did book the trip on a timeshare promotion so we went to the presentation and actually enjoyed it, they had a great breakfast and our salesman was super nice, he was very low pressure and when we said no they simply said ok and let us go, it was all under 2 hours. We had to wait till the last day we were there to do it because that was the only day they had an 8:30, they had booked us for an 11:30 the day after we arrived but let us go ahead and switch and buy our park tickets and use them and they reimbursed us when we went to the presentation so it was no big deal. The location of this resort could not be any better, you are less than 10 minutes from disney and can go on a back road with no traffic. We had a perfect trip and will stay here again next time we go to disney! We booked through frank at the resort who was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “You are always a timeshare prospect, never a guest”
Reviews.Author: spike349
Reviews.Content: If you're used to sleeping on a busy road you will love this property. Located on one of the busiest side entrances to Disney, the traffic is 24/7. Constructed on the filled in Silver Lake, the only remnant of the lake is the mosquitoes and some swampy areas. While the rooms are large and nicely furnished, the walls and floors are paper thin. Each night you and your family will become very familiar with your neighbor's most intimate sounds. Most units open directly to the outdoors, so the mosquitoes come in each time you open the door. The common areas are well maintained, and heavily geared to a very hard time share sales pitch. You can look forward to the salespeople and prospective buyers staring at you while you are at the pool and fitness facility. Silver Lake is all about getting you in, and hard selling you a timeshare. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “After reading tons of reviews - I was expecting the worst - I was shocked!!”
Reviews.Author: AshleyAdler04
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely amazing. I had booked through AFVC - I ready over 100 reviews on the place and for the price we paid - I was expecting the worst. When we pulled up - I was shocked on how nice it was - I really couldn't believe it. This is a time share hotel - and they had asked if I would be interested upon checking in - however, I told that we weren't sure - she said, well if you are, hurry up and get your spot, bc it will fill up fast. I'm thinking they might have left us a message in our room too - though since we have a 1 year old, I always unplug the hotel phones. The room was so nice, the bed was comfortable. It was very clean, nice decor, had a screen room to enjoy the cool nights/smoke. It had an arcade room, which was nice and several pools. The movie nights were free too - with the exception of the pizza/movie kids night which was only $6. They had several activiites going on for children throughout the day too. We didn't end up participating in them, since we had a pretty full schedule anyway. We stayed in the 10000 building on the first floor. Which didn't really have a view, but we didn't have to worry about taking the elevator up every time which was nice with the kids. This is the perfect location if you are going to disney! You can head out the back entrance and skip all the traffic on the main highway. I'm so glad we stayed here over a disney hotel, the full kitchen made it so nice to whip up something quick and we always kept frozen water bottles to put in our cooler to take to the parks. If you are planning on going to Universal most of the time - it is about a 20 minute drive - however, I was so impressed with this place and the price that I would book here again, even if I knew we weren't going to do disney.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review by a First Time Owner”
Reviews.Author: shamama75
Reviews.Content: I bought a 3 bedroom lockout for a steal 6 months ago and last week was the first time my family and I visited our actual property. I will be as honest as possible as I am an owner, proud at that. I will do the PROS and CONS. PROS - Location - First of all, the location is absolutely spectacular. I am not just talking about Disney but the fact that you are in the heart of everything from supermarkets, convemience stores, gift shops,, Super Target, Chain and non chain restaurants,..all literally across the street and right off highway 192. One of my luggage pieces ripped and we literally jumped in the car and drove 2 minutes to target. Also as you may or may not know, the location of the parks is tremendous and that is literally the biggest advantage you have staying at Silver lake. I am familiar with some oif the other igh rated timeshares and Silver Lake stands out. This is one major advantage Silver Lake has over resorts such as Wyndham Bonnet Creek and even so over the Sheraton Lake Buena Vistas. Rooms - If you are looking for a three bedroon lockout, Silver Lake has them and they are nice, some other resorts do not such as the condo resorts. I saw th 2 bedrooms as well and they are very nice, especially in the 300-600 buildings Peaceful - If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing get away and do not care much for loud music, festive pool activities, big crowds,...Then Silver Lake is the place for you. Now this can be viewed as a PRO or CON as some folks may enjoy the festive activities and more of a live atmosphere. Customer Service- I thought the customer service was pretty good. We never had to call twices for anything and unlike many resorts, they actually answer the phone without having to walk all the way to the front desk...very accommodating. Front desk folks were pretty nice Security - Very good and not psycho like some places. They are reasonable and will let you through without fighting them if your guest forgets their parking pass. Timeshare presentation - Very bearable and was not bad at all, got out in 90 minutes and only had to say NO a few times. My guests did a timeshare at the Sheraton Lake Buena Vistana resort and the sales rep literally would not let them leave as he was super aggressive and unprofessional. CONS - I believe as an owner, they need to do a little better job with some of their amentities on their grounds. Silver lake is a small resort with not many amentities on their grounds so in my opinion, things need to sparkle and be put together well. For example, they have only two basketball rims and one was missing a net. The tenis court looks like it could use some polishing. Grounds - I was not too overly impressed with their grounds. They have two basketball rims as mentioned above however they are on their only tennis court. So if someone is renting the tennis court out, you can not play basketball since they share the same court. Also, the business center only has two computers and they are occupied most of the time. Their are only 3 pools, one small whirl pool and a small baby pool. Their activities are OK, not very festive, music is dull, only one tennis court, two basketball rims, playground is exceptionally small, same as market gift shop,... Housekeeping - They are very stingy on towels, they claim they give you enough for your guests at check in and you get more when they do thir mid week cleaning. I had to beg for extra towels a few days before our mid week housekeeping which they were fine with. Also, when they did their mid week housekeeping, they did not change our sheets. When my wife called and asked why they did not, they said that "you have to ask for it". This seems sort of silly as it should be normal practice to change sheets when housekeeping. I mean it does seem pretty filthy for them to expect you to sleep with the same sheets for the whole week. Cabana Bar and Grill - was average and i also noticed they are pretty stingy on their portions but overall good service. I hope this review helps as i did my best to be non biased and honest. My bro in law owns at Sheraton Lake Buena Vistana and we were back and forth between the two during our week. If you are looking for a more festive atmosphere with a TON of grounds which are VERY impressive, then Sheraton is your place. Very fetsive, respected, lots of activities, good location,... If you are looking for a nice, relaxing vacation and not worried about the grounds and amentities, then Silver Lake is the place. If ou are contempt with a few nice pools to relax, average amentities and ground with a superb location, then you are OK. I bought here because it was an absolute steal which i got pretty lucky as i stated plus I need and prefer a 3 bedroom lockout which Lake HSeraton Buena Vistana does not have. if you have any further questions or looking to buy a property at Silver lake for a tremendous price, you can email me at shamama75@aol.com. I have a fantastic 3 bedroom lockout for sale. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chevygirl98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I get to rent Time Shares through Armed Forces Vacation Club.We have been doing this for the last 6yrs. Up until this rental we have always been very happy. We requested a 1 bedroom which is what we got.However , my living room at home is larger than the condo. The bedroom had a tiny dresser with 4 small drawers and a huge T.V on top so there was no place to place anything on top. The bed had a mattress that sank when you got in, a tiny closet with a safe that did not work even after someone came to fix it. To walk between the bed and dresser you had to walk sideways.Washer worked fine, dryer took over an hour to dry a medium size load of light clothes. There was no dishwasher and the sink was so small 2plates and 2 cups was all you could wash at once.We will NOT stay there again nor recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Micah214
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my husband and 7 year old son. This is our second stay and I will def be back. The whole resort is super clean and all the staff are super friendly, especially Denise and Eldon! You can't beat this place for location, you are right around the corner from all the Disney parks. You can see the tree of life at Animal Kingdom from the parking lot. I can't say enough positive things about this place...exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tle3384
Reviews.Content: we were only here for a couple of days. resort has a country feel but is near everything. rooms were very clean and spacious. we had the hotel room type of room and it was perfect for us. it had coffee pot, fridge, and two place settings of plates, cups, bowls, silverware, etc. pools were too cold but we still went in. had a nice bar next to the pool. free internet was nice. very close to animal kingdom and back ways to disney that were not so busy as main entrances. employees were very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews do no justice”
Reviews.Author: mhardy55
Reviews.Content: This was my very first rental in Orlando with RCI. I wasn’t really sure what to expect, but I was extremely satisfied. The resort was very clean and really well kept and was exactly as described on their vacation rental site orlandoparkvacations. We happened to arrive a bit early, and the front desk staff was very helpful. They did everything in their power to accommodate us and helped us get to the park as quickly as possible. The room were very spacious, beds were comfortable, and the activities that they had going on were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much we became owners.”
Reviews.Author: angel3198
Reviews.Content: Our family booked a 2nd Disney Vacation, and we decided to stay at Silver Lake. The booking rep was great and offered us the best deal. The staff were very helpful. After seeing the reviews on this place, we asked for a room in one of the new buildings. Even though the request was last minute, the staff tried their best, and when we arrived we were escorted to their newest building. The room was amazing, more than we ever expected. The view was great, and so were the pool and tennis courts. We did do a timeshare presentation, but it was so low key. The rep never pressured us, and was very respectful. Our family felt it was the right choice for us so we bought it at a great price. We felt at home and were treated great. The place is very family friendly with lots of activity for all. Look forward to going there again and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “very lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pattimann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Silver Lake Resort. Great Place and we will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice, and the timeshare presentation is bearable.”
Reviews.Author: monkeybiz22
Reviews.Content: This place is family oriented, as you might expect, and there seemed to be enough for kids to do when they're not at disney. But I used it merely as a homebase. I stayed in the 900 building, which is new. Very nice. Only complaint is about my neighbors. The door to the room opens onto a mini hallway that is shared with the room next door. You then exit thru a 2nd door to the main hallway. This double-door setup is a great buffer against hallway noise and can only be defeated if your immediate neighbor is an idiot. Mine was. They woke me up each night by talking loudly just outside my door as they entered their room. Oh well. The timeshare presentation. --Because I was there solo, I was surprised to be offerred $100 cash to sit thru a "1 hour" presentation (that included breakfast). I'm guessing I got this offer because when I was asked where I was coming from, I named the fairly pricey hotel from which I had just transferred. But who knows. My presenter, Bob, was funny and nice, and did not high-presure me. He asked why I was there, and I explained I was bribed, had no intention of buying, but would do my best to understand his offer and debate it's merits. I happen to work in finance, and honestly believe the timeshare is a terrible deal. We had fun with it, and he let me off the hook after 2 short hours. Bob is experienced, and knew early on he was probably wasting his time that morning, and kind of said so. It was he who was marking time more so than I. Meanwhile, I enjoyed the coffee, tried to shoot holes in his product, and together we had some laughs. Generally, the presenters seem to be decent people who will not make the experience too uncomfortable for you. When Bob finally threw in the towel, he signed a sheet which I brought up to the front, and was promptly given $100 cash.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: wander2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1-BR unit, top floor with vaulted ceiling. We were in the 300 building and the unit is very spacious. There are two bathrooms, one in the bedroom with jacuzzi tub for two and the second bathroom is next to the TV area. Enclosed patio with table and four chairs overlooked trees. Kitchen has granite countertop and lots of room to move around. The bed was very comfortable. The small movie theater at the resort showed free movies. First one at 5 PM and the second at 7:00 PM. The pools were heated. The weather was very cold and windy during our visit so we did not use them even they were heated. Next time we'll plan the trip in spring.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased all around”
Reviews.Author: finnallyswife
Reviews.Content: My family and I came down end of October to enjoy Disney World for a week and the stay at Silver Lake made the Disney experience all the more enjoyable. The resort is literally 3 minutes from the gate to Animal Kingdom and no more than 9 minutes to any of the other Disney Entrances. The property itself is very well maintaned and well kept. We needed to have a 1st floor unit due to my husbands injury and Ingrid was very helpful and made sure that we had one. The units themselves are very comfortable and clean. The only negative in ours was the front kitchen window was not sealed correctly so moisture did come in which affected how the swimwear and towels dried but other than that very pleased with our unit. Pools are very nice but they are not very well heated despite saying they are. That time of year does get cool so swimming was not very comfortable. If you do the timeshare salespitch it is longer than advertised but very informative and if they offer you something for your time take them up on it but make sure they write down what they are offering. Overall SilverLake is a wonderful property with a fantastic location close to shopping,restaurants, and especially Disney World and all the resorts. If you get the chance, STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: ckguess
Reviews.Content: Booked our visit to the resort thru AFVC, stayed 5 nights, $53 per night, and wanted to stay longer at the resort. The resort is very clean. We had a one bedroom with balcony and partial view of the pool, very roomy. Very nice room, newer appliances, pool was clean, staff was friendly, close to everything. Very quiet but I am sure that during the summer months there are lots of kids staying here. This is a timeshare resort, which we are not members of, we did get a phone call every morning wanting to know if we would be interested in one of the info sessions which was kind of annoying. If we ever visit Orlando again, which is not likely since we hate Orlando, we would stay here again and will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - would like to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sthompsen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and pool - happy and helpful staff. We were very lucky - we had a room with a view of fireworks at the parks each night - Feel lucky to have made the choice to saty in this great place. Only negative is was that my husband had a hard time sleeping because the mattress was very plush - I happened to love it and slept very well :)

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Beautiful, fun, accomodating, just overall wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: jechll
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came home from our one week stay there and we had such a great time. The room was HUGE and the decor was great, it really gave us the whole vacation feel, especially since we weren't that far from home. The pools were great, they have a little kiddie pool that was nice and the perfect size for my one year old and my teenager had a blast at the other pools and gameroom and movie theater. He met everyone there and participated in all sorts of activities. I had shopped around alot before deciding to come here and was helped by Frank, one of their representatives. He told me about the "resort" and was very helpful. I was a little skeptical at first, but after staying there we'll definately be back. My husband and I did have to do a time share presentation/tour, but they weren't pushy as they are at other hotels. We just told them no and went on our way. Will be back next year... Oh and you have to go to Carrabba's down the street. Mmmm.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Relax in a Hectic Place”
Reviews.Author: INHemingway
Reviews.Content: This time we visited Orlando primarily to enjoy the weather and relax by the pool. This was a perfect place to do that, and aside from the relatively minor annoyances mentioned below we enjoyed Silver lake Resort. We had a unit on the first floor of the 1000 building right next to one of the 3 pools. We were disappointed that our unit did not have a dishwasher, apparently most did. Because we were in a corner unit, our screened in porch was very small; barely enough room for two chairs. The bedroom closet was not at all convenient. Hangers provided were in poor shape and could not be moved because there was not a standard hanger bar. Fortunately we brought our own wire hangers, but not having a standard closet bar was a pain. Overall, the unit was nice, well maintained, quiet and clean. Note: Apparently a nearby resort offers hot air ballon rides. We were awakened several mornings between 4:30 and 5 am by the woosh of hot air used to keepthe ballons inflated . We usually had no problem going back to sllep after they departed. Everyone on the staff was friendly, pleasant and willing to be helpful. We appreciated that once we indicated no interest, they did not push the "free breakfast".

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Smokediver
Reviews.Content: We met my parents in Orlando and rented 2 one bedroom units. Check in was fast and easy. I was then sent to "guest services" to get my parking permit. I went expecting to be harassed about taking a time share tour. To my surprise, I was given a parking pass, a list of the weeks activities(some adult, some child friendly), given directions to the parks and local stores, and told if I needed anything to call. Through out the week, we took them up on the offer, and they were glad to help every time, even volunteering to print things from the Internet for us. We had the 1 bedroom 2 bath units. It had lots of room. The rooms were very nice, with granite counter tops, huge shower with separate whirlpool tub, full kitchen and a huge flat screen TV in the living room. The staff was great, from the front desk, to security, to grounds crew. I was taking my trash to the dumpster when someone saw me and met me in a golf cart to take the trash the rest of the way. The only issue that arose was that the unit above my parents unit had a hot water tank leak and it drain into their unit. The staff upgraded them to a 2 bedroom unit for free and helped moved all their luggage. We spent a week at Silver Point, then moved to a friends condo in a newer complex for our second week. If we go back to Orlando, we will go back to Silver Points.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: michaelfd2
Reviews.Content: awesome place. Great service from staff and great room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great pools, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Meelar
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Silver Lake Resorts was very nice. The Staff was very friendly. They offered to show me the timeshare but when I declined I was not contacted any more. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. check-in and check-out was a breeze. My room was clean and in good repair, the pools were great, we swam every day. The porch was screened in to keep out the bugs and was a great place to watch the lightening. The master bath had a jacuzzi tub and a separate shower . The only thing that was odd to me was the location of the washer and dryer. They were in a closet in the kitchen. There was a fee for the wireless internet but it came with a discount card that was good for a great many things around the resort. Silver Lake Resorts is very close to Disneyland and Universal Studios. It is also located right in the center of the state so if you want to travel to the Gulf coast or the Atlantic coast it is a simple day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Fall Break”
Reviews.Author: woodstockwench
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is wonderful if you are planning to visit Disney theme parks. Easy access was the greatest part about staying here - less than five minutes to each and easy to navigate! Rooms were clean, but sparse. Master bedroom king sized bed was extremely comfortable! Second bedroom had two double beds - they were fine for kids. Pool was very large, and not crowded. Well stocked convenience store on site - although typically high priced. Front desk help, ticket and tour help could not have been nicer, and very attentive. Call to replace broken light bulb in hallway outside was answered quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jjkkll52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days for a quick R&R trip. It was fantastic. Check in was easy, parking right in front of our unit. They even let us check in quite early. The room was clean and nice. Very comfortable bed. I loved the location, out the back gate and you're at animal kingdom and all the other parks are just down the road. Also, right around the corner leaving the front gate is a super Target and every kind of eating place you can want. It's only a quite drive to get to the I-4 and hit the outlets. Really this a perfect location. We enjoyed the pools greatly...all three of them. We found it nice and peaceful. They were kept quite clean and open to 11 pm which I really appreciate. I don't like when you get back from dinner and want a swim and the hotel has them closed at 9. The staff were very friendly. Highly recommend this resort to anyone. Looking forward to our next trip. I don't say that lightly. I am well travelled both with work and vacations, this resort ranked right at the top.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay and wonderful staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abbygirl336
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Silver Lake Resort in mid-August as a summer vacation to Disney World. I found them online when I was researching where to stay in Orlando. I did buy into a package (through Frank, wonderful rep of the travel dept) and GET THIS....for **$737** here's what we got!!!!! 6 nights in a 2BR condo at Silver Lake Resort, a Touch of Magic Disney Ticket (which means 2 days at a big Disney Park, plus 1 day at a water park) for all 3 of us!! WOW!!! Just the Disney tickets ALONE were worth almost $500!! When we arrived after a long 2 day drive into Orlando, I was so pleased with the staff at the front counter at the Welcome Center...very friendly, glad you were there! Checked in, drove to our Bldg. #10, went to the 3rd floor and opened the door to our beautiful 2 BR condo!! All three of us (myself, husband & 6 yr old boy) said "***WOW!!!***" It was so clean, nicely decorated and just plain WONDERFUL!!! :) The bedding was beautiful, the full kitchen was great and the master BR had a great sliding door to the screened balcony as well as a large bathroom with jet tub! It was a wonderful feeling knowing we would be there for 6 nights!! My husband was thrilled with the 48" (?) plasma TV on the wall too!! I can't say enough about the fantastic condo!! It was just beyond my expectations! :) We did have to do a 90 min. Vacation Ownership presentation the next morning at 8:30am where they served us a little continental breakfast and introduced us to our sales person. We felt SO lucky to get CAROLINE!!! She was the sweetest, kindest woman and we actually enjoyed our time with her! She was never pushy or aggressive, she just laid out all the facts and showed us how we could enjoy wonderful vacations. The whole presentation was so low-key and NOT high pressured (like some we've been to!).....it was fantastic! Spent our time with Caroline, said "no thank you" and off we went to gather our DISNEY TICKETS!! Wooooooo Hooooooo! :) The lagoon style pool was great and the location of the property was a huge asset!! The only thing I could say I didn't care for was the cafe/eatery off the pool...they do not have a restaurant there but that's no problem because there's plenty very close by on 191. We did decide to get an easy dinner one night after swimming, I got the burger and hubby got the philly cheese steak....it was mildly OK... wouldn't order from there again. The beds were amazingly comfy, the linens crisp and clean!! Our building (and our balcony) was backed by a large swampy tree filled area and every night we went to sleep with a nice FROGGIE CONCERT going on! ha/ha! There must have been thousands of frogs all ribbiting at the same time, although not in unison! It was actually pretty amazing! GREAT STAY at Silver Lake Resort and would go back in a heartbeat!! :) Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be coming back soon!!”
Reviews.Author: jhopkins23456
Reviews.Content: Silver Lake truly met all of our expectations! To start off, the staff that greeted us were truly exceptional! When we checked in to our villa we were astonished at how clean and up to date the rooms were! First things first, the kids had to go check out the pool! The pool was bigger than I had imagined! Now although they don't have a restaurant they do have a poolside bar with food, and a little convenience store with treats! We figured usually these rooms would be too expensive for our huge family, but we found an amazing deal with Orlando Savings .com. Not only did they get us an amazing rate for 6 nights, they were also able to help us with some discounted tickets to Disney World! I had read that the noise was a big problem, but we honestly didn't feel it was bad at all. We didn't go during Spring Break or anything which may be why it was so much quieter! I felt very safe here with the guards at the closed gate! Everyone was more than willing to help us with anything we needed! We will definitely be back, the experience was beyond our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Family with preschooler, not what I expected in a bood and bad way”
Reviews.Author: NJAccountant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Lake for 6 days and 5 nights. I was very shocked when I arrived. The grounds were nice and check-in was pretty easy. We had a room in the 9000 building. We opened the door and to our surprise, the room was very nice. 2 bedroom villas. We were close to the playground and pool. My little guy loved the pool and it was so close. The temperature of the water was great. Parking was always close and a security guard is each entrance. Everything was going great until I tried the Jacuzzi. It looked clean but when the jets turned on it was dirt coming out. DISGUSTING. I called the front desk and asked them if they had bleach so I can clean it myself. They told me that they do not and they could send someone to clean it. I figured I could do a better job. So I cleaned it with dish detergent and thought it would work. It was sparkling. So I filled up the tub and turned on the jets again. More dirt came out. I just gave up. Then I requested to have it cleaned and they never should up. Please note that the towel policy is absurd. After I cleaned the tub, I requested some additional washcloths because I used then to clean the tub. They had someone bring me two washcloths and I had to sign for them. Also at the pool you have to sign your towels out. This is crazy. I travel about 10 plus times a year and had never seen such a policy. I really like the resort and would probably stay here again if they changed the towel policy and had a cleaner Jacuzzi. It is a cute quaint resort. Noting impressive but nice.

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly go back and tell friends to go there”
Reviews.Author: jsr735_10
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews of Silver Lake I was worried but after a few days I thought the previous complainants were just very sad people living miserable lives. We were in one of the older blocks where everything was clearly well used but very clean and very comfortable. All matters to do with laundry, washing, towels for the pool and so on were first class. Staff were excellent especially those who maintained the impeccable condition of the buildings and the brilliant swimming spool. It was good to see security guards at the main gates. Reaching the various attractions by driving out the back door was very acceptable. There are literally dozens of very good eating places within yards. Shopping was so easy with two huge Walmarts within minutes and several other smaller supermarketsI would have to try very hard to raise an adverse comment; my wife felt that the pots and pans needed to of the heavy based variety as the ones we had were poor for waffles and fried eggs. Now if that is the worst comment I can come up with, then you can see that it was a great place for a holiday. I would happily answer any questions from prospective visitors. And to those people who moaned - get a life!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best...had a good time & LOTS OF LAUGHS but there's room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: mat'sgirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Silver Lake Resort with my 17 year old niece. I purchased one week from July 16th through July 23rd, 2010 as an RCI "Extra Vacation." Overall, my niece and I had a good time but having traveled a lot, it is my opinion that the resort could definitely use some improvement and provide a tad more customer service, especially in the most basic areas. Briefly repeating what others have said, the resort is a large and older place that is gradually being updated. DEFINITELY a FAMILY RESORT, this is a "no frills place" with lots and lots and lots of children (hey, it IS DISNEY WORLD in July). Currently, there are nearly 500 units with plans to expand the resort to over 600 units (cannot imagine). My niece and I stayed in a "renovated" studio, which was quite small... you will see this from my photos. We stayed on the fourth floor of the 900 building, which is the last building near the rear entrance gate. Throughout the week, our key card never worked at the rear gate, so we abandoned that option as an entry point to the resort. The resort location is great, as it is approximately 3 miles or so to Disney's Magic Kingdom. The resort is about 4.5 miles to Interstate 4, which gets one to Sea World, Universal Studios, The Orlando Premium Outlets, all Disney attractions and other Florida points, east-to-west. The resort is also located on Rte 192, Bronson Hwy, a major commercial throughway to Disney with many resorts, restaurants, stores, shops, hotels, etc on it. This is good and bad because everything one could want is within minutes from the resort. On the down side, traffic on Rte.192 can be horrific, especially between 10:45 pm and 11:20 pm when Disney World closes for the night. It's weird 'cause after 11:20 pm-11:30 pm or so, Rte. 192 is empty except for all the neon store lights & occasional lone pedestrian...doesn't look like the same road. While pleasant enough, IMHO this resort seems to lack any character or true charm, definitely lacks even basic customer service. The reception area at this resort is a bit odd, as it resembles the lobby of a Motel 6. Check-in lines grew long and folks seemed to get impatient although our check-in went smoothly. The "main reception lobby" completely shuts down by 11:00 pm...so, if you need anything after 11:00 pm, you are out-of-luck, as my niece and I soon discovered! The common areas like the Club House are okay but stark and a bit dated, just like the rest of the resort. The spa essentially gives manicures & neck massages. The two computers in the "Business Room" never seemed to work properly. The three swimming pools were clean enough and despite being a HUGE resort, my niece and I never had a hard time finding lounge chairs by any of the three pools. On one occasion, we were given pool towels that smelled really dank and moldy...probably were rolled up when damp. On another occasion, the towel room was out of towels. On a third occasion, we were only given small bath towels as pool towels...no biggie. On a fourth occasion, there was no one at the pool post to hand out towels. The little Tiki restaurant by the main pool was alright but accepted cash or credit cards only...nothing could be billed directly to the room, which was a bit inconvenient. Our renovated unit was alright but still seemed oddly dated. The "partial kitchen" was nothing more than a 2 ft x 4 ft granite slab placed into an alcove, atop a mini fridge. We washed our coffee pot, dishes & cups in the bathroom sink (YUCK). There was zero room for storage (we stored snacks and boxed food items in dresser drawers, another YUCK). Cups, dishes and glasses were placed in a high cabinet above the little kitchen alcove, which neither my niece or I could reach. The nicest touch was having a coffee pot in the room for morning coffee on the screened-in porch, although coffee pots are pretty standard in most 3-Star hotels these days. Although minor only, a few additional annoyances made our stay unpleasant at times. My niece and I laughed but several things never seemed to work properly and it seems that something in our room or at the resort "broke" every day. Forget trying to get "24 hour maintenance or housekeeping" late at night. Our toilet didn't flush properly one night, I fixed it. Vertical blinds were stuck and two fell off the track one night, I fixed them. Ceiling fan didn't operate properly, I climbed up and fiddled with it. My niece and I never figured out how to use the in-room safe, our table lamps flickered on and off occasionally, the screen door to our porch didn't lock. Nothing huge by no means. Funny most of the time but occasionally a bit annoying. The main upset for me was on our second-to-last evening when I accidentally dropped coffee and coffee grinds onto our bed (trying to manage my way around our super-large room and that super-large kitchen). Everything seeped all the way through to the mattress cover and there was no way we could reach housekeeping to request a sheet change despite trying to do so for over 1 hour. My niece and I rinsed out and rolled up the top blanket, the sheets, the mattress cover, etc and we slept on a blanket that we fetched from my car...not good. While we received a TOWEL EXCHANGE on our 5th day at Silver Lakes, there is absolutely NO HOUSEKEEPING offered throughout a 7-day stay. Forget housekeeping (or anything) after hours. My niece and I got our biggest laugh when we did laundry one day in the very old and out-dated, in need of repair "common" laundry room. The laundry room had a total of three washer/dryer combo machines, TWO operating (one broken) at all times. Several of my niece's panties "caught fire"--well they were burnt black--in an apparent dryer meltdown in our absence. Laugh we did...happy no one got hurt. I could go on and on but others have stated it all...the good and the bad. While an okay place with a good location, nice enough grounds, pleasant people and hey, it IS SUNNY FLORIDA, this resort could use a bit of TLC and some attention to detail, especially regarding simple customer needs. I doubt I would ever return to Silver Lake Resorts if traveling again to Central Florida 'cause there are so many wonderful places to stay in the Central Florida area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful last minute trip”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl4u
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found a great deal through Paradise Escapes last minute vacations and booked a hotel unit at Silver Lake Resort and found it to be very nice. The room had a king size bed, flat screen TV with HBO, a screen in balcony, small fridge, microwave, coffee maker and hair dryer. We were able to turn the air condition on and off for our comfort which was a plus. The resort also has security as you enter into it, which was nice. The room was clean, very modern, and quiet. The staff was extremely friendly and always willing to help out. The grounds of the resort was beautiful. We loved being very close to, Disney, restaurants and more. The hotel had several pools and activities for children if you have them!

Reviews.Title: “Close To Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: speters1930
Reviews.Content: Our unit was a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom. It also included a sofa bed in the great room. The unit was very spacious, updated appliances, furniture and very clean. The screened in patio was nice for our two toddlers to get some air and be in the area. We were in the 900 building on the 1st floor. Wi-fi in the room will cost $24 for week (regardless if you stay 3 or 4 days). TVs in every bedroom and the great room. All appliances in the kitchen worked. The back security gate is a short drive to the Disney Parks (about 5 or 10 minutes). Large swimming pool in addition to other pools, activities onsite (which we didn't partake, but there were lots for children). There was an adjoining hotel unit outside our door but we couldn't hear the people next door. Business Center is only 2 computers that aren't very fast. Good for checking email and that's it. Location is close to Publix Grocery Store and SuperTarget.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: 5frys
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay for all ages. Spacious rooms, beautiful grounds, comfortable beds, updated kitchen, laundry in room, 3 TV's, 3 pools, etc.......it was great. We loved coming home from a long day at disney to a spacious hot tub! My kids loved choosing which of the 3 pools to go in. Movie theater on site for families and a redbox to rent from on site......it was expensive though, so recommend going to the local Circle K to rent. Free internet net in the lounge. All starter bath products were Bath and Body works! The king master bed was super comfortable. They did call about the time share, but just say NO. Will stay here again. Very nice and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Pay Too Much To Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: twilightgarden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found a great deal through Wyndham RCI last minute vacations and booked a hotel style room (make a note that all information applies to this type of room) at Silver Lake Resort in June 2010. We stayed in the Silver Points building 900 which is one of the fairly recent remodeled buildings of the whole resort. The location was disappointing as we were quite a drive from a lot of the places we like to visit in the Orlando area, but it was a quiet area with pretty landscaping. Great location if you are taking the family to Disney and don't much care about the views. My in-laws stayed in building 1000 which was identical to ours. I travel all over the US for work as a specialty contractor and my husband and I have traveled many places as well for leisure. I have stayed in a wide variety of hotels and motels in a landscape of locations across the country. From Washington to Florida to Oklahoma and New York. Also, please note that I have 13 years experience as a professional housekeeper. Attention to details... This review is not based on emotion or shaped around one bad experience. I will state the facts, the cons and pros for your information purposes. Reasons this resort is not recommended are as follows: 1.)VERY limited parking ESPECIALLY close to any building entrances so expect to walk. 2.) Only 1 elevator per building which gets immediately tied up by housekeeping on Friday morning when you're supposed to check out (with a Friday to Friday stay, see number 10). 3.) Aside from the standard bathroom amenities such as soap and shampoo, don't expect many amenities or room features with a hotel style room. Think Red Roof Inn. There isn't even an iron or ironing board in the room. They only provided 2 people with 2 towels each for 5 days. We ran out of washcloths by Sunday morning. 4.) The wall dividing the hotel style room from a larger 2 bedroom condo is paper thin and you share the same main entrance off the long hallway. This caused problems when a loud family with young children roomed next store and kept weird hours. If it tells you anything, the doors aren't sealed properly and you can see a good inch under each others doors so no nose reduction there. The floors are tiled around the doors also so the sound echoed big time. It made for a few miserable nights and mornings. It's like you're all sharing one unit with your bedroom door closed for privacy. 5.) When you have an issue such as nosy neighbors, you have no one to help you. The main staff for the resort (probably all employed by the property management service) does not take care of issues for people who book through a company like RCI. RCI apparently either 'owns' the units or has time shares there and then leases the individual units to tenants such as us on behalf of the owners. A LOT of middle men. Also, some of the bad neighbors may actually be owners as well so there is nothing that can be done. Not at all like a hotel which is what we expected. Lesson learned. We didn't book a room as a time share, we booked a room just like you would make a reservation at any standard hotel chain through Wyndham. We'll be careful next time to stick with the major resort or hotel names next visit. 6.) The bathrooms are VERY small and have little counter space as well as a shower like in a trailer home. Imagine a bathroom from a Motel 6 with smaller counters and newer fixtures and there you go! For the ladies, don't plan to shave in the shower once you get down there. Nearly impossible in the tiny, narrow shower stall with no ledges. They still have the old standard shower curtain rods and not the arc style that are in most hotels now. 7.) The pools suck. The pool near the Silver Point area is only about 3 1/2 feet deep. Plenty of space to lay out and tan, but lame for taking a cool swim if you're older than 5 years. Also, the main pool area near the lobby is larger, but just as shallow. Not what we expected from a huge resort. It's a bit too kid friendly for adults. What happened to a shallow AND deep end? Or a standard pool and a kiddie pool? The shallow water got VERY hot in the FL summer days thus another reason lameness. A little deeper and it would have been refreshing. 8.) They have 2 entrance gates for the resort. Both secured. This is a perk for safety, but the gate next to our building was never guarded so we always had to enter on the other side of the resort from a different road or call the main gate to let us in at our entrance. It got to be a pain when you just wanted to zip in and out. 9.) Although not 100% certain, it seemed they turned the boilers or hot water heaters down at night. After 11 pm, the water was only tepid. During the day it was plenty hot. Understand the need to save to cut costs, but this sucked if you checked in late on Friday or got in late from a park/event and needed to shower up or wash your face before bed. 10.) Check out time is listed as 10 am (a little earlier than standard hotel chains) but housekeeping will show up as early as 8 am. Be ready to go. While the mass exodus occurred between 9-10 am with many guests leaving, housekeeping was in everyone's way trying to get into the rooms before we were even gone. Along with tying up the elevators, it seemed like they were super eager to boot you out. The cleaning staff seemed large enough and the next check in time isn't until 4 pm, so I'm not sure why the rush. They had plenty of time to clean and replace the shampoo. It was annoying to say the least. Reasons this place was worth the $33 a night we paid: 1.) The linens were clean and bed was overall nice. As you see in many pictures, the decor is modern tropical in most units. This was the case with our room. The bathroom towels aren't up to par with say Hampton Inn, but they were at the least very clean. 2.) Although there was not kitchen in our small room, we did have a mini fridge and microwave, kitchen towels, hot pads and a few basic dishes. 3.) Laundry facility use is free for guests. We didn't have a washer/dryer unit in our room so we made use of the laundry room available near the game room. 4.) There is a bar and the pool stays open until 10 am. At least you can relax after 9 pm. 5.) We didn't see the first sign of an insect or critter anywhere inside. Just a cool gecko that hung around outside every night. Even for a classier hotel, you still see the odd bug buzzing around somewhere or laying dead in the corner of the bathroom floor. Sounds silly, but I notice a lot. 6.) We had a flat screen TV (just no HDTV) in our room on the wall. 7.) Though shallow as a puddle, the pools and pool area was very clean and well kept. The bar area was nice also. Side notes: The property managers will try to offer you a time share deal. They aren't pushy about it. We never called to express a desire to set up a meeting, so they never pushed the issue after the initial expression at check in. Our room did have a note warning against outside people pushing time shares and advised us to call the desk or security if we were bothered. This may be where some people state in the reviews about the pushy time share people. We had no problems with this. All in all our stay wasn't terrible. But we won't be back. It wasn't the place for 2 adults celebrating their anniversary and if the nightly rate worked out to be higher than what we paid, we would have been upset and disappointed. For the money, it was ok. If you're looking to book a hotel style room at Silver Lake, be wary of paying more than $40 a night. You're better off at the Econolodge on Universal. At least they have larger rooms and a deep and larger swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with a few minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: sunflower35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a fantastic deal on a hotel room at Silver Lake (through RCI). The property is divided up into several buildings, some are timeshare condos that are bigger than the hotel units. We booked a hotel room due to the very low price for 7 nights. The unit was very clean and had a comfortable king bed, small sitting area with a table, flat screen TV, microwave, coffeemaker, and small fridge. The bathroom was sufficient in size and very clean. Our balcony was screened-in and was big enough to be considered our "living room" for the week. There were lots of drawers for clothing and a big closet with a safe inside to store valuables. We were very pleased with the room. It even had a few dishes, glassware and silverware. We were able to look at the timeshare unit next to us, and it was much bigger with a dining room and separate bedrooms/living room. For the 2 of us, the hotel unit was just fine. The only big problem we had was there was no ice machine!! You had to walk all the way to the cabana to get ice. This was a pain since it was over 100 degrees and the ice practically melted on the way back to our room. Basically, we had to plan when to get ice (ex. on our way back from dinner when we had our car). We just had to remember to bring the ice bucket with us every time. Smaller problems included housekeeping. They were very noisy in the morning and apparently didn't realize that people may still be sleeping at 8am while on vacation. There was also a small child in the unit above us who enjoying bouncing a ball for about an hour early on the weekend. Otherwise, the night time hours were quiet and peaceful. Our balcony overlooked an awesome wetland and the frogs sounded really cool at night. Every morning there were a couple of cranes (big birds) who would show up and hunt for small fish in the wetland area. Basically, we had a great view. Also, around 10pm nightly, we could see Disney's fireworks from our balcony (in the 900 building). Every morning, there was a skywriter who would write in the sky with his plane (I think he was from the Holy Land Park b/c the phrases were basically all religious) Disney is very close by and there is a shuttle available for 8.00 per person round trip. It was timely, quick, and very easy to use. I was impressed with this service and how much time it saved us in parking. The cabana was fun.
