It served lots of great "pub grub" that was fattening, but eating greasy food on vacation is okay. You could work out the extra fat and calories in the great fitness center. There were 5 or 6 treadmills, 3 ellipticals, free weights, weight equipment, as well as bicycles. Overall, one of the best fitness centers in a hotel I've seen. (And all of the equipment worked with no "out of order" signs to be seen anywhere). The pools were very well maintained and spotless. The one thing to be careful of are the "sheer" pool umbrellas. I ended up getting a bit more sun than desired due to the sheer nature of the umbrellas around the pool areas. Other than that - the 3 pools were awesome! There is a movie theater at Silver Lake Resort, but it played mostly kids films when we were there, so we passed. There is also a cool game room with air hockey, ping pong, and video games. There are also daily activities by the pool daily, we hung out for some of them and had a blast. The activities staff are fun and very energetic! There are tons of chain restaurants nearby, so food is easy to obtain. If you want some really cool food choices, you should go to Celebration. There are neat pubs and wine bars there that provide different options for those who don't have kids. Good shopping there as well. We had no problems with the Wi-Fi, however it was a bit slow at times. The Activities Card available for purchase is worth buying (I think it was 25.00?). Especially if you plan to use Wi-fi in your room. In a nutshell, Silver Lake Resort was clean, friendly, and fun. We'll return one day when we get another good deal!

Reviews.Title: “great extended family vacation”
Reviews.Author: ThegriswaldsfromTex
Reviews.Content: After reading hundreds of hotel reviews,we chose Silver Lake Resort for our 14 family/7 adult /8 children member vacation due to close proximity of amusement parks and amenities we were looking for.They really worked and got us all on 1800 bldg 3rd floor with elevator service. Check in was unbelievable easy and fast.We carried all our groceries from nearby Target on a luggage cart.The left wing had the more updated rooms then the left wing. They were all very clean.I had a one bdrm/full kitchen, large bathroom with hot tub/w/d. One side of the bed was a little too close to the wall facing the window overlooking the pool. We stayed for one week. .The two bdrm/two bath also had the same amenities and accomodated a family of 5 with room to spare.The other wing 1 bdroom partial kitchen rooms were smaller. The beds were very comfortable.The kids loved the pool/jacuzzi and generous snack bar.. They have a movie room and game room.We did not do much of the activities offered at the resort since we were gone most of the day-all amusement parks are practically 10 min away.It was nice to come back to a quiet, serene place after the parks.The service is great-security made rounds on our floor. They are not constantly watching you just watching out for you and we felt safe. Cannot wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “very very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: rickhimm
Reviews.Content: Well to start off with I am a part time travel agent so I have been to alot of places in the world an sometimes I wonder what kind of place am I going to end up at. Let me put your mind at ease. This resort was perfect for me. I say me because your taste may be different. It was what I was looking for. Easy to find, guarded gate, clean, friendly customer service. I stayed in the 1800 building over looking the pool. My room was perfect. Clean, washer n dryer, hot tube bath, full kitchen, screened balcony. Had a great stay . Yes I am going back there soon!! PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake Resort was the highlight!”
Reviews.Author: Janasayqua
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silver Lake thanks to a friend, 7 days $550. We had a 2 bedroom condo on the 1st floor. It was incredible, and so close to the Disney parks! The pools were wonderful, with one within walking distance of our room, and never crowded. The room was spacious and clean. The view was of the parking lot, but really we weren't there for the view. We never had time to do the movie theater or arcade, but upon checking in we received a list of a lot of FUN activities they had throughout the week!! The only downside I'd say is there is no restaurant on site, although the cabana near the pool has food, but again, we nevert tried it. We did have drinks though, those were yummy. I'd definitely go back again, there is no way you could beat the proximity to Disney!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Will definitely return. We were 39, 34 and 5 year old girls!”
Reviews.Author: jchudak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Building 600 in a huge 2 bedroom. We were on the third floor with no stairs, however it was not a big deal at all. Room # 632. Brand new everything....had just been renovated. Pools were clean and grounds were clean with the exception of the staircases up to the condos. Disney is RIGHT there...there is a back gate that takes you to Animal Kingdom in a couple of minutes, Magic Kingdom in 10. It was great to "get away" from the Disneyness honestly! WIFI should be FREE though.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes...Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BailTJulie
Reviews.Content: We try to take our two small children to Florida every year. This year rather than staying at our normal timeshare, we decided to try this our on a RCI exchange. We checked in on Monday and checked out on Tuesday a.m. Maybe if you don't have small kids and like to party all night long you would consider this resort the place to stay. The pool (one pool area) was cloudy, what they call the "kiddy" pool was small, maybe six feet in diameter. The so called "roomy" room couldn't even fit the crib in the two bedroom. CRAZY! It wasn't all that "clean". We filed a report with RCI and they switched us to our normal resort- Vistana on International Drive. Thank goodness our trip was saved.

Reviews.Title: “`Would return anytime.”
Reviews.Author: Lori019
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Silverlake. I booked through RCI extra vacations and received a week for under $300.00. I stayed in the newer section on the last visit near the rear entrance. The unit was fine, nothing fancy however in good condition. This time I request to be near the main pool, which is awesome, since my daughter prefers to stay inside. She is now old enough to leave for short periods however being close to check on her was important. We were assigned a unit on the fourth floor in the 1800 building as requested with a beautiful view of the pool. These are older than some units however location was what was important to us. The only downside was the noise from the pool area early in the morning however it was worth the view and location. The rooms are basic but comfortable and the staff is great. Main pool is huge and they have couple smaller ones also. Very convient location to the parks and the highway. Decent pool snack bar if you don't want to leave resort. Many restaurants very nearby and a Publix grocery store 3 minutes away. Not fancy but a great resort to get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “April 25,2010”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherM2546
Reviews.Content: Just left this resort, I found it to be Aveage at best. There is no Food service at all. Gift shop opens at 8 am and has coffee. The main pool was very nice and not crowded even during a spring break. Pool temp was nicely warm. we did not use.....but has a golf simulator and a small free movie theater. The game room was spacious and had 3 ping pong and 3 pool tables. The kids liked this place very much, adults could use some more amentities. We stayed in building 400 ( through RCI ) and had NO view but of only a road and the ymca across the street. The downfall here were cars going by all night at 50 mph. It was loud. I feel like rci always get the bottom of available buildings and dont know why. So out of a 10, we gave it a 6.5 - 7.0. average and close to disney parks is a big plus here. 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Lots o' fun!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey95
Reviews.Content: I am an 11 year old boy writing this review, just for the record. The resort has an amazing pool, and it even has a volleyball net! One great thing about this resort is that it is very close to Disney World! (only about a five minute drive). The rooms are huge, and the dining room was amazing! If you like basketball like me, there's a basketball court close by. There's an ice cream sundae stand at the side of the pool, and there's also hoola-hooping, and dancing.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!! Would stay here again for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: shafferfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010 for our disney vacation and the resort was absolutly amazing! We had a 2 bedroom condo with a jacuzzi tub! The room was beautiful and the balcony was great too! The room we had was in the 300 building and seemed to be updated. I have no complaints at all the pools were nice and warm and the poolside cabana was great too! We had a 10, 8, 1 year old with us and this was really nice for all of us! Staff was friendly and fast!

Reviews.Title: “Aging ungracefully”
Reviews.Author: AineFlorida
Reviews.Content: Staff was attentive, helpful and friendly. The niceties end there. The room was worn, peeling, paint, blinds falling down, MOLD (excessive) in the bathroom. Let the front desk know and there seemed to be no concern. Lots of noise 12;45 pm at the badketball court. Trashcans overflowing, trash and leaves in the pool, paint on buildings peeling ' and faded. Close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work.”
Reviews.Author: micdic10
Reviews.Content: Had requested & been assured by our time share co. that we had a KING size bed. When we arrived, we had a king sized frame w/ a queen size mattress. We consistently fell over the frame & wound up w/ bruises. When our t-s rep called, we mentioned it to her. She said she would send some extra pillows up to cushion the edges (?). They never came. Bed tilted back toward the wall & mattress was terrible. We knew we had a hotel room, but did not expect to have to pay extra for anything over 3 days of coffee, when we were staying a week. One packet of sweetner for the week also seemed strange. The Wednesday towel replacement appeared on Tuesday when a man knocked on our door, & asked if we needed to change towels. He replaced some bath towels with hand towels. Oh, well. Nice balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: dommi_10
Reviews.Content: we Travelled with 3 adults and 1 kid and 2 teens. the first night there the 3 of the kids had an allergic reaction. The Mananger did not come up till about half hour and said it was only the chlorine (which we were in it long before the reaction). I (one of the teens) had a reaction for the next 2 days. We think it is the balnkets that gave us the allergic reaction and we are not allergic to anything. Also, we asked for blankets for the pull out coutch (whick we were all on when we had the reaction and no one else went on them since -except the 3 of us :P ) and they did not come we called beck again later and it took like 4 hours for them to come. so we did not have the best stay. But the Pool was AWSOME!!!!!!!!! I stayed in thet like ALL day once. Be careful in the rooms. We had room 1860A on floor 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Rooms, Very Close to Disney, and friendly service- Going back Oct 2010!”
Reviews.Author: LiviWS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one bedroom condo for our first wedding anniversary trip through the Armed Forces Vacation Club and we had a great stay! I understand some people may be unhappy with some things, however, for our needs it was great. Check in was extrememly smooth, we received one phone call for a timeshare meeting/tour but when we told them we weren't interested we weren't bothered again. You get a pass to put on the dashboard of your car so the security guards no you're staying there and you're asked to stop upon entering to just say hi and to make sure your pass was still good. I felt safe at Silver Lake which was a small concern for me, but I was very comfortable. The kitchen in our one BR condo was stocked very well with pots, pans, plates, bowls, utensils, and a tea kettle among other things. If you're a go with the flow kind of traveler who doesn't need the newest kitchen tools and aren't about to whip up a culinary feast the kitchen was a great tool for us. We saved a ton of money by preparing and eating easy dinners(ziti, chicken ceasar salads, baked chicken breasts with veggies) back at our condo instead of eating out around there or in Disney. The location outside resort property is a little tacky, but once you're on resort property it's very well taken care of. There was construction happening at the time, and I understand it is still happening, but in the 900 building we were not bothered with construction noise at all. There is a Publix maybe 2 miles up 192 and a super target as well which was so convenient for booze runs, food runs, or for any other miscellaneous needs we had during the trip. I truely felt at home at Silver Lake which is important for me when I travel. You will definitely need a rental car to get around. The furniture in our room had a couple small stains. The room smelled clean, the bathrooms were immaculate(and I'm a clean freak, and the beds were extrememly comfortable, but after being in Disney parks all day I could've slept on the tile if I had to. If you can, I would ask during booking your reservation if you can be in one of the newer buildings. We stayed in 900 and it was great. All in all it was a great trip, and we just booked another 1 BR condo to return to go to Disney's Halloween festivities this October.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Canuck9999
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days and 4 nights... The new condo's being built are just beautiful. The condo units they put you in for the tour are ok. Nice but small... The lady that did the presentation to us was totally amazing...Hats off to her...Great place to be very centrally located with tons of amentities for the teenagers to do...

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: tdo321
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was partially the weather, there 2/26-3/05. Got real cold in the evenings. Stayed in the 1700 block, the rooms need some updating. I have heard other sections are better. Worn furniture, time to replace when the veneer is peeling. Landscaping seems to contain many dead plants, perhaps the recent weather has played a hand. Very convenient to Disney and parks. Plenty of standard food joints close by. Certainly not overly impressed. Keep your belongings locked in the room safe or with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, high quality apartments”
Reviews.Author: Barrym68
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at the Silver Lake Resort, check in and out quick and easy Apartment was a 2 bedroom sleeps 8 and was huge the lounge dining area was 50 feet by 17 feet, master bedroom had a large bathroom with a bath and large shower room with rainforest type shower head and a second bathroom next to the other bedroom. TV in every room. good quality air conditioning, the weather was very cold when we arrived and we turned it on heat and it was hot in no time. Location just of the 192 west and very close to Animal Kingdom and the other parks via a short cut at the back of the resort, Animal Kingdom was les than 10 minutes door to door. Large heated outdoor swimming pool, Gym and onsite shop helped to make this a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Third time visitor if that tells you anything”
Reviews.Author: ChezTom
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Silver Lake Resort and we have enjoyed the accommodations each time. Since I prefer not to eat at restaurants most of the time on trips, I was pleased with the kitchen and supplied utensils...though I found it odd that the only knives available were steak knives(not too useful for cutting larger items). This is a small thing, but for one who enjoys cooking, it was irritating enough to cause me to buy a larger knife while down there. There is a very nice main pool with a cabana and poolside entertainment some of the days. Our condo was a two bedroom in the 600 building and was very spacious for the five of us though there is extensive mirroring on the walls and the bathroom jacuzzi has been there a while. We didn't use it, so it really didn't matter. Overall, a better than decent place, reasonably priced with a very nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “ehh... it was ok”
Reviews.Author: angelea1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Silverlakes through RCI, so cant really comment on the price. it is great for the location if you are going to the parks, 10 to 20 minute drive to the major theme parks. unfortunately I was in florida when its been the coldest temps in a decade so the resort was really quiet, rarely anyone in the pools or hottub they did have the pools heated, but for me, it was too cold to walk outside from my building to the pool and back again in a wet suit a warning for if you are planning to do the timeshare presentation for free/discounted tickets- they tell you it will be 60-90 minutes, but be prepared to be there for several hours- it was very long and i didnt even ask any questions to extend it- thats just how long it is. i had planned to go somewhere afterwards, and it took so long that i couldnt make it. so only do it if you really dont mind giving up a chunk of your day (oh and the free food was barely edible- i went later in the morning and everything was cold and hard- so i took fruit) also they only have 4 computers at the resort and you can only be on the computers for 30 min, the computers are very slow and you can only have one webpage open at a time. if you have a laptop, they want you to pay for the password to connect to the internet, which i thought was a rip off and refused to do it. there are a lot of places to eat around the corner, but you do have to drive there i had a minifridge in the room which was enough for juice/pop/sandwich meat etc. the room was pretty small, nothing to great- on the timeshare presentation they show you beautiful rooms, but im not sure how many are like that on the resort, so if you are ok with subpar rooms beacuse you wont be spending much time in them, its fine (again- i was stuck in the room because of the weather) also fyii- they only change your towels once during the week and dont change your sheets or empty the garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Stay, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlamourPhotography
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silver Lake Resort over Christmas and New Years. The hotel was very nice and clean. We booked through our timeshare. The Kitchen is well stocked with things you would need to cook and eat. The bed was very comfortable and the layout of the resort is very nice. We didn't take advantage of some of the things the hotel has to offer but thought it was great that the had a movie theatre and golf simulator, the games room looked like there was lots to do there. One night we decided to rent a movie from the activites centre and they brought a dvd player right up to the room. Security is fantastic at the resort, very friendly. The location is fantastic, you are only a couple of minutes from all the Disney resorts, and back onto Animal Kingdom. We watched the fireworks from our balcony on New Years Eve. I only have a few complaints about the hotel, first the wireless was not working in the rooms. We bought an activities card so we could have wireless and a few other things, like a paper monday to friday, 15% off food at the Cabana restaurant, and some other things. We spent a lot of time trying to get the wireless working, and in the end it never was fixed, they took the card back and gave us our money. I think they should have let us keep the other discounts for our time. The rooms are close together, you go through one door and then there is an "A" and a "B" room, the people staying in the room beside us would walk through the doors and slam them, and a lot of the time wouldn't shut the outside door at all. They also checked out before us and the maids came to clean it and were also very noisey. All in all this is a great hotel, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The alternative to overpriced Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Orlando-FanUS
Reviews.Content: After big disappintments staying at Disney Reosrts on previous years I decided to stay outside Disney grounds this time. My wife and I travel with small children, so a place with a full kitchen and laundry is a plus. Silver Lake Resort is very conveniently located a few minutes away from the parks (behing Animal Kingdom actually), and it has a back gate that will help you get to the parks without having to drive along the crowded I4. It only took me 10 minutes to drive to Magic Kingdom, and other parks were even closer. It only takes about 20 minutes to drive to Universal and Sea World. The place is very safe, gated and guarded 24/7. I got a 1 bedroom with full kitchen with a pull-out sofa bed. The place was very clean and well equipped with a washer and dryer in the room. Keep in mind that this is a time-share, but unless you got your room with one of their promotions your are not commited to the sales pitch breakfast. Overall, this place was so much better than any ot the Disney Dleuxe resorts I have stayed at that I'll stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!! Will Definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Juls1066
Reviews.Content: Many will say, "When you go to Disney World, you are only in your room to sleep." I would agree with that statement to a degree, however our original plans had us traveling with our 2 children (ages 4 and 14) and my mother in law, so the space of the 2 bedroom / 2 bath (roommate split) unit was a necessity. We were literally a stones throw from Animal Kingdom and found the rooms to be extremely comfortable - almost homelike. Now it is true that they ask you if you'd be interested in attending a 90-minute meeting including breakfast to talk more about the facility (time-share), however they didn't pressure us to attend. After finding out that it was a one on one encounter we opted out, even though the $150 cash was a tempting offer. I would say that my only gripe about this place was when they say check-out is at 10:00 AM they MEAN IT! We were packing up some last minute things and the housekeeping people were already coming in to clean the room! Not to mention there was a couple outside in the hallway, they didn't LOOK like housekeeping to me but obviously wanted into the room. So much for 4:00 PM check in!!!!! That aside, it was a GREAT place and I would recommend it to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney Animal Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: Kutaisi
Reviews.Content: I booked Silver Lake with Armed Forces Vacation Club. No problem, excellent rate. Chose SL because of proximity of Disney. I requested a room with a view of the Tree of Life. No problem, my room was changed to Bldg 1000, 4th Floor. We watched the nightly fireworks from our apartment. We could watch the Tree of Life and Mount Everest. The were some large trees in on the north side of the building, which could provide shade in the summer, but blocked the view from the living room. Bedroom windows and balcony had a great view. Clean and well maintained apartments. Helpful front desk. There was a free internet cafe if you did not want to pay the $10 per day/$25 per stay wireless fee. The kitchen was well equiped for normal light cooking. DVD player and 3 TVs. Washer and dryer let us travel lighter. We were at SL in mid November 2009. Never used the AC or heat. The location off of US 192 west of I-4 was great. Shops and restuants close by, but not traffic on Black Lake Rd. The back gate on Shereberth Rd is only a half mile from Disney property. Traffic was light. Two of our friends were to fly back home on Thursday. Instead of leaving Disney and driving them to the Orlando Airport, they caught the LINX (city bus) from Magic Kindom to the airport. $2 regular fare and $1 for our frient over 65. We waved good-bye from the MK Transportation Center, and continued our vacation. I read reviews prior to booking. Of course some folks thought SL was a vacation in hell while other thought the were in heaven. I know I was in a fine resort with a team of associates that know how to make you feel at home. When/if something went wrong, they were quick to fix the problem. The batteries one of the TV remotes needed replacing. In minutes it was back in service. The only suprises we had were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: 2cubaigo
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at this resort October 25-November 1st. It was a wonderful spot - can't understand what there is to complain about. Our unit in the 400 building was spacious with a king size bed, whirlpool tub and separate shower as well as 2 queen size sofa beds and a second full bathroom. The room was well equipped, fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, coffee pot, pots, pans, dishes, etc. and loved the fact there was a washer dryer! The decor was beautiful - granite countertops in the kitchen and bathrooms, large glass dining table with 6 chairs - it was a beautiful unit! The staff were extremely helpful as we did have a medical emergency and they couldn't have done any more to assist us!!! The location is what really sold us on this resort - we would definitely return! It was less than 5 minutes to Animal Kingdom and no more than 15 to Downtown Disney. It was the perfect spot for access to all Disney venues. It was extremely close to shopping, dining, etc. Overall a great location, a great resort and great staff! Thanks Silver Lake Resort for making our stay so perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Very Close to Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: Nibletsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silver Lake Resort for a trip to Disney World. It was amazing. We booked through the Armed Forces Vacation Club and were a little worried about the place since we were getting such a great deal. When we got there is was more than I could ever expect. We stayed in a 1 bedroom and it was very clean and very well equipted. Our unit had a full kitchen with dishes, dishwasher and all the goodies and things you could want. It had a fabulous bathroom with a huge tub and seperate shower. The living room in the unit had a large flat screen tv, a couch, tables and chairs. From our screened in balcony we could see Expedition Everest - a newer rollercoaster ride and Disney's Animal Kingdom. We loved sitting out there at night watching the fireworks and just enjoying the weather. Silver Lake has 2 pools that are very nice and usually not busy at all, they have a tiki bar and a small food area around the larger pool. We just had so much fun and can't wait to go back. The location is great as well, only 1/2 mile from Disney World, close to shopping, dining and all kinds of attractions and fun things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms Nice pool Some downsides”
Reviews.Author: lp1962
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in the 9000 building. Great view of the wetlands on the 4th floor. Feel sorry for others on the first floor facing the parking lot. The room was great. I had a 2BR. Both had king size beds. The one suite had a Jacuzzi tub and a separate shower. The location is great for Animal Kingdom. To get to Downtown Disney it is more of a ride. There is a pool next to the 9000 building. The bigger pool is next to the business center/check-in area. For the second week I paid for the Internet access ($25 + tax) so I could use my own laptop. The computers in the business center were horrible, constantly crashing. Service was OK. A lot of younger workers. Seemed more interested in talking to each other or texting friends. Felt like I was interrupting them. Received several calls for the dreaded timeshare presentation, but never attended. The back entrance (Sherbeth Rd) is less than a mile from Disney property. I did have a problem trying to come back in. Usually no one there and out of 4 cards, none worked on the gate. Always had to call and get someone to open the gate. One night no one was there and I had to pull out and drive to the other entrance. Never used the back entrance after that. Very cold in the elevator buildings. It was ~90 outside and I left the AC off since the rest of the building was kept so cold. Great place for families, but I would probably not return as I would prefer a smaller resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Fielddaisie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort close to everything Disney . We could even watch fireworks from our balcony each night! Spacious rooms modern decor and a very comfortable bed. The full kitchen is great for saving money on food. Such a wonderful place for so little money. The staff is very friendly and the grounds are very peaceful and well planned . We loved Silver Lake and can't wait to go back! Excellent family vacation spot! .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort - No Bugs”
Reviews.Author: cheryl6202
Reviews.Content: Being Military we booked our 2 day stay through Armed Forces Vacation Club and got an awesome price. This was our first time ever using AFVC. This place was GREAT! It is located between Marker 6 & 7 which means your about 1 mile from Disney and about 20 mins from Seaworld. We had a one bedroom, full kitchen, livingroom, screened in porch, full bathroom and washer/dryer. It was very clean. The king size bed was very comfortable and the sheets must of been at least a 400 count. Very soft and clean. We stayed in building 1000 on the 1st floor with a side view of the pool and woods. The pool we were near is not the main pool area, so it was very quite, more for the adults. The main pool area is huge. We didn't use either but I was told the water was nice. They also have a Theater which shows 2 movies a day (free). Game room with pool tables, pin ball machines and arcade games. Fitness room (free). Computer room with about 5 computers and 2 printers (free). Xbox tournaments, bead making classes, pool side dancing and there's a DVD rental box, tennis court and basketball. The list goes on with all they offer. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The service desk is not pushy about owning a Time Share. When we checked in they asked us if we would like to go to a free breakfeast the next day for about 1 1/2 hrs and we could get $100. The good ole Time Share meeting. We said no and they were ok with it. They never tried to convience us to do anything. I'm not sure about the other's bad reviews but this was a great place. Maybe if they were in a different building they would of had better luck. I was told that our building 1000 was one of the newer buildings. Very simple, no fancy decorting, very clean and simple. The only one thing I would recommend to the staff is that they have more towel hangers in the bathroom and a clock in the kitchen or living room area. The only clock they had was a small alarm clock on the night stand next to the bed. Our room was quite. We never heard anyone. The location is off 192, Which is a main strip that has several stores and places to eat. You don't have to go far for anything. Can't wait to go back for a longer stay. Ask for Building 1000

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful timeshare experience- clean- close to WDW- comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JJWilson
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location- arrived on Sat. early afternoon- had my rented stroller delivered to hotel and it was waiting for us- hotel kept our luggage in storage until our room was ready- peaceful check-in- no pressures- convenience store with large selection of goods- more pricey then outside the complex but convenient- pools were great- tiki bar had food and drinks- open late- We were literally 2 minutes from Animal Kingdom- extremely convenient to all WDW destinations- out the back gate and you are on your way with not much traffic to speak of. Pleasant staff in all aspects- maintenance issues were dealt with promptly and curtiously, internet access very easy to sign up for, front desk staff was great- activities center is well maintained and good to have something for the kids to do in a down time. Pools were clean, cozy and safe. Our 2 bedroom condo was great- huge is another word for it- we stayed in Bldg 300 which is an older unit- well worth it- much larger then the viewed newer rooms- huge kitchen with sufficient stock- large 2nd bedroom, flat screen TV, with full bath- laundry right there and then a large dining area and living room with DVD and TV, screened balcony. Master bedroom (suite) had a great bed, space- TV, and the bathroom was wonderful- fully tiled shower- separate jacuzzi tub- separate facilities and then large vanity area. I could not have been more happier with our accommodations. We did opt to do the 90min timeshare sales- the breakfast offered was a BIG DISAPPOINTMENT- but that aside the sales people were friendly, no pressure- and stuck to the time slot- just be firm- we have been previous owners and that closed the session for us real quickly. It was good to hear about the facilities from their standpoint and we were offered cash for the time- so it was a win - win for all. I will definately go back to Silver Lake Resort with out a doubt. I highly recommend the grounds for convenience to WDW- inexpensive accommodations, easy in and out, quality of service. Of course we traveled in an off time of year- and am sure it can be pretty different in the summer; however- you have the choice. Thank you Silver Lake for a splendid vacation of 8 days with twin 6yr old girls, family that came up from West Palm.

Reviews.Title: “Great people. Great Location - not good design....”
Reviews.Author: WinthropMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on timeshare points in a 1 bedroom in the 300 block. There is a lot of great about Silver Lake - The people who work there are very friendly and helpful! the location is fantastic for Disney! We ate at Boma in Animal Kingdom one night and the car ride was less than 10 min! The main Disney entrance for all parks is about a 10 min drive. the Pool area is large as is the pool itself, clean and the bar is nice with music and good ambience. Very laid back and people were all friendly! For a your typical Orlando area vacation location its a good choice. However there are a lot of flaws in the design of the buildings especially for the one bedrooms. Ours had been updated, I would say in the past few years and all the tiles had a newer feel. Living room and kitchen are combined with small table and chairs, couch with additional chair. TV is in an odd spot in the kitchen but a raised level. The bathroom is a good size with sink and mirror in separate rooms which is a good choice for more than one person getting ready. The area where the place fails badly is the walls are paper thin - our bedroon adjoined the kitchen of a two bedroom and there was not one word you could not hear coming from their unit and I am sure vice verse..... I am not talking about raised voices in anyway. You could even clearly hear individual items being loaded into the dishwasher as if it was in our unit. There was also no window in the bedroom which just feels wrong in design providing not exit except the main door. We were not in the room much so it served its purpose of sleeping and showering but if somebody from Silver Lake is reading these design flaws are the main reason for not attending the timeshare request (which we are in the market for). Maybe give some people your targeting an upgrade to a two bedroom on the condition they attend the talk on timeshare and the result may be better. We will not return however if you are in a 2 bedrooom and can deal with knowing your neighbor a little more than you may care for it could be the right place for you....

Reviews.Title: “Loved Silver Lakes Resort”
Reviews.Author: RobCoutts
Reviews.Content: Before we left for our vacation,I was feeling a bit nervous after reading some of the most recent reviews about Siver Lakes. My wife left it to me,so I was feeling the pressure.We really only have a chance once a year to travel as a family.So I really did not want this to be a horrible experience for my family. When we arrived,the staff was great.They went out of their way to help us get settled in. Originally we had selected a single room with pull-out couch.The room was fantastic,but a bit small.We decided to up grade to a two bedroom.The staff let us look at a couple of diffrent options and settled for a room in the 300 building. Our room was huge, had a brand new kitchen,washer and dryer.The master bedroom had a huge area. Last year we did all the parks,so this time we decided to "RELAX". We spent alot of time around the massive pool area,and loved it! Close to shopping and restaurants. As a family we have decided that we will be returning next year to Silver Lake Resort, Had a great family vacation!!!!!! "GO GATORS"

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lakes Resort - We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Kentuckymimi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Lakes Resort from Sep 5 - 12, 2009 in the 300 Building (second floor). We had a two bedroom, 2 bath condo with a full kitchen (brand new stove), washer and dryer (stackables), pull out couch in the living room and a dining room. The table and end tables were made of glass and the floors, except in the bedrooms were tile. My grandson thought this was great because he could slide the furniture across the floor. We went to Orlando to go to the Disney Parks and we booked our condo throught the Armed Forces Vacation Club. We arrived at Silver Lakes Resort at 2:00 on Saturday and after going through the security gate, we stooped in the main office to see if we could check in a little early. Carmen helped us out and she was very nice and pleasant. She told us we could check in right away into a two bedroom without a screened in porch or wait until 4:00. We chose to wait til four and my husband and grandson went swimming while the rest of us went to the nearby Super Target to get groceries. When we checked in at four we were asked if we would be interested in a time share sales pitch (offered $80) for tickets to a park. We declined and there was no pressure to attend. Just told us that if we changed our mind to let them know. This is a private time share group so they are going to try and get you to attend. But since we already had our park attendance planned out we declined. They called and left a message at midweek, very pleasantly, and we declined again. We chose a condo so we could cook some meals and have snacks and just have more room. We had 5 adults and 2 children - 2 1/2 and 5 months. The master bedroom had a king bed that was very comfortable and plenty of room. The master bath was huge with a walk in shower and a tub with a jacuzzi (which we never used). The second bedroom was a little smaller with two double beds but the baby's pack and play fit easily at the end of one bed and the door still closed. My daughter slept on the pull out couch and said it wasn't all that comfortable. It would have probably been fine for a child, but not an adult. In the middle of the week they have a towel exchange and a trash pickup. But, we just took out the trash each day and washed the towels. This is why we wanted a condo. This was an awesome deal for us. Plenty of room, plenty of parking. We had to walk to the pool but it was really nice - heated, not croweded, with a nice hot tub. If you are looking for someone to make your bed everyday, and room service so you don't have to do anything, then this is not the place for you. Also, we didn't see any bugs. We saw a few frogs outside the door but this is Florida and it is warm most of the year, so there will be lizards and frogs outside. Also, they had a great activity center which you won't get at a hotel. For internet service you can either pay $10 a day or we paid about $25 for the week for two users and that came with some discount coupons. They also have activities for kids even though we did not try these. If you have a family and you want a close place to Disney then this is a great place. The Super Target near the condos has all kinds of T shirts and souvenirs for half the price of the stuff inside the parks. The only place we did not like near the resort was the Golden Corral. It was the filthiest place I have ever eaten in. Avoid it if at all possible. Very dirty and crowded. It was like playing football to get to any food. We really enjoyed Silver Lake Resort and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again - even if we weren't going to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...... No frills.”
Reviews.Author: MPMechanic
Reviews.Content: I booked a room and requested the 1700 buidling, they did manage to put me in it. I had been told on the phone that I had a 5th floor room, but when I checked in found out that I had been moved to a 1st floor room due to a VIP checking in.... What constitutes a VIP???? Well the room was the same just on the ground floor. Where they lacked was in the service department. We stayed for 2 days in a hotel style lock off before moving into out regular room. They told us they would expidite the move, hovever on the morning of the move they wanted us ouf of our room but couldn't garantee when the new room would be cleaned and ready. They wanted us to bring our lugage to the desk untill it was ready. We protested they told us to stay in our room until the new room was ready. Hours later I went down to ask and they told me that the room was still not ready. When I protested that they had wasted several hours of our vacation they told me that I could have gone out done whatever we wanted then returned the room would have been ready.... Only problem was they took the key cards from us. All in all this is a time share and not a hotel, so the room was worth what was paid but there is no service in the time share business.... Location was nice and so was the decor in the room..... Would book again but in the same room for the entire stay. Would have booked the same room we arived 2 days early and they wanted way too much for the room to stay straight through so I guess it's live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Disney World with resort atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: icdastar
Reviews.Content: Silver Lake Resort is a timeshare resort, so expect an invitation to a timeshare presentation which you can turn always turn down. As a resort it offers many activities for kids and the family. There are large pools where people hang out late into the night, but the walls of the rooms are thin so you can here people in the pool. The location of this resort is perfect and is as close to Disney World as you can be without actually being owned by the Disney resorts. It sits behind the Animal Kingdom Park and down the street from Hollywood Studios, which is so convenient when you want to get to beat the rush of people to the park. It's also close to a Super Target where you can get any food or supplies that you forgot or may need for the week. The rooms vary from updated with granite counter tops to older looking rooms. Some rooms contain a large enjoyable jacuzzi bath tub and a shower. The rooms are spacious and there is a kitchen with a dining area for a family sit down dinner. The kitchen is fully stocked, and even has tupperware for your leftovers which is great, if you want to save money. Oddly they charge for wireless and they charge for extra amenities which are normally complimentary (ie. shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc). They also have a washer/dryer. The resorts entrance is guarded by security guards, which helps secure the place. Overall, the place was enjoyable and would be even better if it had free wifi and all the rooms were updated and had thicker walls.

Reviews.Title: “You can't stay closer to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: saraben
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a three bed apartment in block 1700. It suited us perfectly. The apartment was large and well equipped, with two families sharing it was great to have two washer/driers. You have to sign for your pool towels and return them at the end of the week. We would have preferred to have fresh ones every day, but that was the only adverse comment.

Reviews.Title: “Really terrible place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lizzie385
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Silver Lake... and while I was sad that vacation was over, I was thrilled to be leaving this place. We had a 2 bed/2 bath unit with a full kitchen, which in theory would have been great for my family (husband, 3 year old and 18 month twins) and my in-laws. However, the second bedroom wasn't even big enough to put a pack n' play, let alone 2 of them.... in fact, you could barely walk around the bed. The tv was mounted on one of those hospital style tv thingys (don't believe the pics they show with flat-screens- they were nowhere to be found). So, we had to boot my in'laws out of the master bedroom (slightly bigger) so we could set up the cribs. Which brings me to another issue- they wanted to charge us $35 per crib and $35 just to bring a booster seat to the room. I have NEVER stayed anywhere that charged for a crib. When we first arrived, I was excited. The website (and other travel websites) show new furniture, nice cabinets and granite counters in the kitchens and luxurious baths - they actually say "luxurious" on the website. DON'T beleive it!! This is a bait-and-switch! When we got to our unit- through musty hallways that smelled like an old pool storage closet- we were seriously disappointed. First, our air conditioner was broken and it was 85 degrees in there... not fun in the Florida heat. When we called maintenence they sent 2 very nice gentlemen to fix it (and that was the best part about the resort- the maintenence guys). However, it was hot in our unit for the rest of the evening. Everything here was dated, it looked like the Golden Girls living room with all of the bamboo furniture. The tile was gross, our feet were filthy just from walking on it barefoot. The kitchen was dirty and old; the appliances were old and very very loud. It was the kind of place where you feel dirty the minute you get out of the shower (which had no water pressure, by the way). Other than the nice guys that came to fix our air conditioning, the only other good things about this resort were the comfortable beds and its proximity to Disney. As for the beds, I'm not sure if they were actually that comfortable, or if they just felt that way after 14 hours at Disney World! If you leave out of the back gate, make a left on Sherberth Road, then a right on Osceola Pkwy and you are on Disney property in 2 minutes. We could even see Animal Kingdom from our room. Too bad I will never stay here again, it was so close.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: roxie1679
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an exhange with my parents time share and we were sorely disappointed. They made a point of saying they were a royal crown resort.....More times than not, our door would not open. We were in the 9000 building and there was no phone in the lobby so we would have to drive down to the receptionist area to have them call security so they could let us in our room. The hallway always had pieces of trash on the floor. At one point, my husband was counting the days that a piece of trash laid in the hall. The room was small, but it was clean. The bed was comfortable. It's close proximity to DW, but if we went back I don't think we would stay here. The staff was generally unfriendly. At one point I asked the bartender if there was different ice cream in the main building and she told me that she didn't know and I would have to go look myself. For a resort that prides themselves on being a royal crown resort and survives on people buying into them, I wouldn't spend my money.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when exchanging timeshares here”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTina
Reviews.Content: We had 2 weeks banked and wanted to take an extended family vacation. We exchanged those for 2 units at SLR for the same week so both families would have plenty of room. We had a one bedroom unit at our home resort. We learned that you have to be very careful to get an equal exchange. One unit (building 1700 unit G) was a true one bedroom and very nice. The other unit (building 1700 unit B) was more of an efficiency unit. It was very small, long and narrow. When we brought this to the attention of the SLR staff we were told there was nothing they could do. The resort was very nice, we did enjoy the stay. We will be more careful in the future to make sure we are getting a fair exchange.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great trip”
Reviews.Author: BethWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 1800. We had 3 one bedroom units. Each of our adult kids and there families had there own room which was great. We were all very comfortable and enjoyed our stay. There are lots of mirrors but, the furniture was arranged to help hide them some what. The furnishings are older but in good repair and the main bed was comfortable. The floors are all tile and our socks did find the dirt left behind. Im sure they were cleaned but not dried with a clean cloth. The staff was very polite and a simple no to the sales pitch was all that was needed. The resort is close to the parks and restaurants which made our trip easy. We had a great week. Try and stay away from the pool side of units it is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: freefam6
Reviews.Content: They have daily activities and nice pool area. You pay for wireless connect. The rooms were spacious, but average in decor. The appliances were mismatched, towels had long pieces of hair on them when unfolded. The key did not always work and half of the cable channels did not work in one bedroom. The staff was very polite about trying to correct some things but other things they had no answer. I was told if I became owner I would get better room, LIES, so I cancelled that and have been waiting a month for refund. OH there were ANTS and BUGS

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travlrwannabe1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Silver Lake Resort from June 5th through JUne 13th. My inlaws were in a 1 bedroom at the back portion of the resort. Room was very nice, had been very recently remodeled and was lovely. Bath amenities were Bath & Body Works. My husband and I spent the first night on their sleeper sofa due to a scheduling conflict (no fault of resort) and as far as sleeper pull-outs go it was tolerable for one night. The only issue with this room was, although the cleaning form was signed and left out in plain view, i noticed that my 2 yr old daughters socks were black and my own feet had actual pieces of lint and dirt on them from the floor. The bathroom sink tub, etc were very clean, but the floor had obviously not been cleaned properly in some time. I reported this to front desk, but no one ever came out to clean. My husband and daughter and I were in building 100, in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath. This was very spacious, the master bath was a dream and it was very clean. Our floors did not have the same grime as other room. The decor could use updating, LOTS of mirrors everywhere gave me a 70's flashback. It had a dishwasher and washer-dryer, which was very handy. Also was right across the street from the main pool, which was convenient, but loud. Pool area is very nice, small kiddie pool with a fountain and a place to get snacks and drinks. Towels provided at pool. The best feature of this resort for our family was the proximity to Disney. We turned left out of resort onto Sherberth Road and made a right onto Oseola and we were on Disney property in less than 5 minutes. We were close enough to walk to Animal Kingdom. I prefer to stay on Disney Propery, but this was the next best thing.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: przbabygurl86
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice and the grounds are well maintained. The staff was pretty nice.. I loved their pool and the fact that it is open til midnight... (There is a bar too!!! :-) ) the rooms are comfortable and my family had fun.. Its near almost every attraction so we had a good time... Very relaxing...

Reviews.Title: “nice room, average resort”
Reviews.Author: Saabi13
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this resort in August of 2004 however this site doesn't allow me to go back further than 2006. The resort was ok, didn't have much to offer other than the normal amenities (pool, game room, etc.). The room was average too but nice. All in all I would recommend it. However, if you are in Orlando to experience disney then this resort is quite a distance from the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for activities and relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: SusanRNMaryland
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a terrific week at Silver Lake -- our first stay there. The "we" are my early-20's daughters and their fiances, as well as moi (mom). We were on the fourth floor of building 1700, right by the main pool, game room, fitness room and computer room (4 PC's, all can print). We had a *huge* 1400 SF 2BR/2BA with a comfortable queen sofa sleeper I could open and close easily. The unit was stocked with "starters" of laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, coffee, etc., a nice convenience. Both bedrooms had screened porches. The larger bedroom had a jacuzzi. The smaller one was part of a "lock-off" and had its own microwave, small refrigerator, kitchen sink, and dishes. There were small flat screen TV's in the bedrooms and a very large one in the living room. Since we were there a whole week, having a washer and dryer in the unit was very convenient. I was favorably impressed with the list of daily activities, including poolside music and ice cream sundaes, and a weekly casino cruise. The teens on premises (and the young men accompanying me) seemed to really enjoy the game room. One of the young men worked out every day in the spacious fitness facility. I loved having the computers available for daily e-mail. An in-room Internet service package is available. Additional towels were available immediately upon request and a free towel exchange was offered on Wednesday. Pool towels were free and could be easily exchanged at the pool office. There were plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas pool side. The poolside snack shop had tasty and reasonable food (only ate there once, though) and a Happy Hour. I was told there is a children's pool and that one pool is heated, but I didn't check them out. I did see a tot lot with a climbing apparatus and a slide. All of the employees I dealt with were friendly. Two problems (needing more dishes and a leak from the air conditioner into a closet) were dealt with quickly. I attended a timeshare purchase presentation but did not feel too pressured. Silver Lake's "back exit" abuts Animal Kingdom [we saw the "auditions" sign] and drops you on the Disney portion of Oceola Parkway in two minutes. Both entrances are gated and staffed. This location is just generally so convenient. In addition to being in Disney's backyard, it's a mile from Publix, 7-8 minutes from a SuperWalmart and 3-4 minutes from I-4, which takes you up to International Drive in 5-15 minutes, depending on which part you need. West [of I-4] SR 192 (W. Irlo Bronson Hwy), one minute from Silver Lake, has a slew of restaurants, both inexpensive and nicer ones, gift shops, a FunSpot (bungee jumping, etc.), and miniature golf, so we found plenty to do for variety. I would choose this Orlando resort over others for location, facilities, and service. Price, of course, varies on your particular deal. Ours was very reasonable, especially since we had five people all together. Susan, R.N.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: getlstwme
Reviews.Content: The condos were amazing! The rooms were spacious and very modern with flat screen televisions. Jetted jacuzzi. the karaoke bar by the pool was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but not homey”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithFour
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the resort. It does everything right, the service is great, but the rooms were not our style. The rooms feature tile, mirrors and lots of glass tables. My sons like to sit on the floors and play and tiled floors are too cold for this, they hated it. My in-laws are slightly hard of hearing and thought the rooms echoed too much. The hot water was WAY too hot, if anyone touched the water or flushed the toilet while someone was in the shower they could be burned. So having two bathrooms was useless, we constantly had to warn everyone not to touch the water before we took a shower. This is a big worry with small children around. The resort is very well staffed and is well run. The pools were nice but boring, just standard pools. We liked the rooms and pools at Calypso Cay better but Calypso Cay's service doesn't come close to Silver Lakes. I bet this is a great resort for older couples.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in Florida”
Reviews.Author: mr_cow
Reviews.Content: This resort was a lovely place to stay, friendly staff, great pools, lovely gardens well kept, felt safe everywhere. We had our own car and GPS so tavelling was easy although we did manage to get lost on the odd occasion.Only 1 thing I found that hopefully overtime could be rectified, glass dining and small tables are a constant worry with small children

Reviews.Title: “Absoulutely Fantastic Family Resort something for every age group!”
Reviews.Author: MYDOG22
Reviews.Content: I'm at a loss as to why people are so harsh with their reviews. We stayed on the forth floor of the 1000 building. Yes it was a short walk to the pool, but it took under 2 minutes with a 5 year old and my mother in tow. It certainly wasn't a great distance. In fact we loved the set up of the resort as you seemed to be close to everything no matter which building you stayed in. The pools were pristine and both the pools and hot tub are all salt water so no yucky chemical smell. The Cabana by the pool was open every day. They not only serve finger food but also have a great variety of "tropical alchoholic drinks" and fancy smoothies with whip cream and a cherry which my 5 year old daughter loved! If you have young adults they had a karoke evening by the pool one night and bingo in the afternoon that every age group (even the "way too cool teens') enjoyed. They have music playing by the main pool most of the afternoon and evening and a quieter pool not far away if you'd rather spend a quiet evening. There is a small store onsight that sells everything from bread to Disney tickets and of course Ice Cream Cones (accessible from the pool area). There is a towel service where you can exchange your wet towels for dry towels which eliminates wet towels hanging all over the bathrooms (this is a free service), the gym is well equipped, and the games room for the kids/teens/adults is lots of fun (includes ping pong, pool tables video games (even classics like pacman) price is reasonable (25 cents per token and most games are 1 or 2 tokens). There is a full week of planned activities for children if you aren't spending all you time at Disney (tie dyeing tshirts, and other crafts, drama evening and show, etc). They had a Casino cruise the first night for adults (didn't go but heard it was good). The staff are very friendly and helpful (helped us up with our luggage) you have an activities coordinator that you are introduced too when you check in (gives you her contact information) that can not only give you directions to something other than "Taco bell" (In fact if you can't find somewhere to eat near this resort you must be driving with your eyes closed! There are restaurants everywhere!) but can also book you discounted tickets to most dinner shows or tours. I think the property is closer to Animal Kingdom than the Animal Kingdom Lodge! The small side road you use to access Disney property is great! The entrances are gated and have an employee at the front gate. We stayed in a one bedroom and it was clean, well stocked, with a washer and dryer, jacuzzi tub, large shower and all the ammenities of a full size modern kitchen. It was clean and well furnished, 2 flat screen tvs and a screened in porch (great for a morning coffee or relaxing in the evening. The King Size bed was amazingly comfortable and the pull out couch was easy to pull in and out and quite comfortable. I will definately stay there again and bring friends and extended family as well. Thanks so much to everyone a Silver Lake for making our trip relaxing and fun

Reviews.Title: “be careful!”
Reviews.Author: sadea786
Reviews.Content: In 2007,We stayed in silver lake resort.we got discount and we had to attend some presentation or tour...we were told that we are under no obligation to buy this time share.anyway it was a big mistake of us to book our vecation through this time share game.long story short,resort was beautiful our saty was ok.but we had to give our credit card to them during the tour presentation as a proof,they retured it (probably after making copies)...when we came back from our vecation to my surprise my credit card was charge for those things i never purchased,and resturants i never went.i was shocked...please becareful when u go for timeshare tour dont give your credit card..you will be robed...

Reviews.Title: “We want to go back!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: quitemad
Reviews.Content: I am really curious as to why so many people wrote so many bad reviews of this awesome place. We are members of a travel club (not timeshare) in Winnipeg, Manitoba and were advised by our travel club that we could stay here in a 2 bedroom condo or a 3 bedroom if available for the same price. We paid $650.00 for 1 week for a HUGE (over 1500 sq. ft.) 2 bedroom condo. We actually only ended up paying $50.00 for the condo, as our contract with this travel club offered us $600.00 cash back on anything we wanted, airfare, hotel, anything so we opted to use it on this condo. We had read some of the bad review and were very afraid to stay here, so I called the resort directly and told of my concerns. They bent over backwards for us and recommended which unit and building to stay in. I changed my mind several times after booking and they changed it for us each time with no problem. They were accessible and friendly. We were in the 300 building, which was an older building, but had been newly renovated and it showed! Brand new kitchen with stainless steel appliances, new granite countertops, beautiful kingsized bed with LOTS of room on either side. Huge 2nd bedroom for the kids with 2 double beds and their own bathroom. A huge master bathroom with jacuzzi tub. Everything was gorgeous. The money we saved making our own meals was incredible. The staff called us on our first night to ask if we were satisfied with everything. We had one small problem with the safe and it was dealt with and fixed in a matter of minutes. The pool was spectacular. The place was deathly quiet and restful and the amenities were great. We were greeted with smiles and very pleasant attitudes the entire time. They basically treated us like royalty and we made friends with many of the staff members. It was incredibly clean and the staff was ready to help us with any request we had in a matter of moments. We have decided to make this our home away from home everytime we visit orlando as it is so close to Animal Kingdom that we feel it is conducive to visits again and again and again. I highly recommend it, especially if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: r0ma09
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the location of this resort. It's located just outside the entrance of the Disney property right near Animal Kingdom. It took less than 5 minutes to get to AK from the resort. There is no traffic at all and the other parks are just as easily accessible (you can get to the parking lots in 10 minutes, 15 min tops). Because of this we were able to take a break in the middle of the day, recharge at the resort, then go back to the parks later in the evening. And because it is located off Hwy 192, you can go to restaurants and fast-food places which are much cheaper than eating on Disney property. A super Target just opened and has everything you need including groceries and souveniers. The room itself was adequate but all we really did was sleep there. Our family of 4 (with 2 preschoolers) was comfortable. We didn't even get a chance to participate in any of the activities that were available but I appreciate the fact that the resort offered them. We liked that you can only get in through a security guard. The staff wanted us to participate in a sales presentation but weren't pushy by any means when we declined. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: ATW1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of March in the 1000 building. I didn't start reading reviews until after I had book this resort, not sure why some people were so harsh. The room was clean, everything worked just fine and the staff were friendly. We stayed on the first floor in a one bedroom which was kind of cramped for 4 adults but that was our own fault for not booking a 2 bedroom. Our unit had a screened in patio, full kitchen, washer & dryer, a king size bed in the bedroom and a pull out queen size bed. We didn't have maid service, but I think you could have it for a fee. Didn't really see a need for it though they give you all the tools to keep things clean except a vacuum. We didn't have access to the internet in our room but could access it in the lobby, by the pool, or in the activity center. They had a fitness center, tennis courts, basketball court, and a cabanna by the pool that sold food and drinks, don't know much about it because we just brought our own food to the pool or walked back since it was so close. There was a pool on the side of our building and one directly across the street, both were clean and well kept. They have activities for the children throughout the day, it's no disney but if you want to skip the parks and just hang out in the pool its nice they set up activities. Very close to disney and 192, which has everything including a publix and a new super target. Florida mall, mall at millenia and two outlet malls are within 10-15 mintues. All in all I through it was a great resort and have nothing to compalin about, if we go back to Orlando I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So So at best......”
Reviews.Author: Bowling_Guru
Reviews.Content: This resort was ok. Furnishings in rooms are outdated. Single room was small. Set up of the buildings is not good if you want a place that you can walk out of your place and be 10 feet from the pool. There are no ground level rooms onsite that I saw which makes it inconvienent because you are always having to wait for an elevator. Didnt like the fact that there are no ice machines in any of the buildings, if you want ice you have to go down to the cabana by the pool (good luck getting it too because they were not open one day during my trip the hours that are posted) 80 degree days and the cabana was closed by 6pm at the latest (suppose to be 11pm). The staff at Silver Lake was ok at best. One evening I went to the main desk to ask where I could find some good mexican food (keep in mind that the 2 individuals behind the desk were of spanish decent), their response.... "Try Taco Bell". I couldnt believe it until I realized they were serious. The only upside to the place is if you have a bad weather day.... call down to guest services and ask for Cindy and tell her you would like to come down and sit thru thier timeshare presentation (takes exactly 1 hour and you will get free breakfast, or lunch), after you are all done and tell them no thanks, they will hand you $80 cash and you will be on your way. (Not bad... make $80 in a quick hour and get free breakfast rather then spend it sitting on your bed watching tv). All in all this resort was ok but I really dont think I would recommend it to anyone. Much much nicer places in the area and also much much nicer places closer to the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: ymetzcus
Reviews.Content: When we were offered a couple of free nights to check out this resort for a timeshare thing, we were excited because we had been looking to get one. Well, you would think if they were trying to encourage people to buy here they would put you up in a nice room so you could check things out. Our bathroom floor and floorboards were dirty with hair and dirt, the toilet wouldn't work from the moment we checked in, the coffee table was broken and had been taped together, the whole place looked like it just hasn't been upkept very well if often at all. When we talked to someone about our room they admitted that it's just a rental they stick people in when they come to check things out and they don't really take care of them very well. Which leads me to wonder how well they actually take care of the rest of the resort if they don't care about first impressions? To top it all off I left something in the room, my fault but not the point, i called immediately after we checked out, we would still be in town a few days, and they said it had not been turned in to give it a few days. I called repeatedly for updates, they never called me, and they said their cleaning crew was supposed to turn things in. So what I gather is that it is there custom to allow there cleaning people to steal because I can't prove that I left it there. I would definitely not recommend this resort to anyone. You also have to pay like $30 a week for internet, that's more than i pay a month!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WiRealtor
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Silver Lake.We loved the resort and the location to Disney. We stayed in the 900 building and it was newer and very clean.Pool area was very nice and made new fiends in the hot tub.We would love to go back. My kids loved the pools and had a blast. The only negative is the tables in the room are glass and the edges could be bad for small kids. We blocked all corners with chairs ( no big deal). Brian from Wisconsin.

Reviews.Title: “ok i guess”
Reviews.Author: rosrog
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from jan. 18th to 25th . our room was in the 1800 building pool side thr 2 br/2 bath was plenty big with jaccuzi tub in main room the king size bed left about 6" on each side but that was ok the unit was big enough the patio screened in and nice. by crossing the street it was in walking distance of plenty of stuff . i didn't like the fact that we were poolside altho some think this is great but having kids screaming and people hooping it up until 11 oclock and later at nite isn't our cup of tea i probably would have preferred a parking lot view the staff was very friendly and the resort was well kept

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Not looked after!”
Reviews.Author: JDTravelCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for Five Nights while we spend time at Disney. It is quite dirty and not well looked after. We knew ahead of time it was a timeshare resort but I was expecting a little better. The lobby(or place you check-in) is terrible. Most resort's work extra hard to make the lobby area extra nice to fool the customers. After you check in you get set up for a time so they can try to sell you a timeshare. When we finally arrived at our room( if you can figue out which building you in) we had problems with our keys. Also I guess if your are not a timeshare owner they put you on the top corner as far away from everything as you possibly could be. Now this place is not the worst resort out their but it does have many problems. We have been the hotels before and had simply problems (Keys, bugs, dirty areas, etc) but when I contacted the lobby they didn't seem to care. This resort is close to Disney, Shopping, Dining.......But then again so are the other 200 or so Hotels/resorts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance but had dirty feet!”
Reviews.Author: Runner777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Silver Lake Resort through an exchange with RCI. Had read many of the posts and knew what to expect. We have been to other RCI resorts in the past and were somewhat disappointed with SLR. As noted in other posts, the floors were dirty! Our socks and feet were black when walking across the carpets which didn't leave you with a nice clean feeling of the unit. The units were spacious and enough room for our family and friends. We stayed in the 900 building in a 3BR unit so we had plenty of room. The sofa beds were in pretty bad shape with springs/supports missing. The sheets for the sofa beds were not fitted which pulled out all week. Luckily the kids had them so they didn't complain much. I wouldn't want to sleep on them for the week. The overall quality of the resort was average and we didn't spend much time around there since we were at the parks (very clean!!) most of the time. The pools were nice and the check out pool towels were much better than our room towels. Overall quality of the rooms/furniture/fixtures were average and nothing to brag about. The staff was helpful, but it is obvious that Disney gets the first cut at the best staff around. Our keys did not work several times which was frustrating. Finally gave up when we got one of the many to work. The best thing about this resort is its location. It is only about 1/4 mile from Animal Kingdom and getting to the other Disney parks was a breeze. We didn't necessarily have a "bad" experience, but I would likely search elsewhere to find something cleaner or nicer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Service for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: surfered
Reviews.Content: Rented a 1 bedroom Condo for a week thru an online auction site. For the price I paid it was good. What we liked: >Pools were awesome, clean and well heated >Service and Security was very good >Location was great, just a few clicks from Animal Kingdom, close to grocery stores etc >Kitchen appliances were all brand new and kitchen was well stocked >It was clean What was OK >We were in a new re-furbished room and the workmanship was a little sloppy. Paint on the base boards, toliet paper role kept falling off, plug in the tub not hooked up right...just the little things that made me think I would not want to own here if this was a brand new room.... >Washer/Dryer was a bit older and not vented properly so it took a long time to dry clothes As I said, for the price I paid I thought it was good vaule. I worry a bit that the construction crews they have are not up to snuff. Also I would request another building besides 4 since it backs on to Sherberth Road. We spent allot of time by the pools and the staff were great. They called us few times for the time share presentation but I just didn't answer the phone and they didn't push. I would stay again as long as I could get the same price but not pay more. I would not buy here based on what I oberved as the quality of the renovation...IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT-RESORT, perfect stay one of best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: peterboro1
Reviews.Content: Our family checked in on Jan. 4, 2009 and stayed in the 1000 Building, our whole stay was perfect. Silver Lake Resort is fantastic. Check in/ check out was simple, front desk staff was professional and courteous. The main pool area is spectacular! Especially in the evening after the theme parks. It is in front of the 1800 building and next to the 1700 building. There is a smaller, quiet pool near the 1700 building. The main pool is huge, clean, not crowded and has enough beach chairs and towels for everyone. The cabana bar at the main pool provides music and entertainment, serves food and great drinks. There is a nice size hot tub at the main pool area. The rooms at Silver Lake are large and very clean. We stayed in the 1000 building in a 2 bedroom, 2-bathroom unit. The room was very clean. No odors, no bugs! Air conditioning worked well. Beautiful, new furniture and comfortable, clean mattresses and bedding. The master bathroom is large and has a Jacuzzi tub for two! The kitchen has all appliances and everything you need including a dishwasher and the washer and dryer is a perfect convenience. The balcony area off of the unit is screened in. I was able to access wifi from the balcony for free. Plenty of parking close to the building. The trash room on each floor of the building is clean, and emptied often so there are no trash smells! The elevators were great and you can take the stairs. Silver Lake Resort also has a movie theater and game room. Silver Lake Resort has a well equipped, and well maintained, gym and work out center with an awesome weight room, cardio machines and sauna. There is an activities center with a huge arcade and game room! A computer room with internet access. The resort provides a list of organized and directed activities for kids and families to participate in each day. Best of all, you can walk to everything. No driving and parking. The sales tour we attended to get a deal on the room price was a little longer than advertised but I didn't even notice the time as it was so informative, especially how RCI works. The sales representatives are informative and not at all pushy. We didn't purchase a timeshare and no one bothered us about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mysticwind
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to be able to stay at the Silver Lake Resort. Usually you tour the resort and stay at a hotel or somewhere close by, but we stayed in one of the newer buildings. We had a one bedroom unit. I absolutely loved the screened in porch - I had breakfast there every morning! The kitchen was equipped with everything you would need. In the bathroom, there wasn't the cheesy cheap shampoo and soaps that you find in hotels - they left Bath and Body Works for your use. The bed was very comfortable. The whole unit was very comfortable. Everything worked - washer & dryer, dishwasher, stove, etc... There is a beautiful pool, a movie theatre, exercise room, and game room (which my teenage boys loved.) Plus, it's right there. I mean, Disney is only a few miles down the road, there's a Publix supermarket a few miles away. Shopping and eating are within walking distance. It is gated, and all cars are checked before allowed in, so the security is good. There are also things going on for everyone. You can sign up for a spa, make tye-dye shirts, karaoke, live music by the pool (which also has a bar.) I have been to several time-shares, and this has been by far the best. I would definately recommend Silver Lake Resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: mobbsrc
Reviews.Content: We got our package through universal adventure, which we thought scamed us out of $518.00, but no they are for real. If anyone else is worried about universal, don,t be, they are ok. The deal they offer is really worth it, we still have 7 days in the Bahamas, and we would have used up the 518 at silver lake. Well we had agreat time at the resort, our suite was really clean, 2 T.Vs, a really comfortable bed, and no bugs.
