There is no restaurant, but a small store that sells a bunch of food, not to expensive, but there is a Golden Corral 5mins away, best buffet a have ever seen. The pool was a little cold, but there is a jacuzzi right there, so you can step out of the pool and jump right into the jacuzzi, there is a really fun games room, the staff is very helpful, Our stay was fun, we would stay there again. If anyone wants more info, let me know. [--].

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it !!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilia_Motogp
Reviews.Content: I cashed in a Getawayweeks.com voucher for one week at any available RCI timeshare. At first i was hesitant because I wasn't sure what to expect, although the reviews here on trip advisor are accurate as far as the positive ones. Checking in was easy, and the the staff at the front desk was very helpful with showing me where everything was located. The facility is gated with controled security access, and is located just down the road from Disney's Animal Kingdom. The rooms (or should I say small condo) was spacious and well constructed. Included: Full kitchen, tiled floors, standing shower with jacuzzi, second full bathroom, living room with 2 sofas (both with pullout beds, and an enclosed patio. Though I went for a getaway with my fiance, I was sort of dissapointed I hadn't invited some friends or family because there was so much space !! All in all it was a great property with plenty to do in case the rain interfered with going to the parks for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: neeliefree
Reviews.Content: Great location for a Disney vacation. The resort was very clean and comfortable. The pool and gameroom are great for family fun, but we were on a mission to do the Disney parks. Resort is very close to the main drag and almost every chain restaurant you can imagine is just a short drive away. Will definitely return to Silver Lake for our next Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Can't Wait for Next Year”
Reviews.Author: Keirasmum
Reviews.Content: Hi Stayed at Silver Lake for 2 weeks at the beginning of August Booked the holiday thru RCI From the moment we got off our flight at Sanford we knew this holiday was going to be good The flight was slightly delayed by about 1/2 hour but when we landed i was shocked at how quick and effortless it was to get our luggage and car All the airport staff we dealt with were really friendly Got to Silver Lake no problems, sailed thru check in, did have to sit thru the 10 minute sales talk trying to get us to have timeshare tour just declined and were given keys and directions to our room We were in a one bed in the 900 building which is right by the back entrance which was really handy for the Disney parks You can see the top of the everest mountain at Animal Kingdom from here Our room looked out onto the pool which was great and never crowded some people were still using it at 11pm The super kingsize bed was fantastic Came home wanting to buy one like it I slept like a baby every night it was so comfortable There were 2 televisions (not flatscreen) but fine 1 in the bedroom and 1 in the living area which had a pull out sofa bed and a dining table with 4 chairs My son loves NASCAR and american football so he loved being able to lie in bed watching HIS telly whenever we stayed in in the evening There was some big american football story going on so the sports channels kept him amused I on the other hand love the channel 13 news channel (how sad is that) Anyway back to the hotel we had a washer and dryer and a balcony The room i thought was quite spacious for a 1 bedroom and had a nice bathroom was disappointed that we didnt have a jaccuzzi bath but the shower was nice and powerful The only time we really used the hotel facilities was when we used the computers to check our emails The main pool looked great and the shop looked ok aswell From previous reviews i was worried about security but found the front and back entrance both very good The aircon was not working when we first got there but 1 phonecall and within 1/2 hr someone had put it right We did have a few phone calls during our stay but chose to ignore them as thought they would probably be someone trying to get us to do the timeshare tour Found the room very clean and chose not to have cleaner mid week as prefer to do it myself just had sheet and towel change Spent nearly every day at parks also went to boggey creek, busch gardens and kennedy space centre Most nights we went out for meals nearby as there are loads of decent places to eat a short drive from the hotel then we would head back to the hotel and watch the telly,saw a few decent films then early to bed so we could get up early the next day for the parks The main parks Universal etc being about a 20 minute or so drive away Loved the shopping came back with an extra suitcase full of stuff even resorting to throwing my sons old trainers in the bin because we couldnt fit everything in Check out was also quick and easy We love Orlando and We would definately go back to Silver Lake again and would request the same building again as we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Two big thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: moonfall03
Reviews.Content: We spent the week of Thanksgiving at the Silver Lake resort and loved our stay. Upon reading some of the other reviews on this site, I called and requested a room in the 1000 building the day of our check-in and they gladly obliged. The check-in was smooth and we did sign up for the tour (though the lady wasn't pushy at all). We had our tickets already, but she promised us $80 if we wanted. The room was clean and updated. There was a huge flatscreen TV in the living room and granite-like countertops in the kitchen. The jacuzzi tub was great and so was the laundry unit in our bathroom. We called maintenance twice about the dishwasher and laundry unit - they were up within minutes and quickly resolved our concerns. Also the pool areas were lovely and the water was warm. The location can't be beat - 5 minutes door to door Animal Kingdom. Restaurants all over, grocery store close by...great! The sales presentation was not bad at all. Stayed exactly 1 hour, said no thanks, got our $80 and left. Great way to make some extra fun money! I'd definitely reccomend this resort to anyone - ask for a newer building for sure though. Their older buildings don't look quite as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice overall”
Reviews.Author: traveldudeWashington
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit in the 900 building. This has the advantage of being right next to the back gate, with easy access to the Animal Kingdom area of Disney. The 900 building is also right next to a satellite pool that has a zero entry and was very popular with the 5 year old in our party. The main pool was very nice, but rather chilly so people were in the other pools in the evenings when we stayed there. The room was very nice, I did wish it had been a true two bedroom instead of a lockoff, but we propped the doors open so we didn't have to use keys to go back and forth. We enjoyed our stay, the people at the front desk and at security were extremely helpful. Our room was in good shape. The only complaint I had was that they force you to go to the events desk when you check in, even if, like us, you are not scheduling any events and you do not want to attend a time share presentation. That was annoying, but once past that I enjoyed our stay. Perhaps the 900 building is newer than some of the others on property, but our room was in good repair, everything worked and it had been cleaned before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “So - So”
Reviews.Author: drewman1010
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to start with this resort. We arrived at Silver Lake Around 2pm, and we were allowed an early check in. Our room was in the 100 building, and we had a 2 bed room condo. Now, the first thing that we noticed when we walked into our condo was there were mirrors everywhere, and i mean everywhere. The bed rooms were fair sized, and the master bathroom contained tub which was probably big enough for 4 people. The room was nice, and there were no problems until the second night. We had a little interaction with some cockroaches in our room, we were willing to work with them the first time, and they gave us a $50 credit to our room for our inconvience. Later that day we found that there were 8 more cockroaches in the bedroom, which is when we called down to the front dest to complain. Our complaint was handled wonderfully. They set us up with a different room, upgraded us to a 3 bedroom lock off villa in the new 1700 building. The newer buildings are amazing. They had all top of the line furniture and electronics. I was greatly suprised with the new room. The resort staff was very helpful to us, and they never hesitated to assist us when we asked for help. The trip wasnt the best, but if offered, I would return to Silver Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake OK”
Reviews.Author: deedeetoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-bedroom at Silver Lake for 5 days and were pleased overall. My husband's parents have a Hilton timeshare and typically stay there, but there were no rooms available so they booked this through RCI. The pool looked really nice (it was unseasonably cold when we were there, so we didn’t get to use it). The location is really quite close to Disney, and since it is on the south side of Disney, traffic isn’t bad. There are several restaurants and souvenir shops close, however there is a better selection on International Drive, about 10 minutes away. There is also a Publix grocery about 2 miles away, and again it wasn’t crowded, so that was convenient. Our room was OK - we were in the 300 building, and it was not nearly as nice as some of the pictures posted, but was comfortable and for the most part clean. The bed in the master bedroom appeared to have a new mattress, and was very comfortable. The armchairs in the living room were dirty and needed cleaning, but other than that, all was clean. The grounds, too, are OK. Everything is well-maintained, but nothing is really gorgeous. Overall, I think Silver Lake is nice, and whether you’ll like it depends on what you want. If you are looking for a place to rest your head and maybe cook in for a night while doing the theme park rounds, I think it is a solid choice. If you are looking for a true resort experience, this is probably not the best place...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: koosh0122
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week vacation in the Orlando area. We had a three bedroom unit in the 1700 building. Check in was a breeze and the room was very clean. There is not much going on at this resort. However, you can not beat the location. You can literally get to the Disney Gates (Animal Kingdom) within a 3-5 minute ride. The pool was large. We did not spend much time at the pool. We spent a lot of time at the waterparks for our off days. I have stayed at Orange Lake and the Sheraton Vistana our previous visits. These are nicer resorts however you can not beat this location. I would visit this reort again. It makes for a good home base while doing the Orlando Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night!!!”
Reviews.Author: elgie
Reviews.Content: I booked Silver Lake through a website that gave me a discount for attending a timeshare pitch. This was last minute and sounded like a great deal. I checked in late so I did not get a full view of the property. I noticed the units looked older when I pulled in and thought they must be pretty nice inside since I was told this was a four star property. They also gave me an upgrade to a 2 bedroom from the 1 bedroom that I booked. Boy was I surprised at what I saw. They gave me a unit in Bldg 100. When I first walked in my first thought was "wow this is big". I was on the third floor with vaulted ceiling and it looked huge. Upon further inspection I noticed how old and dated everything looked. I felt like I was on the Golden Girls. I was not happy. I wouldn't let my niece use the shower in the master bedroom because it didn't look right to me. The unit was huge, but it was old and made my skin crawl. I couldn't get comfortable in it. The bed was comfortable, but I tossed and turned all night. I couldn't wait to get out of there the next day. My two night stay turned into a one night stay. I checked out the next a.m. When you check in ask for a newer unit. I think that 1000 is the newest. From what I've read you can't go wrong this way. I did go look at the new unit on the sales pitch and they were gorgeous. At this point I was so turned off by my experience that I wasn't interested in buying anything.

Reviews.Title: “Faaantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rusty2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September 2007 with four other adults. We booked via a winning bid on EBAY. Initially, we were worried after reading some of the other reviews, however on arriving we were pleasantly surprised. Check in was very easy and the desk staff, friendly. On getting to our room we had some trouble with our door key, this was reported to the front desk, immediately a friendly man comes to check the problem. Simple fix, the battery needed changing. We began the settling in process. Our room was a 2 bedroom lock out with a pull out sofa. Our accomdations were spacious, comfortable, modern and clean. We were on the fifth floor. The apartment came with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry, master room with huge comfortable bed, flat screen and in room safe, bathroom with seperate shower and jacuzzi. There was a small walk out balcony from the living room and the master bedroom. We slept in the lock out room where we had a huge comfortable bed, in room safe, flat screen tv, kitchenette, our own private bathroom and balcony. We liked that at night and first thing in the morning we had our privacy while still being close to the rest of the family. Part of the package included a time-share presentation, which we had decided on before that we would decline all offers. Guess what. We loved the place so much we bought a timeshare. The grounds were well kept and the place was big but not too big to make it impersonal. Now, when we go back to Orlando we have the theme parks and Silver Lake to enjoy. They do have a small internet cafe with free usage which I hope will eventually be updated to free in-room internet. The parks are really close to the resort, if you use the back entrance you are 2 minutes from Disney's gate. Many eating options with lots of restaurants nearby. We loved SIlver Lake!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: SLSReview
Reviews.Content: As my review title says - the hotel was AWESOME! Great stay, and the pools were so much fun! The hot tub was HOT and all the pools were clean and in great condition. We stayed in building 1000 on the 4th floor in a 1 bedroom suite, king size bed and plasma tv's. It was beautiful and had all the comforts of home. The kitchen was fully equipped, including a dish washer! It also had granite countertops. We loved it here and would stay again. We went to Disney World for 3 of the 7 days we were in FLA and loved the down time pool side in the hotel. We also swam in the pool after a day at Disney, very relaxing! Don't hesitate booking this hotel, you will not regret it. We went for a T/S presentation which allowed us to get a great price on this resort. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Cheaply built, but not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: Catrianna
Reviews.Content: The Silver Lake Resort really is pretty. The rooms were nice too, the only thing I didn't like was the tile floor throughout the condo, only the bedrooms were carpeted, and with a one year old, I was constantly on edge that he was going to hurt himself. He did bump a glass on the table and it shattered, cleaning up the glass sucked. They did seem to be built pretty cheap, the chain lock on the doors fell off, so did the door stoppers, the closet door came off the hinges more than once, and the jets on the jacuzzi tub would come on by themselves with a loud "WOOSH" that scared the crap out of us!!! The bed was FANTASTIC, super comfy, the room was really clean too and they supplied everything you would need. The washer/dryer worked fine, and there's a screened in patio which is nice, we were facing bushes but could see the fireworks from Disney. The resort is pretty, nice pools, decent pool bar with some pretty good food, the staff were friendly and there to assist. It's in a pretty high traffic area which kind of sucks but there's lots around to do.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: sun_sand_and_sea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silver lake the week of 7/22-7/29. We had a 1 bedroom in building 1000 and it was awesome. There were two plasma's, a screened in balcony, a washer/dryer, dvd players, fully stocked kitchen and an oversized bathroom. The grounds are immaculate and even the security is friendly as you enter the property. The property has 3 pools and activities for every age. My wife who is real picky about where she stays really loved the place and wants to come back next year. Overall, we enjoyed the stay and the staff was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst "resort" ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1MsTif
Reviews.Content: We booked this through RCI timeshare. We relied on the represenations that this is a "five star" resort. I even looked at the pictures on line--the flat screen TV with granite counter tops. Talk about Bait and Switch. The room was a throw back to the 70's. I heard the theme to "Three is Company" as soon as I walked in. I expected Mrs. Roper to knock on the door and ask us to the Regal Beagle for drinks! There were full wall mirrors in the "livingroom/dining room" and in the bedroom. The kitchen and bathroom were seriously out dated with formica counter tops and old fixtures. The bedroom was tiny. They squeezed a king sized bed into the room leaving almost no room to walk around. There was about 1 foot clearance on 1 side, about 2 1/2 feet at the foot of the bed, and about 2 feet on the side closest to the closet. Everytime we sat upon or got into the bed, the head board banged against the mirrored wall! The unit is marketed as accomodating 4 adults. No way! There was only 1 closet in the entire unit--it was in the bedroom. There was only 1 towel rack in the bathroom. Me, my husband, our 12 year old and 17 month old barely had room to spare. The washer and dryer were stacked in the bathroom--they had to be at least 20 years old. Wait, there's more. The bathroom had mold on the ceiling and in the shower stall. When our 12 year old took a bath in the jacuzzi tub black mold started shooting out of the jets! Yuck! We complained--no action. We told the property manager, who was non-responsive. Then they had to nerve to try to sell is a time share! Are you kidding me?! Also, they charged us $5 per day for a crib. And they charged if you used more than their rationed amount of toilet tissue, paper towels etc. For example, .95 cents for every additional roll of toilet tissue. They gave us 2 rolls for 1 week. Wow. Beware!! Don't go to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation!”
Reviews.Author: HobokenPixie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I treated each other to a trip to Florida and stayed longer than we anticipated! I was very very uneasy about booking at this resort because of the many negative reviews but I had nothing to worry about! This was truly the best resort we have ever stayed at! TIP: we asked for a newer unit and the resort was able to accommodate (we stayed in the new 1700 building). Having a newer unit really made our trip special. What we liked about the unit: -the newer unit had 2 flat screen TV's -screened porch -Jacuzzi in a very LARGE bathroom!! -washer/dryer -comfy bed with lots of extra pillows and blankets -Bath and Body Works soaps! -we didn't see one bug ANYWHERE! This was truly the cleanest resort we have ever stayed in!!!! -no DVD player. We asked at the front desk and they said that they would be able to bring one to our room. We didn't want to impose so we declined the offer. What we liked about the resort -something to do everyday! The resort has activities just about every hour for both kids and adults. I really enjoyed the $10 spa package!! We ended up staying a day longer because we were having fun! -shuttle to Disney for $10 pp round trip. Shuttle to Univeral/Sea World is $14. We didn't have a car so this was great! You can then take free buses within Disney to get to the other Disney parks. -tennis/basketball court. You can rent the equipment and the fee is returned once the equipment is returned. -NICE FITNESS CENTER. I am an avid runner and this was one of the nicer resort fitness centers I have used. Sauna in the fitness center -Huge arcade room with pool tables. -HUGE movie theatre! They usually play a G rated movie for the kids at 5pm and something more mature at 7pm. They also have popcorn! -Pools were huge, pool towels can be obtained at the activities center, cabana at the poolside! -There was a convenience store on site but it was very expensive. -Maid service for a fee. There wasn't anything that we didn't enjoy. Again asking for a newer unit really made our stay special. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake was wonderful, POOL STAYS OPEN UNTIL 12 am.”
Reviews.Author: bagzarepkd
Reviews.Content: I was actually dreading vacationing in Florida, as I usually travel to more tropical and exotic places. But we had a absolutely wonderful time. We stayed at Silver Lake from 7/21-7/28, arriving for late check in @ 10:30 pm with no problems. Our 2 bedroom unit 1305 in building 1000 was nicely chilled and clean. The average sized bedrooms each had nice sized balconies overlooking wooded area. The livingroom was tropically decorated and the well equiped kitchen had beautiful granite counter tops. Dinning room table was a little close to the dresser above the TV. There were no dvd players(as advertised) or AV inputs on TVs to watch movies or view you pictures from your digital cameras. The pools are great. We loved the smaller pool between buildings 1000 and 900. The smaller pool had the zero entry for the baby to walk into with water showering her, which just tickled her. The big plus is the pools stay open until 12 am(sometimes, Later(1 am) but don't tell). It was a real treat to take a night swim after a long day in the park. The grounds were nicely maintained and housekeeping keep everything nice and tidey. They had lots of activities plannned for adults and children. Karoake was a blast and the games were very great. I won. I chose Silver Lake to meet up with other family members vacationing in Florida, and they too were impressd. Like I said, Florida was not my choice, but Silver Lake changed my mind. I will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: recep117
Reviews.Content: First off I just want to say that I am the kind of person who usually reads about all the reviews and keeps my thoughts to myself, but this time I could not do that. I owe it to all those weary family vacationers that just want a place to enjoy quality time with their family and enjoy making the most of the small time your job entitles you to have every year. We went to Silver Lake Resort as a timeshare option, and without a doubt it was * AMAZING *. We loved it so much we will be coming here again. We are 2 adults with 2 children 6 yrs. and 17 yrs old. and rented out a 1 bedroom suite that offered not one but two queen size sleeper sofa beds. It also had a screen balcony for morning breakfasts. A giant Kitchen with every thing from a wine opener to blender. The rooms are large and spacious enough that no one is bumping into one another. The dining room area has a wet bar , a washer/ dryer, a dishwasher, which was great since while I don't mind cooking a meal I hate doing dishes. The bathroom was almost as large as the Master bedroom with it own jacuzzi. The girls had there own small bathroom. The where three tv's one in the bedroom, one in the living room and one in the Kitchen.The staff is friendly, attentive and very helpful. I only wish that I would have know before ordering Disney ticket passes online that the resort offers better package than by the front desk. I could've saved me the frustration of finding the right one etc etc ( I would ask resort about these deals to assure yourself they are still going on, better safe that sorry) The pool was lovely with drinks and grill poolside. My only question was as to the Jacuzzi outside. It was 95 degress why would I want to jump into boiling water. I wanted to get refreshed not the other way around, but that is just me and some other people seemed to enjoyed it.. I wish I could of hung out by the pool more often, but will next time I go there since Disney tends to drain the life out of you when coming back home. Walmart is a jump away so you can supply yourself with the basic food supplies as well as souvenirs. I have no complaint about this resort. It is clean, well maintained, service is great, and you feel right at home. . It is worth it in so many level, you will not be dissappointed. Enjoy your Vacation it only comes once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Found it pleasant and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nicky484
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Silver lake in July this year. I found the experience to be fine compared to other hotels we stayed in joinging this vacation. We arrived slightly early to check in but the resort were fine they checked us in and then gave us a call when the room was ready. The staff were pleasent and helpful, yes they were foreign but spoke perfect English and lets face it where is America do you find staff that are not predominantly Spanish. We had a problem with a dates mix up but they quickly resolved it without any stress to us. We also had to receive a fax whilist we were staying and rather then hang around all day again they gave us a call to say it had arrived and kept it to one side. At no point were they rude or abrupt, yes reception seemed to be constantly busy but its a large resort so its to be expected. I must admit when we arrived at building 1800 we were a little daunted by the lift area and the hallway, they were very dated and a little smelly. However, when we got into our room we were pleasantly surprised it was spacious and airy and the bathroom was huge and it was all very clean. The only down side was no maid service unless requested but as we were only staying for 3 nights it didn`t really bother us. The location is excellent for disney, sea world etc and it feels secluded even though it is right off US192. As its not far from I-4 its also good for travelling across florida. There is plenty of places to eat within a stones throw although as its orlando its always best to have a car. The pools were all clean and large. There is plenty to do for children with the movie theatre, arcades etc and the internet suite was free also. All in all we had a pleasant say but I do think it largely depends on which part of the resort you are staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and fun resort!”
Reviews.Author: bbern69
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week long stay at Silver Lake Resort in Kissimmee, FL and what a great resort! The resort is on a quiet road off Hwy 192 - "the main drag" in Kissimmee where all the restaurants and souvenir shops are and it's right by Disney 's Animal Kingdom. I like how there is a security guard at the entrance and they do a good job checking your guest pass, etc. The lobby is large and has a convenience store in it. There's also a counter to buy attraction tickets but she's there early in the morning and leaves early in the afternoon. The grounds are very well kept and quite pretty. From reading the reviews here I requested a newly updated room and they gave us one in the 1700 bldg which is right next to the beautiful main pool, movie theater and golf simulator. The 1800 building is also next to the main pool which has the arcade/game room, gym and internet room on the ground floor. We got a beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo with a nice size kitchen (full fridge, microwave, dishwasher, plates, etc), very nice living room/ dining room combo with a big flat screen TV and a pull out sofa bed. In the large main bathroom was a spa tub with a separate shower and a washer/dryer, and in the bedrooms were 2 ultra comfy king size beds and smaller flat screen TV's and both bedrooms had their own screened in porch. The main pool is very large, almost shaped like a giant 8, it goes from 3'6" to 5' deep and is open from 8am to 11pm. There is also a smaller 4' pool next to the main pool which is never too busy. One part of the main pool has a volleyball net and my kids had a great time playing with us or other guests. You do have to provide your own ball but you can buy a ball in the store in the lobby. There's a bar by the pool which also sells ice cream and appetizers which aren't that good but it's convenient. The resort has daily activities - lots of stuff for the kids like tye dying shirts, ice cream parties, movies, ping pong tournaments, etc. There's also scuba lessons and I did the $10 spa treatment but the lady does have "the products available to purchase" but there's no pressure and it was quite enjoyable. We did have to do the typical timeshare presentation which wasn't too bad. We sent the kids to the arcade while we did it. Make sure you look for the coupon booklets in your welcome packet or they're in most of the restaurants . We saved quite a lot on meals and attractions. We really enjoyed our stay at this resort and would love to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Orange Lake or Westgate for sure...you will not be sorry”
Reviews.Author: sharetampabay
Reviews.Content: I booked the reservation through RCI as I am a Wyndam owner and RCI came with the package unfortunately. This is in no way a Wyndham slam. Wyndham resorts are outstanding, I just wish there were more of them in Florida. Had there been more Wyndham resorts, I would not have landed in what I will refer to as "Motel Hell" aka Silver Lake Resort in Orlando. The only good thing I can remotely come forward with this resort, is that is the location to Disney, but hey....take a look, there are alot of NICE resorts in that area so not such a great or outstanding feature right? You do not need to settle with this type of chaos if you are looking to have a peaceful and relaxing experience. Mine was SO totaly not that. My check in was terrible, the folks at the desk were curt and rude as if I was infringing on their break time. I was cast away like a red headed step child when my reservation was less that what I anticipated or was described to me by RCI. The check in was extremely busy and they did not have enough rep's to cover the need. Can you say WAIT? I had to wait a long time to get the mishap resolved. Ohhhhh if only RCI would have been honest and up front with me regarding this room or lack there of, all of this could have been avoided. But RCI was not. After all who is gonna sell you on a dump? But it's a really great deal! DO NOT FOLLOW THEIR ADVICE! RCI was not forth coming with the fine print right off the bat, thus leading to my check in troubles....It SO could have been avoided if RCI were to have been looking out for it's members. I was told it was a very nice resort and was a great deal to boot and that I should take it now while it was available as it would not last the hour. I SOOOOOO wished I had passed on this "deal" as it was a vacation nightmare. Had they told me we have occupancy in a lower rated facility, I would have thanked them and stayed home. Look at the testimonials, not much has changed at this resort in the last year. If you are an RCI member take their description of resorts with a grain of salt.....do your own research...they have not stayed there themselves, I would bet. in fact I told Matt, manager of RCI customer service that if Silver Lake were to offer me a complimentary week stay I would give it to some one I hate. I offered it to him even. I had 2 br/2ba accomodations and upon first inspection it did look relatively nice. The grounds were almost decent and the rooms looked adequately furnished but worn. The mirrors definately told the age, or lack of a qualified interior decorator. The lack of a disco ball left me wondering and what exactly was that stain on the comforter? The amenities were less than that of a Motel 8 or La Quinta and that is not saying much for a "star" rated resort. Starting with the room.....is it electrical or do they just not take the time to check the light bulbs? My "light" went out at that point and I shook my head in disgust. What are they paying the hired help for any way, atleast those that could actually speak english? Did they not understand " NO LIGHT....LIGHT OUT?" Or can they not see? The elevator went out conveniently as I returned with groceries. While talking to the elveator repair technician he indicated that this is routine for this resort. I am thinking in the back of my mind....Gosh what if? What if I was on the 4th floor for heavens sake, and the elevator was out for who knows how long. My son who is diagnosed with autism, freaks out on stairwells and heaven forbid the building cought on fire for faulty wiring. I felt extremely concerned and unsafe in a relatively new building. Would I be trapped in an elevator with my disabled son at any moments notice? Well you might have guessed that I was not only concerned but very scared. I hardly slept the nights I was there. The card keys may have worked 1 out of every 30 attemps which would not have been all that bad but the halls are not air conditioned and in Florida, it was a feels like temp of 150 degrees. I was told the room included certain things that were half true. Did the person in charge of lights check this as well? There was no DVD/ VCR player at all. The TV did have a few reconizable channels you could actually tolerate watching and the rest were full of static and snow or I was left with a blue screen of death. That is only of course considering I received any TV service at all. The Toilets scared me as they flushed with such force I was afraid not to put the lid down or I may very well be covered with Pooh! EWWWW! They did have a small game room that ran on tokens which would have been almost medioker but the token machine did not work so that was a HUGE bust. We ended up going to Orange Lake ( a light up the road) to participate in activites and have some actual fun) I am a week owner there so I have full acccess year round. The activities at Silver Lake were a joke. The walls were paper thin and I could hear the young family next door like they were in my lap. The baby screaming and crying at all hours only to be muffelled by the electric guitar and all the vibrations the woofer brought on. What did I hear from the staff or RCI about all this? NOTHING! and we are only on day #2 here. It went south from there at a rapid speed. And you were thinking it could not get worse right? Well I called RCI yet again to complain as the resort obviously did not care and I was told by RCI management that if I was so unhappy with the resort that they would be happy to have Silver Lake Resort Security escort me off the property....yeah folks you got that right. My my son who heard the phone converstation was convinced the resort police were "coming to get him" because he acted up to the constant screaming of the neighbors and their lovely electric guirtars. I spent the next few hours trying to calm him down and coax him out from under the bed. Despite my attemps to satisfaction, I turned to my son at day 3 and asked him if we could return home. like many other Silver Lake guests we doing. He told me not to give up. At this point I do not know who was worse, dealing with Silver Lake or RCI?

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room, but outdated”
Reviews.Author: rodbev
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: Huge Pool Area and 2 smaller pools in other areas Huge Room (500 building) Nice Bed in Master Suite 2 person shower and tub No pressure to attend a timeshare pitch 5 minutes from animal kingdom We were very relaxed most of the time and I would stay again NEGATIVES Front Desk put me on hold every time I called, one time I was on hold for more than 20 minutes Internet quit working in the room, but was refunded at end of week I found 2 cockroaches in room, one was huge room keys don't fit back gate entrance rooms outdated-but from what I could tell, they were in the process of remodeling LOTS OF MIRRORS

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare, no hard sell”
Reviews.Author: ACK1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a renovated unit (1700 building) with great flat screen TVs in both the living room and the bedroom, and what may well be the most comfortable bed ever. This is not hyperbole. The location can't be beat -- if you go out the back exit, you're on Disney property in under five minutes. For such proximity, the resort has a wonderfully secluded feel (it's a half-mile off the main drag of Route 192). There are three gorgeous pools around the property, as well as a game room, a movie theater, a gym with sauna, and even a golf simulator. They offer lots of activities as well (casino boat night on Port Canaveral for only $5), but we were always so beat after the theme parks we didn't partake. It's not the Ritz, but it was a lovely place to come home to every night for a week. Though we booked our vacation as an RCI timeshare exchange, we didn't get a high-pressure sales pitch. We were invited to a "breakfast," but the guest services folks were very gracious when we politely declined. As a note: you do need to request housekeeping service -- they do not come at any point without a specific request. As there was a washer/dryer and dishwasher in the unit and soap for both provided, though, we were more than content to keep house for ourselves. Advice: pack spices if you plan to cook! The kitchen has salt and pepper, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ecowarrior71
Reviews.Content: We used the RCI timeshare exchange program to book a week at the Silver Lake Resort for a week of Disney World. This was not our first choice of resorts, but was the only one available. After reading the reviews on this website, I was a bit concerned about our stay. I'm not sure about the other reviewers, but we had a great time!!!! Check-in was very easy. We checked in about an hour early and had to wait for our room. We took advantage of the time to wander around the resort. Once we had our keys, we moved our stuff into our room. We had a 2 bedroom and it was great. We put the 2 girls in the second bedroom. Our 16 year old son claimed the couch and they were all happy that each bedroom and the living room had a TV. The only "issue" we had was that our building (1700) was without hot water. I called the front desk and they told us that it would take most of the day to replace the broken part. They offered to let us into a spare room to bathe. Our building was right next to two pools and the arcade/activities center. It was also one of the few buildings to have adequate parking. Not that you can't find a place to park, but some of the other buildings have very limited parking right in front and you will be forced to park and walk (though it really isn't that far). The best aspect of the hotel, though, was the proximity to Walt Disney World. The back gate of the resort leads to a road that runs into Animal Kingdom Lodge. This is a very easy way to get in and out of Walt Disney World. I would definitely recommend staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: AnnaParrott
Reviews.Content: My dad won the bid for a 1 week stay at a charity auction. We had a two bedroom lock out room 9108. The main living space was okay, however my parents said that their pillow top bed was very uncomfortable. Their room did have a funny smell not sure what it was but I did notice some black stains above the stacked washer/dryer which I suspect was mold. I also noticed it was around a vent in the hallway. My daughter and I stayed in the other room that had a very comfortable bed, bathroom, microwave, mini-fridge. The staff was very nice and helpful. They gave you bath and body works products in bathrooms and coffee, etc. Air conditioning worked well. It was an okay place to stay nothing to exciting accept for the location to disney. They did have 2 big pools which were kept nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: isavelives
Reviews.Content: Before going to the resort, I constantly read the reviews. I was very worried about what we were going to encounter when we arrived. When we arrived, before my family got out of the car, I went to preview the room to make sure everything was in order. I must say, the room was very nice. We had a 3 bedroom lock-off which was really roomy. It could fit up to 12 people easily. Every room was clean, including the bathrooms (which we had 3 of by the way!) The pool was great. In addition to the big pool located in the middle of the complex, there was also a smaller pool located by our building, builiding 10. The location to all of the attractions was unbeatable. We had no trouble with the staff. My family and I did purchase a timeshare while we were there, but felt no pressure to do so. The furniture is a little outdated, but it was clean. The bed was comfortable. There were flat screen TVs located in each linving room. The only con was the router for the TV in one room was not nailed all the way to the wall and fell from the wall. However, we notified the front desk and it was fixed promptly. My family and I really enjoyed our stay. I don't know why other guests had so many bad things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: vacationseeker5
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried to stay here after reading all of the reviews but the resort is very nice. We stayed in the 1700 building and the rooms were great. They were fully stocked and had a washer and dryer which was very conveniant with kids. The location to the theme parks is great. The grounds of the resort and the pool area are very nice. They offered different activities throughout the week but we were to busy with other things to take advantage of them. We did take part in the $2 ice cream social and it was very nice.The only real complaints I had was with the girl who worked at the the pool bar. She was not very friendly and would spend most of her time on the phone . If you were not male then you had to scream at her for service. The other problem is that the playground was not much and they needed to have one closer to the pool area. All in all our stay was great and We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: EricToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over the Easter long weekend in 2008. We booked through saveonresorts.com. The price for the weekend included a timeshare pitch that lasted 90 minutes. In exchange for listeninig, they provided us with 2 disney tickets. The facility was nicely laid out, but dated. The pool area looked pleasant and clean. The room itself was clean. We had a problem one day with opening the door. The staff didn't seem to know what to do. It took several trips to the front desk and about a 15 minute wait for security and another 10 for maintenance to arrive and fix the problem. For some reason, the A/C in the hallway was at full blast and was really cold. The rooms themselves are decent. Well worth it for a small family. They charge a fee if you use the kitchenette for cleaning but if you plan on saving money, again worth the charge. It's located just off 192 near a McDonald's. It's Orlando, so don't expect to go out walking. But you are a short drive from all the tourist attractions and subsequent restaurants. I woulnd't pay a lot to stay here. But for the right price, and if you don't mind a condo like vacation rental, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mrsmom08
Reviews.Content: This property was not all what we were promised. The shower floor was absolutely hideous and filled with filth. We wore shower shoes the entire time we were there. The hot tub in our unit had mildew around the jets. I would NOT recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great look forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: Californianative03
Reviews.Content: Hi Our family spent 10 nights there in October 2004. I know review late just joined TA March 2008. The stay was not part of a timeshare deal and we were NEVER bothered once by anyone trying to sell us a timeshare. In fact the word timeshare was never even mentioned to us we never would have known if we didn’t already read their website. We had a 1 bedroom 1 bath with a studio lock out. There is the main common hallway then unlock door to a little entryway with studio door to right and 1 bedroom door in front of you. Room: 1 bedroom was great, big full kitchen, giant bathroom with really big Jacuzzi tub and washer/dryer in bathroom. Very roomy actually for a family of 5, but we also had the studio lock out but could have easily been comfortable without it. Living room/dining room combo, living room had queen sleeper sofa and 42" plasma or LCD (can't remember whatever they had in 2004) screen T.V., flat screen 35" in bedroom, DVD players in both rooms. Nice furniture marble floors throughout, clean, paid extra for housekeeping to come daily. Good size balcony. Pool: Big. Kids loved it, plenty of room, little kids pool for tiny to splash around too, 2 feet deep with palm tree in middle. Bar that serves basic food next to pool. Gated play ground next to pool also. ½ price drinks at certain times of happy hour like 4pm - 6/7pm Arcade and kids activities, staff were great with my 3 boys, made tied dyed t-shirts, and other crafts and activities. Popcorn machine next to pool inside arcade, bags .25, root beer float Tuesdays $1.00 and other special things like that. Kids love that stuff. I hope they still have things like that (higher prices now of course). Big Sundries store on property, had a little of everything you might need. Resort has room service of basic food (burgers, fries, pizza, pancakes, and other breakfast, lunch and dinner items) it was good but not consistently good, sometimes only OK. We really enjoyed the resort very much. We had no issues with anything at all during our stay, everything worked, rooms both 1 bedroom and studio looked newly redone, so can't give opinion to service requests, the entire resort was very clean, comfortable, and would stay there again with out any hesitation based on our last stay. When we needed a break from Disney World a couple of days just to unwind and relax we really came to appreciate the resort even more and the kids had such a good time they never even asked when we could go back to the theme parks. Very convenient to Disney World too I think just 1-2 exits at the most to the entrance of Disney World. You really don’t even need a car, we had one, but could do with out if only going to the theme parks, use the shuttle. Silver Lakes is walking distance to all sorts of shops too. Go down the road to Target for your souvenirs and save a BUNCH on stuffed Disney animals, t-shirts, you name it. Target is way better, cheaper and better quality of souvenir items then all those cheesy souvenirs stores off the road too. Go there even before the theme parks that way you’ll know what you can get there for a lot less and compare what you can and can not buy at the theme parks that you or your kids just have to have. We bought so much Disney stuff for our boys and saved a ton. If your like us you’ll still end up buying bags and bags at Disney theme parks too, check them at Disney store you bought them from in the park and pick them up at the end of the day at a central pick-up station or have them delivered to your hotel if your staying in Disney resort properties. Weather in October the best, warm, humidity not bothersome at all. Was not bothered by bugs at all and we were all expecting this, very pleasant surprise!! It's been nearly 4 years since we stayed there and I have read on their web site so many additional upgrades to the property we are looking into fitting another vacation in this year to go to Disney World and will stay at Silver Lakes. We already know it and had a great time. You'll have a great time. I have found the only people who don't have a good time on vacation are the ones who spend their time crawling around bathroom floors to take pictures behind the toilet, dirty window sills and anything else they can find wrong LOL The pictures I’ll post with this don’t forget are nearly 4 years old. Didn't take much of the Silver Lake, sorry. Took thousands of Disney parks. Best, CaliforniaNative

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: HarvestM00n
Reviews.Content: I thought this resort was amazing but from reading reviews it seems to depend on the unit you're assigned. I was in one of the newer buildings (10109G) and thought it was beautiful. We had a huge plasma screen TV in the living room/dining area, a full kitchen with new appliances, a beautiful new bathroom, king size bed with great sheets (ZERO bugs), a screened in porch (yes the floor was clean). I really couldn't fault the 1 bedroom unit but if it was The area does looks less desirable with a seedy hotels on the same strip but it is in a GREAT location close to all the parks, restaurants, shopping, and a Publix. We actually walked to the Red Lobster and a couple of other places on the 92. If you don't rent a car the resort has a shuttle. 10$ per person to Disney/Sea World, 14$ to Universal/IOA, 22$ for the Premium Outlets return included. The pool area was fantastic! They had a small cabana that served food and drink until 11 PM or things wind down. We ate there a few times (the one thing the resort did need was a restaurant) and thought the food was pretty decent for a poolside cabana. The games room was alright with ping pong, billiards, some video games, chess etc. The also have an internet access room where you can sign in for 30 minute increments. They also have a small store where you can buy knicknacks or a few food items. Our check-in was late at night and a breeze, we were shown the grounds and to our room and told a bit about the area and parks. Overall we had an amazing time and really can't complain about anything.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE DO NOT ADVISE”
Reviews.Author: dontdoit_8
Reviews.Content: My Car was broken into my window was shattered my GPS was stolen, along with 2 IPODS, Video Camera, Flashlight and more. You have to pass through a secured fence with NO POSTED warning signs and security patrols. But on this night there was no record of patrols from 2-6 am. I was one of 4 to have there car broken into all of them had GPS 2 had wallets. None of the GPS'S were visible just the suction cups. The cars were parked in an area that the cameras can't see. (INSIDE JOB!!!)Which are the parking areas for the first 4 buildings. We were not parked side by side but 10 cars in between all of us. The General Manager Debroah Moore, only response to it was NO COMMENT. After that she didn't return phone calls. The manager Scott Merrit felt it was our fault and told me as I grow up I'll find it funny. The only thing I find funny is that you can only reserve this place every four years. Four years, ten years I will never go back or recommend this to anyone. They gave us nothing No dinner, no free drink at the pool, nothing for lax security and poor responsibility to there GUESTS. My 4 Kids could not sleep in there room because they were terrified. Not to mention it took maintance 2 days to fix the bathroom door that fell off the minute we walked in. This place is located in a run down area and it is the worst place you can take your family. The other thing is for the week you get 2 rolls of toliet paper for 8 guests and NO Mid week cleaning. WHAT A JOKE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !!!”
Reviews.Author: tlama
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the 1700 building ,great location short walk to pool.Our unit was excellent, clean and very roomy.The pool is large with penty of room to lounge.All the staff was at your service.Resort is close to all the DW parks.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake is JUST ok, other places better”
Reviews.Author: vester44
Reviews.Content: We went to the Silver Lake Resort from the www.saveonresorts.com package - it included a timeshare presentation - for which we got free tickets to Universal and 5 other parks (not Disney). The room was nice. Overlooked nothing, but was nice :) NO dishwasher, so all dishes had to be done by hand. Also, and this is a BIGGIE TO ME, they told me that all the dishes had to be washed before we left, and the trash taken out or we would be charged more cleaning fees, uhh....ok. I'm staying at a timeshare resort, without maid service, I get that, but whats next, windex the mirrors? .... vaccum the floor? I mean, come on already. The price wasnt great for what I got - We stayed for 4 nights, and then we moved to the Marrriott Grade Vista (rated top 10 family resorts by Trip Advisor) and the difference was hands down unbelievable - seriously breathtaking. I walked into that room and just stood there for like 2 minutes going - wow, is this a room or a palace? But I digress, the point is that there are better deals to be had, with cleaner rooms and where you dont have to do your own dishes. There isnt a lot for a 2 year old to do but the pool. The pool was nice - but no baby pool. The food and shop was expensive and closed at 11pm. The place was just...ok. You can find a much better deal in Orlando right now. You wont hate this place, its not like its a gross Motel 6 with cockroaches, but its not the best place you can find for the money. The people were nice enough - the timeshare presentation was even ok - (the breakfast was a joke, but again, I disgress haha) Point is - that there are definitely better places (look here on Trip Advisor to find them). It was a good stay, but I'm SO GLAD we ended up at Marriott Grande Vista for a week - it was sweeeeet. Hope this helped someone. :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved SLR”
Reviews.Author: robyn530
Reviews.Content: WOW! This resort is gorgeous!! My boyfriend and I (both in our mid 20's) booked this resort thru an RCI program - for CHEAP! We were expecting the rooms that the unhappy people were writing about for the price we paid - but it was amazing! ( I still cant figure out where they stayed that they were so unhappy?) We were in the 1700 bldg, one bedroom, full kitchen - the bed was so comfy, huge Jacuzzi tub and seperate shower, couch was comfy enough to sleep on, 2 flat screens in the unit. Everything we needed for the week and more! They have 3 pools, two close to eachother by the cabana which serves food and drinks til 11 pm - and GOOD cocktails at that =) Couldnt have been happier with our stay! Staff was very friendly and not ONCE were we asked about taking a tour - we were even considering asking for it anyway because we were so pleased! Gorgeous!! =)

Reviews.Title: “droning noise ruined an otherwise perfect stay !”
Reviews.Author: Marie030
Reviews.Content: We stayed in newer 900 building unit 9603.It was amazing roomy ,well equipped and modern .The grounds were lovely ,pools were great and weather fantastic ! The problem was a continual droning noise coming from somewhere within the building ..it went on all day and night .Maintenance came in but couldnt seem to help .We had to leave our air conditiner fan and TV on all night in order to drown out the ANNOYING DRONE !!! We even tried ear plugs !! Very unfortunate as otherwise we loved silver lake !!!

Reviews.Title: “Pool area is wonderfull, rooms could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: ILOVE2TRAVEL_8
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at SLR, we were appointed a one bedroom unit in the 1800 building, facing the parking lot. We requested a poolview room, which they were able to accommodate the following day. We were very thankful for that, since we had a 7 month old baby who takes an afternoon nap and at least we could sit out on the balcony and have something to look at. Also, we could get wireless internet access from the balcony of our poolview room, but not the other side of the building. Our initial impression was that the rooms were a little dated, we had previously stayed at Vacation Village at Parkway in one of their newer units. Our unit at SLR had older appliances, the bathroom jacuzzi tub, shower and vanity were old and ugly compared to Vacation Village. But everything was clean and the bed was quite comfortable, so we were ok with it. The pool area at SLR was absoultely wonderful, the pool is huge, they have a cabana that sells smoothies, liquor, beer, etc and food such as quesadillas, hamburgers and onion rings. Atmosphere was great, they played music all day, staff was friendly, they had some activities for the kids.....we were very impressed with everything other than the rooms. The other thing that turned us off about the room is that the fan in the bedroom sounded like a train clacking down the tracks and we turned it off when we were in the room because it didn't look very sturdy and safe. Also, the doorknob in the bathroom fell off and I ended up locked in there when I came up to the unit to get something, The 1700 and 1800 buildings are the best location, they are closest to the pool. We did know someone who was in the 1000 building and saw their room, it was much nicer and newer with oak kitchen cabinets, new black appliances, plasma tv's etc. All in all we were very satisfied with our stay at Silver Lake, the rooms could use some improvement but the pool made up for it, and we spent more time by the pool than in our rooms anyways. We would return for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: tamelrick
Reviews.Content: We booked our week using RCI Exchange. Check in was a breeze. We opted out of the sales tour and although they did call once about it during the week, there was no pressure to attend. This resort could not be closer to Disney without being on property. Out the back gate & down the road two minutes and you're at Animal Kingdom! Very easy. We could actually see the tower from Blizzard Beach and the top of Tower of Terror from out living room window. We were in the 600 building which looked like it had been recently updated. Very clean, large two bedroom unit. One of the most comfortable beds I've ever found in a timeshare. I actually slept well. Our only complaints were the lack of sharp knives in the kitchen (only steak knives provided) and we could hear people outside. Might just be that the windows needed new weatherstripping. We didn't use the pools because we were too tired from being at WDW all day but they looked very inviting. Nice little 'grocery' on property and less than 10 minutes to a full service store (Publix).

Reviews.Title: “Never been happier with a stay. Already planning a return trip. A+”
Reviews.Author: Wassabe101
Reviews.Content: I won't bother to add photos,as there are many others to see in previous reviews. I, like many others, was nervous about my upcoming stay at Silver Lake Resort. Wow, what a waste of energy. Our check-in was a breeze. Very helpful front desk. Put me in a "newer" building. All I had to do was ask. Ended up in the 1000 building/4th floor. I guess I would request a room facing the parking lot/pool. It looked like the other side of the building might face kind of a scruffy overgrown fenced-in area. BUT, that side might face the fireworks at the Disney resorts, which are visible from SLR. The room was very clean and surprisingly spacious for a 1 bedroom. Comfortable sleeper sofa and a huge king in the bedroom was more than enough for my wife, 5yr old and me. 42" plasma is located in the living room. The pool is fantastic. My daughter is a real water rat. The main pool is kept at a perfect temp, and isn't over juiced with chemicals. The poolside tiki bar is a nice touch. Decent drinks and food. The gameroom was well equipped with modern video games, pool tables, and ping pong. There is also alot for kids in terms of crafts and activities. Im not kidding when I say that the location of SLR is IDEAL. The Disney resorts are literally only a few minutes away. There are many, many stores and places to eat within 2 minutes. I took off the day we arrived and picked up everything we needed for the fridge. Publix market is just around the corner. The "timeshare" presentation was actually very informative. We didn't buy. When the time came, I said "no-thanks" and that was that. They were nice and said that they closed 1 out of 3. Pretty amazing. I still cant figure out the math. Why the hell would somebody pay $35,000.00 and $65.00 a month in fees to stay ANYWHERE for 1 week a year? Beats me. Overall an outstanding stay. I cant figure out where all the people with the scary reviews actually stayed. A+

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - the staff steals”
Reviews.Author: Chicago223
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Someone from the staff broke into our room and stold our credit card numbers. Three of mine and two of my sisters. There are other reviews that reflect the same thing. It is a terrible thing to have to correct. Their employees should be screened.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Silver lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: mikeKentUk
Reviews.Content: Booked Silver lake through RCI Points, stayed in a one bedroom apartment in 1000 block. Had pool to ourselves most of the time and the water was very warm. Very well appointed apartment,clean and a very comfortable bed. There is a small snack bar at the main pool serving snacks and drinks but it is not open until 11am. Location is ideal for Disney etc being just off the 192. The only thing that we thought could be improved on would be an evening entertainment program to save a trip out at night. There is no maid service for the duration of your stay,but we found this convenient. We were invited to a timeshare tour which was declined,after which we were left alone, we did go down to key west for three days but there was no evidence of any hard selling going on. We would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE GROUNDS, ROOMS NEEDS SOME WORK”
Reviews.Author: peck206
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Silver Lake Resort, check in was fast and easy, they do send you over to guest services which wants to sign you up for the timeshare tour, we did not sign up. They did proceed to call us everyday to set up a tour, we just said no thank you. The grounds are beautiful, the pool area is very nice. We stayed in the 200 building, which is one of the older building. I thought the room was average at best, it was a nice size we had the 2 bedroom 2 bath condo. The furniture is very outdated as is the decor, our master bathroom left little to be desired, the vanity mirror was corroded, I would not use the jet tub it just looked old and dirty, the shower stall was nice but the drain plugged everytime and took forever for the water to go down. I hear the newer buildings are beautiful, but I did not see one for myself. We used our own pool towels so we did not run into the problem of the pool area running out of towels. The best part of silver lake resort is the pool area and it is so close to Disney it's unreal. The back way into the resort takes you to Disney property Immediately. We were back from the Animal Kingdom in less than 5 minutes. We never had to wait in any traffic. I would stay again if I could be in a new room, but I would most likely pass if I had to stay in the older buildings again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort in a Great Location, Close to Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: A_Canadian_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Silver Lake Resort had beautiful grounds, friendly staff, and nice rooms! We were originally booked to stay in a (massive!) two-bedroom 8-person villa, but opted to move to a smaller two-bedroom 6-person condo when we arrived and decided the villas were far below our expectations. Villas were roomy and clean, with a functional layout, but they appeared as old as they were, with dated interior decoration and a musty-smelling screened-in balcony. Condominiums have smaller units, but because they are much newer they are much nicer, very bright, clean, and welcoming. I would not be surprised if Silver Lake planned on updating their villa units in the near future. The resort has a wonderful pool area with a large pool, bar, and lots of sun exposure (a great place to hang out in the afternoon). The grounds are well-kept, making the resort very attractive. There is also a tennis court and two other smaller pools on site. Silver Lake is located right next to Disney's Animal Kingdom, with a back gate leading form the resort to Disney World. The other attractions in Orlando, including Universal Orlando Resort, Seaworld, and shopping are a short drive away. There are also many restaurants located very close by. Overall, Silver Lake Resort is a great place to stay when visiting Central Florida and all of its attractions. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “NIce resort and great location”
Reviews.Author: robonel
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a week at the Silver Lake resort in Kissimmee on a business trip. The complex and grounds were very nice and the whole place is pretty secluded from the main road. We were in an older building which was nice, our 2 bedroom unit had more than enough space with a king in the master and 2 full size in the other bedroom. The furniture was terribly outdated and uncomfortable, but I think some of the newer units have the new items and nicer televisions, etc. Most of the places I have been to are all like that, so ask for a newer unit if available. The pool area was really nice with a small outdoor bar, the workout facitility was excellent, wi-fi in the main building, computer areas in the game room area, and a large game room. The activities on site were really good and nice. We had ants in our unit one night from leaving a cookie out on the table, and I called the next morning and they took care of it that day. Other reports had talked about the hot water being too hot, and they are right, so watch out. Overall a great experience for us except for not having some new stuff in the unit when it came to the furniture and decor. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest place I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: simon83uk
Reviews.Content: I've been to this resort about 12 times or so, admittedly the last time I went was in 2004, but i'd basically been every year for over a Decade as a kid, and from the photos it seems like things have only gotten better. Parents own a Timeshare here, hence going so often, and Im glad they bought it, cos this place was/is fantastic. Firstly as others have mentioned, the customer service is fantastic. From the reception/helpdesk, even just random staff you see when walking around the resort, ALWAYS friendly, i've never seen a miserable member of staff there. Maintenance etc. is on hand if there are any problems, and nothing's perfect, so if you are unlucky to have a problem, then at least youve got friendly helpful people on site to assist with issues, which are usually dealt with very quickly. Room-wise, (and I've not stayed in any of the newest apartments, newest was the big block behind the main pool when I went), they are very modern and very well furnished with alot of the essentials and some nice luxiries. I know some people on here complain about the smaller rooms, but you pay alot less for those and theyre more intended for short stays. Yes those kitchens etc. are cramped, you dont get as many nice features, smaller TVs etc. I've not even stayed in the newest rooms with the LCD/Plasma TVs etc. but the large semi-newish rooms I'd stayed in were excellent. Beds were very comfortable, good kitchen, very nicely furnished. Unless youre used to staying in 5-star resorts (in which case you'd probably be in one already) then you should find the accomodation very nice. I think my only criticism would be what others have mentioned, which is the air conditioning sometimes making the rooms cold, especially at night. BUT if youve been on the tennis courts or even just out for the day in the HOT florida weather, its such a nice relief to come back to the A/C lol :) So definete thumbs up there from me. On-site, theres alot to do, youve got tennis courts, a Gym, Internet Access (Rubbish PCs when I was there though, could barely load MSN and a few IE windows up :P hopefully improved since then), a games room (quite old games though when I was there, we're talking 1990s style Arcades in 2004 -.- bit sucky but eh you go on holiday to get away from those things, and the kids will be entertained anyway. Im a bit too old to be spending $50 in there now haha). But anyway, youve got the pools (from the photos/other reviews, more pools now), the cabana which is nice for a casual drink/snack, the entertainment is great, always things going on, for all ages, which I think is good. TBH theyve probably added alot more since then, I've been there from when they were like..a quarter of the size of what they are now, and theyve always improved on the stuff available on-site. Location is great as others have mentioned, as youre right next to Disney Parks, still very close to things like Universal etc. and youre right next to the.... bleh cant remember the "Highway" (Bronsen highway maybe), which has alot of nice shops there, not high-street equivalent ofc, you go to Florida Mall for that, but nice restaurants (Bennigans, please, go there, basically a TGI Friday grade-restaurant, VERY VERY friendly staff, who actually understand what customer service is, great food, great value for money), various flea markets, all sorts of souvenir shops to visit etc. etc. Honestly I couldnt explain whats all there, because theres so much. Water Mania is even further along (Basically a less-grand version of Wet and Wild, but its cheaper and less crowded too, as well as easier to access). As i mentioned youre not too far from things like the Florida Mall or the Sand Lake Road Area (lots of good shops, Wet and Wild etc. etc. if memory serves me correctly) Wow I keep writing, hopefully if youre interested in visiting this place, then you've read this far. Alot of good reviews, but I wonder how many people here have visited this resort over ten times :P But also, theres just so much good stuff. This resort is fantastic, I hope it doesnt grow too much, because it'll turn into an Orange Lake type resort, which doesnt seem as "personal", as its just endless waves of villas leading to the main area, this is much more closely-knit, and the staff are awesome. The location is perfect, youre near everything, always alot to do. Honestly can't recommend this place enough, I think the only people this wouldnt be suitable for is someone looking for a very serious Honeymoon, but tbh i'd go to this place, I mean i suppose with all the kids running around its not ideal for some, but you can go to so many nice places with a partner or whatever. Its not really the place you'd go for a "Lads' Holiday" either, but then you go to Mediterranean for that, not Florida, so its a moot point. In summary, I loved Silverlake when I went when I was 10 or so, I loved it when I was 16, and I loved it when I was 21. It is the nicest resort I've been to (and Ive stayed at the Meridian Hotel in New York from a Company Incentive, which was obviously much more upmarket and posher, but very soul-less, but still nice), especially given the audience its aimed at (i.e. its not a 5-star, but its the equivalent of, for people who maybe dont have tens of thousands of pounds to throw at one holiday... It really is that good. The people who had negative experiences here, that really does suck, especially the one who had their credit card/£££ stolen, althoguh that is an isolated incident. This is a very prestigious resort with a very good track record, and Ive been 11 or 12 times and not had any problem like that. Definetely DEFINETELY worth going to. You will NOT be disappointed. All my most memorable vacations have been here. If I could right now, i'd leave the rubbish that is England and live in one of their apartment blocks :P

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever go there Employees that steal”
Reviews.Author: cmburke2005
Reviews.Content: While on vacation the resort seemed wonderful and had a great time. Unaware until going back home that our room had been entered by a employee. Yes the key cards were checked. The employee stole credit card #'s not actual cards and spent over 6,000 dollars. There are no back ground check done on these people. We also had a person come knock on our door in the middle of the night that said they were security. we called the front desk and no one knew of any secruity that should be knocking on our door. So watch your purse and your children. You could be the next victim. Not only were we blew off by this resort after they knew which employee did it but also still employee him. They will lie to you. I still have the police reports if you need more info. Your kids could be taken from your room in the middle of the night. We were treated to terribley and will never return. We were not offered any support or componsation for everything we went through.

Reviews.Title: “Three thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: fjsandiego
Reviews.Content: Perfect home away from home! Stayed for a week-long Disney vacation with my wife and 4-yr old daughter (I should've opted for the two bedroom cause' my 4 yr old pretty much took up the bed) and it had a 42" flat screen TV. I stayed in one of the newer buildings (1000) so everything was new. Living/dining room area was large and had a 24" flat screen TV and a place to hook-up a laptop (I did not bring mine so I'm not sure if it was free or not). Microwave, stove, oven, fridge, toaster, blender, dishes, utensils, washer/dryer, iron, hair dryer included (but no dishwasher) in my unit... like I said "perfect home away from home". Balcony was screened in and one of the three heated pools was just outside my building. Lots of activities at this resort... they even have movie nights for families; however, after a long day at Disney all I wanted to do was relax in the pool with my family. Not very far from the parks and especially close to Animal Kingdom. Close to every amenity you could possibly need (Publix grocery store is a quick 5 minute drive). Staff was cordial and attentive to my calls and requests. The only thing that was wrong was that my door did not have the weather stripping at the bottom so I could hear my neighbors kid throwing fits, other than that, no worries. I would definitely stay again. Three thumbs up! Perfect home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matrgaston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay at Silver Lake Resort. I was very pleased with the activities they offered all members of our family. The pools were wonderful! Since it was mid December, it was nice to have the heated pools. The rooms were very clean and well equipped. If we had 1 major complaint it would be the temperature of the hot water....way too HOT! The building next to ours was being upgraded and there was a large trash bin left out at night. One night, after returning from a Park we saw racoons looking in the trash for food. It was very scary because the trash bin was only a few feet away from where we parked. Our teenage girls loved having the lock-out all to themselves. I really appreciated the help from staff about where to go and what to do. They were very informative and nice. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BT-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-week stay. Stayed with my parents and my wife. Our stay was very positive. Our unit was a 2 bedroom villa on first floor (don't have to worry about stairs) in the 200 building. The villa was very spacious, clean and well kept. The pool area was well kept and we never had a problem finding a chair, then again, this was low season. We enjoyed the outdoor hot tub, though did have concerns with unaccompanied young minors in there alone. Did encounter some noisy teenagers at the pool, but no big deal. My mother enjoyed the heated pools and the exercise facilities and sauna. I made use of the free internet daily. Thanks to previous reviewer who suggested bringing own laptop- I was able to connect (though it was slow) for free as opposed to using in-room connection for a fee. There were a few minor issues. The water pressure was great but the hot water setting is much too hot. Almost got burnt a few times. Also, the clothes dryer in our unit left stains on clothing -not sure if it was rust or baked on crud from previous users who put something in it that shouldn't have been there. In any event, the stains washed out, but I was afraid to use the dryer for white clothing. The ensuite bathroom off the master bedroom was very nice and spacious also, but found the location of the toilet to be awkward. It was literally enclosed in a small closet-type space with it's own light and fan and I felt claustophobic when in it . A broom and sponge mop were provided, but no dustpan or pail. We had 2 large TV's in our units but the quality of reception was not too good. There was an LCD TV in the 2nd bedroom and it worked fine. This location is excellent for families who intend to go to Disney, although that was not the purpose of our trip. Guest services were thoughtful enough to provide written driving instructions to popular attractions, but perhaps the return instructions could have been included as well as street names. Eg. instructions for Publix grocery store simply says "...turn right at next light", but doesn't say what the name of the street was. Plenty of restaurants and shopping near by but definitely not walking distance. We attended the timeshare presentation just to see what the condos looked like (newer but slightly smaller) and the money involved. It was not a high pressure sales presentation so we were happy with that. They offered tickets to attractions or $100 US cash for attending. The breakfast was nothing to write home about. Other than that, no regrets about attending. Staff at Silver Lake Resort were very nice and friendly; maintence workers were always busy working on the grounds, guest services were friendly and helpful. Some Helpful Tips: We really made use of our kitchen, so I would suggest bringing coffee and filters (as well as any other dry goods you can bring) because you only get 1 bag (4 cup serving) or you could purchase through them for a lot more money. Teabags were provided but it tasted awful. Bring your own sugar and creamer, too. Really, the only thing they gave you is salt and pepper, 1 laundromat-size box of Tide, dishwasher detergent, and dish detergent , shampoo and conditioner ,and hotel-sized soap. If you need more, resort will SELL to you. Supply of paper towels, tissue, toilet paper and garbage bags were adequate. Bring a nightlight and plastic hangers for those wet swim suits. I also brought along a hook on a suction cup-it was useful in our shower stall.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake Was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: sjaem01
Reviews.Content: We were at Silver Lake on Oct 21-27,2007. We had an excellent experience. The check in was a snap. Everyone was friendly and very helpful.
