The unit we stayed in was in the 100 building on the 1st floor. 2bdrm,2bth,w/d,dw,screened in porch,full kitchen,TVs in every rm. The place was so clean I couldn't believe it. The resort provides you with enough samples of everything to last you a couple days or until you can get to publix or walmart. Both located within a mile or two. The pool was very nice, we only had time to use it once. My 3 and 5 yr old loved the air hockey in the game room. The location is better than some Disney resorts. Out the back gate, one turn and your on Disney property. Exceeds all my expectations! I really don't understand the bad reviews people give this resort. I guess some people are just impossible to please! I added some photos,they really can't do the place justice!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake Report Card: Location A+ Facilities B Staff C Cleanliness D”
Reviews.Author: coldparcel
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, off the main strip (Irlo Bronson), back door extremely convenient to Disney as others have stated. That itself is worth a lot, and apparently what Silver Lake is using as their main draw. A+ The buildings were okay, decent enough accommodations, though if you like a firm bed, beware, the mattresses have extra thick pillow top that made my back ache (much too soft). Our spa/whirlpool, like others have noted, kept going off randomly (a known bug, annoying when it woke the kids from sleep). Furniture was fine, kitchen well equipped if somewhat cheap accessories (to be expected in timeshare type place). Nice big pool (though only small kiddie one heated, despite claims on website). Washer and Dryer a bit disappointing (small aging stack type), small and dryer could dry 6 shirts at a time at most. Supposedly has wireless throughout for $10/day, but my laptop couldn't detect any signal. Wired connection did work for the most part (intermittently went down). B The staff were very pleasant, cordial, did their best to appear helpful, but very poor follow through. For instance, called and confirmed "mid-week tidy" twice, no one ever showed up despite scheduled time! You would think they would make up for it by coming the next day... nope. Called couple of other times for things like fresh towels, toilet paper, etc.., they followed through about 50% of the time. C+ Cleanliness perhaps related to staff, but I thought worth a mention. I wonder if they miss the "mid-week tidy" all the time, they probably need to do them more often. The floor was filthy, white socks became dark grey/black socks on the bottom after about 15 minutes of walking around. Ants and other insects were abundant (probably didn't help we were on the ground floor), but bearable. Some of the walls had a half hearted patch job (not sanded or painted). Spa/whirlpool had water in it when we got in (hopefully from being cleaned, but who knows). D So, all in all, ok. Certainly not a terrible miserable place, but wouldn't go back to it given so many other choices in the area (location isn't *that* good). We actually elected not to go to the timeshare presentation after the first couple of days there as we knew there was no way we'd buy a week there, even if they dropped the price 50%.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort”
Reviews.Author: mrwoodcutter
Reviews.Content: SLR was a very nice resort. We stayed in the 100 building and although it was an older building it was still nice. Every thing was clean and taken care of. The best part of this resort was its location. One turn out of the back gate and you are on Disney Property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved SIlver Lake! Loved! Loved! Loved!”
Reviews.Author: jess816
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Lake last week and loved it! Some advice: DEF call Kristi beforehand. First off, the resort was recommended to me by my aunt who had spent time there last year. So I used that info to leverage that I needed a good room. I also said that my fiance and I were interested in possibly purchasing in the coming years, and my aunt's postive review made us more interested in Silver Lake. IT WORKED! By the way, my boyfriend and I are NOT engaged, not living together..and this helped us when straying from the sales pitch. We stayed in the 1700 building, which in my opinion is the best location. You're RIGHT next to the main pool and the cabana. Adjacent is the 1800 building which houses the gym (yeah, never made it there) the arcade, the business center, etc. PLUS, there's TONS of parking there. The main pool was great, though must admit we only swam once. The cabana was a bit pricey for what they served, but it's right at the pool and we realized the serve Coronas in a bottle (for all you cruisers who are used to no glass around the pool, this is great!) So we threw some coronas in my beach bag and sat by the pool with them. The back entrance is great. You LITERALLY make a left and you go around 2 bends and you see Disney's purple signs. They give you towels, two packs of dishwasher detergent, a mini dishwash soap, a small box of tide, and some Bath & Body Works products. We went to the Super Walmart and stocked up on some more stuff once we got there (Coming from NJ, Florida groceries are so cheap! We didn't worry about throwing out some stuff). Our ONLY issue s and this is BEYOND minor is that whenever we used the jacuzzi, it would randomly start up again like 30 minutes after it was drained. We merely had to push a button (which one time was the "Light" button for some odd reason) to shut it off, and it didn't do it again. The other issue was the iron they gave us leaked a lot of water when in use. We could have called the front desk, but it was more just a situation of iron it, let it hang on the chair while it's drying, and then get dressed before you leave... Again, VERY minor! They apparently do housekeeping midweek for a week's stay, as well as a towel exchange. Personally, for us, since I had to buy laundry detergent anyway, I just washed our towels everyday as part of a daily routine. Was no biggie. Threw them in before leaving for Disney, came home for lunch, and threw them in the dryer. We also didn't have them clean up either..we just kept it neat ourselves. I personally prefered this due to the fact that I didn't want people in the room w/o us there (just a pet-peeve I have). When checking out, if you're leaving early in the morning, you can check out the night before and just give your key cards to the security guys when you leave. They'll also print out your boarding pass for you when you check out. Great place! Great location! Totally modern and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: angelizer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, perfect for family holidays. Near animal kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: evmaya
Reviews.Content: this review is about the SILVERLAKE RESORT and not the SILVERLEAF RESORT. Really enjoyed our stay at this resort...building 800...cannot fault the apartment...had everything we needed plus more...very friendly staff...big pool was not working but building 800 had a simple small pool across the road...so close to disney...timeshare talk was a pain in the neck but my baby made it disastrous for the woman giving it to us so it was pretty funny. Disneyworld was flawless...4 days from 8 am to 12pm with a 2 year old...was awesome and overwhelming the senses. feel free to contact me with any questions

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: erickasmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort Spring Break 2007 . My husband, my 15 yr. old son and my 3 yr. old daughter. Not a bad place to stay the check in process was OK, staff was nice. The resort was in a great location almost on the grounds of Disney. Not even 2 minutes from Disney. We stayed in a roomy one bedroom condo. Very clean, really nice pools.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: shellyLLLL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, really loved it. Very quiet and peaceful when we stayed (late Sept). Spacious 2 bed suite, fairly well equipped kitchen and nice balcony. Clean and well maintained property and helpful staff. Plasma tv, whirlpool tub and VERY spacious bedrooms. Lots of towels etc and a lovely touch was that there is a welcome pack of tea/coffee/toiletries/washing detergent etc. I really appreciated this after travelling long haul with a small baby. Didn't find the time share sales people too pushy, they were actually offering some good deals but finanically it wasn't for us at this time and they took that graciously, which I appreciated as I hate the 'hard sell' in some of these places. Seemed very quiet though there were a lot of cars parked in front of our unit but you felt like you were the only ones staying there. Booked through 'Back to the Caribbean' which was a disaster, a word to the wise - book yourself, it would be a lot less hassle and at least you wouldn't suffer the indignity of bascially being told to get lost, when you contact them with a problem. Nice staff at the Silver Lake Resort, all very helpful and friendly, very quick to solve any problems you might have. I found our stay here was great in every way, not to mention its so close to Disney World. I'm very fussy about where I stay, having a 6 month old baby means I require somewhere very clean, spacious and safe and I would highly recommend this resort to anyone, especially those with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great poolarea”
Reviews.Author: FruOlsson
Reviews.Content: Got to stay in the not yet renovated building close to the pool. It was a nice one bedroom apt, very spacious and clean. Check-in went smoothly . There's a small store on the premises, several playgrounds, movietheater, gameroom and laundryfacilities. There's also an activitycenter for the kids which was convinient. We had a great stay and did the tour. This was a pain even though the sales rep were OK. Bring your kids and let them run around to shorten the salestalk!

Reviews.Title: “super place”
Reviews.Author: dallas401
Reviews.Content: we got here on 10-07-2007 it was great the cleaning staff was great ( evans ) was great the kids were so happy here i would stay here 100 more times but timeshare price was way to high my kids loved it 100% it was great

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JLWGodwin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for the first time, 7 nights. What a wonderful week. From the check in til check out, we received excellent customer service. We stayed in the 300 building. We spacious 2 bedroom condo, very clean, everything we needed. Huge master bath w/juccuzi, large stand up shower, separate toilet area, vanity area for putting on make-up, styling hair, etc. Very large living room, screened in sun room w/ceiling fan, large kitchen w/everything needed to cook meals. Microwave, dishwasher, washer/dryer, coffee maker, blender, iron/ironing board. Live music daily at the cabana at pool site. Towels provided at pool. The staff very friendly and went out of there way to make our vacation very enjoyable. We received calls from the front desk daily asking if there was anything we needed, any special request/complaints, etc. Each day when traveling, we stopped by the office and received step by step directions to our destination. Also was given discount tickets on meals, mall, etc. We rate this resort #1!! No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Simply On Of The Best!”
Reviews.Author: ccotton526
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, I was skeptical like all you guys/gals out there until I went there and I was completely blown away. Of course everyone will have their own experiences, but this is mine and I'm happy with it. This was an awesome place to stay. They have security at the front gate for your protection 24 hours/7 days so no outsider can enter. This resort has a back private entrance to take you quickly to any of Disney theme parks which is only 2 miles away, and at night when you return; your key can open the back gate because security at these gates leaves around 9pm. Parking? there are plenty of free parking available here no need to worry. We stayed here for 1 week at the 1700 building, suite 1717g to be exactly. My suite was furnished beautifully with washer/dryer, king bed, crib for extra $7 a night, dishwasher, Jacuzzi, 52'' Plasma TV and the whole nine yard. How can anyone stay at a hotel? This is the best place for family. We had a well equipped suite with complete kitchen utensils, plenty of towels, extra sheets/pillows and everything you have at your home. But you have to make your own bed and clean up after yourself except if you stay for a week, housekeeping will clean for you once. However, the mid week cleaning crew don't do a good job - they leave the floors dirty and don't take out dirty towels either, not to mention they leave the dishwasher running for hours. Anyway, more about the suite, we were 10 - 20 yards to the private movie theater, golf simulator, computer room, game room/arcade and 3 pools including the large free form pool, the kiddies pool, 1 other pool and even the hot tub/spa. Con: the movie theater only plays a year old movies and is always empty due to this fact. The hotel staffs were friendly from the front desk people to the pool girls to the cabana guys, all of them were pleasant. My 2 year old toddler got air sick from flying in and I called the front desk to let them know that I'm calling an ambulance at 5am, and the gentleman name Carl was very nice; he sent security over to close the doors and he even called me the following night to see if all went well. This is how sweet the people who work here was. However, they did try to entice me with the timeshare meeting once when I checked in and then again via phone call, but I simply decline and they leave me a lone. If I ever return to the Kissimmee area, I'll surely stay here again. However, there were 2 major set back to let you all know and that is there are no restaurant on the premises, so please eat out or cook because the cabana has limited amount of food, like chicken wings and hamburger and if you don't eat this; make sure and plan for your meals ahead because the pool closes at 11pm and so is the cabana. The other set back is the entire suite is tiled and very cold except for the bedrooms which have commercial carpet. Hope this review is helpful and the photos give you a better idea. I write this review because somebody else was kind enough to do the same for all of us so we can make better decision of where to stay. Thank you and I hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_noe
Reviews.Content: Purchased a 7 night stay in a 2 bedroom condo from Bigdog vacations on E-BAy. I admit being a tillle worried when i read the reveiws.........some were very nasty............. But when we acctually got there, my kids and I were blown away from what we saw. NICE!!!!! We stayed in the 900 building. Big.............big beds! nice kitchen, living and dinning space modern, and everything was clean. The bathroom with its juccusi.......... I used it almost every night after a long day at the parks........... Our rooms gave view ont the Walt Disney Rosorts. You can see Disney' s fireworks every night! The service was great. The tour well as expected a little preshure, but not enaugh to ruin your day.................... So my review is...................VERY NICE.............I GIVE IT A 9/10. And for all the people that gave a negative review............................. I really dont understand!!! I guess some people just like to complaine about everything!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “RCI Points used-Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: arkiegal
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (children ages 11 & 13) and stayed at Silver Lake Resort for 7 nights in July 2007. We were in the larger one-bedroom condo (sleeps 6) and we were in the 300 building. We were in Orlando on family vacation to Disney World, Universal and a day trip to Cocoa Beach. With all that we had planned during our vacation we didn't spend time enjoying the resort amenities including the pools. All seemed to be clean and enjoyed by those we saw. We arrived two hours early for the 4PM check in on Saturday. I told Marc at the front desk that we were tired from our drive and anything he could do to get us in early would be appreciated. That's all it took. He got us into our condo right away. He was friendly and very helpful. After receiving our keys we were directed to a desk where the obligatory "would you like a tour" question came. All I had to say was we are there using the RCI points and no more was said about that. Again the staff person was friendly and said that if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable please let them know. The 300 building is a walk up (no elevator) but this was no problem at all. We entered to a clean, large one-bedroom condo. Having read previous posts here I was not surprised at all to find the numerous floor-to-ceiling mirrors. We had the dishwasher and the stacked washer-dryer and those were well used during our stay. The kitchen comes with all glass/silverwarre and dishware that you might need during your stay. We brought dish-machine liquid, Tide & Bounce (they only provide small one use samples). There is a Publix grocery store very close (>2 miles) and we were able to get enought groceries for breakfast and lunch for the week. The King-size bed in the master was wonderfully comfortable; my kids reported that the fold-out full-sized beds were fine. We did not have any plasma TVs. The Living Room TV was large (52" or bigger). There was also a 26-32" in the master and a small TV in the kitchen. All had cable. There were no DVD or VHS players. The master bedroom also comes with a safe (no charge) with electronic key that you set . We had to call maintanance to set this up for us so that we could set our own key number; we used it all week with no problems. There were two bathrooms; they were clean and well stocked with towels. We didn't take advantage of the free mid-week cleanup and towel exchange. There was only carpeting in the bedroom and tile everywhere else. I think the tile in the entry hall and dining area could've been cleaner but it wasn't so dirty that I felt the need to complain. Pros: Location, location location! I know it's been said on this website before but if you stay at Silver Lake you are as close to Disney as if you were staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (which you can see from the resort property). There's a back gate onto Sherbreth Road that, as you exit and turn left, puts you right onto the Disney property. We NEVER had any problems with traffic into or out of any of the Disney parks. I would like to warn all about Sherbeth Road -- it seems to have become the preferred cut-through to Disney and so can have heavy traffic. And most driving seem to be tourists (like us) who aren't familiar with where the turns are. We were rear-ended as we were stopped for a car in front of us turning (into the Disney security office no less). We are still dealing with this mess. It has nothing to do with Silver Lake of course.. I just want to warn others to be very cautious while driving on Sherbeth Road. CONS: 1) Not enough towel racks in the bathrooms! If our condo is for 6 people where in the world are they all to hang their wet bath towels? There was one small towel bar in the master bath and a towel ring in the other bathroom, and that was it. 2) The outside stairwells were filthly. When we arrived there was actually old, dried food on the stairs to our condo. I left it there, thinking that housekeeping would get to it after they cleaned the rooms nextdoor. After stepping over it more than a few times I eventually swept it up for them. I'm sure if I'd reported it they would've cleaned it up, but I don't think I should ask them to keep their stairs free of trash! 3) The Master bedroom and bath are seperated by glass-paneled french doors.. that had NO covering on them whatsoever! And one whole wall in the large masterbath was mirrors. So if anyone's in the bedroom there's no privacy in the bathroom! Some might like that I suppose (wink). Me... not so much. Parking was fine. The times we returned after 11PM we weren't able to park directly in front of our condo, but were no more than yards away. We would definitely recommend Silver Lake Resort to any families coming to Orlando, especially those going to Disney World because it's so very close and easy to get to from Silver Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort --- Would stay there again !!! :-)”
Reviews.Author: BELLAVEGAS
Reviews.Content: We stay at this resort for 16 nights in July 2007- Building 900 Unit 9410!!! It was an awesome resort. Staff was very friendly & willing to do anything to help. We were left messages on our voicemail reminding us if we needed anything to call the frontdesk & also they offered a shuttle for a Sterling Casino Cruise for $5 & gave details on how to book for the shuttle. Very close to everything by car. The room was clean & all the appliances worked!!! Had a washer & dryer in the room so it was perfect we never had to wait for other people to use it. My family loved the kids pool. If I had to say a negative comment about the resort the only thing I would say is that they should have a reserved stall for all the units because we usually stayed out late & by the time we came back to the resort we had to park far away from our building but a little walking never really hurt anyone. I definately recommend this resort for families!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MD_to_Disney
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a 2 week stay at Silver Laker Resort and I can truly say that it was a great experience. From the day we checked in until the day we checked out, we were comfortable, felt welcomed, and enjoyed all the ammenities. The front desk staff were all very nice...they even printed out our boarding passes the day before we checked out. Anytime I had a question, they were very courteous and found an answer. We stayed in a 2 BR, 2 Bath unit in the 300 building. The room was clean and VERY spacious. As a matter of fact, for the first week, there were 10 of us in the room...4 adults and 6 kids (ages 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, and 11). We had plenty of space...besides, we spent most of the time in the Disney theme parks or by the pool! The pool and sun deck are great. My family really enjoyed swimming there! The resort offers various activites for kids, adults, and families. My kids loved the poolside dancing and games. They also enjoyed the game room. Silver Lake is in a great location! Minutes from Disney...and right off of RT 192, which has everything you need (places to eat and shop). Summary: POSITIVES: Spacious room, awesome pool and sun deck, great location, clean, and nice front deck staff. Suggestions: Need a few area rugs in the living and dinning rooms (all tile floors), GO WIRELESS...and make it free!, make sure all rooms are equiped with a DVD player (ours did not have one), take down all the mirrors, and update some of the decor. Overall, we were extremely please with our stay at Silver Lake...it felt like our home for 2 weeks. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Silver Lake”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSts
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Silver Lake Resort for 3 nights. We checked in early, around 3:00 because our room was ready. We were in the 1700 building, on the 4th floor. We had a two bedroom condo, with the second bedroom in a lockout. Upon entering our condo, I was very impressed. It was much nicer than I expected. It was very modern and nice. There were little imperfections, such as grout stuck on tiles and loose tiles around the jacuzzi in the master bathroom but all in all, it was great. The beds were VERY comfortable, as were the pillows and bedding. Silver Lake also provides Bath and Body Works soaps and lotions which is a brand I frequently use so it was a nice addition. We did a deal to listen to the timespare session for two Disney tickets. My husband and I travel often about three times a year. We were paired up with Robin, who was very nice but new at the job. We would have definitely been done in the 90 alotted minutes but we basically learned about Robin's whole life. We are a young couple and take time to make serious purchases. When Robin's manager, George met with us to discuss purchasing a timeshare, he was very rude and curt. When we said that a timeshare was something we were interested in but needed to have some private time to talk about it, he became very rude and walked away. He basically sealed the deal that we would not purchase a timeshare. We did the Magic Kingdom and Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios so we did spend as much time in the rooms as we would have liked. We did use the main pool. Very nice, vary warm. We went in the pool late afternoon and it was not very crowded. All in all, Silver Lake Resort was a nice part of our two week vacation in Florida. It provided a clean and comfortable place to rest and relax. We would definitely stay at Silver Lake again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation at Silver Lake”
Reviews.Author: MsVacation876
Reviews.Content: Silver Lake Resort is fantastic. My husband and I spent our 1 year anniversary there. Our vacation was flawless. Silver Lake is gorgeous, clean, and friendly. The resort is 1.6 miles from Disney property, you can't get any closer. Make a left out of the back entrance to Silver Lake onto Sherbearth Rd, make a right onto Disney property. No highways! No traffic! You're there! Check in/ check out was simple, front desk staff was professional and courteous. The lobby is very inviting; it has a small, convenient store, gift shop, atm, comfortable seating, clean restrooms, tons of travel information and resort representatives are everywhere to help. Visit the tour desk and ticket sales to buy tickets to Disney and area attractions, we saved a lot of money purchasing the tickets at Silver Lake Resort. The main pool area is spectacular! It is in front of the 1800 building and next to the 1700 building. There is a smaller, quiet pool near the 1700 building. The main pool is huge, clean, not crowded and has enough beach chairs and towels for everyone. The cabana bar at the main pool provides music and entertainment, serves food and great drinks. There is a nice size hot tub at the main pool area. The rooms at Silver Lake are amazing. We stayed in the 900 building in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit. The room was very, very clean. No odors, no bugs! Air conditioning worked well. Beautiful, new furniture and comfortable, clean mattressess and bedding. The master bathroom is huge and has a jacuzzi tub for two! The kitchen has all appliances and everything you need including a dishwasher and the washer and dryer is a perfect convenience. The balcony area off of the unit is screened in. There is a nice size pool, beautifully landscaped at the 900 building. Plenty of parking close to the building. The trash room on each floor of the building is clean, and emptied often so there are no trash smells! The elevators were great and you can take the stairs. There are no ice machines, so buy a bag of ice and keep it in your fridge! Silver Lake Resort also has a movie theater and golf simulator. The golf simulator was very fun and helps to improve your game. You can play 18 holes, rain or shine, in air conditioning and watch each swing you take! Silver Lake Resort has a well equipped, and well maintained, gym and work out center with an awesome weight room, cardio machines and saunna. There is an activities center with a huge arcade and gameroom! A computer room with internet access. The resort provides a list of organized and directed activities for kids and families to participate in each day. Best of all, you can walk to everything I decribed at the resort from your room! No driving and parking! Don't be afraid to take the tour to get information about timeshares at Silver Lake Resort. It is worth it to get the discount on tickets to Disney and area attractions. The sales representatives are informative and not at all pushy. We didn't purchase a timeshare and no one bothered us about it. The sales tour takes an hour or more. Depends upon you. In addition to being on top of Disney property the resort is just seconds from highway 192 which has tons of shopping centers, stores, restaurants, hotels, attractions and service centers. The Orlando airport is about 18 miles away, an easy drive, takes about 30 minutes. Sea World and Universal studios are just past Disney, very close to Siler Lake. The front desk has great directions to these attractions. Check out my pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Our family had a great stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Shaygirl
Reviews.Content: I've been checking this website daily to read all the reviews to prepare me for my trip. I was very nervous, not knowing what to expect at Silver Lake but we just returned from our trip and I must say that it was sooo much better than I expected. We (myself, boyfriend & 2 kids; ages 10 & 13) stayed in room 8301B in the 800 building. The resort itself is a beautiful place. We checked-in around 3am in the morning and we were done in about 5 minutes. The guy behind the counter was very courteous and helpful. When we were walking down the hall towards our room, I got nervous because the carpet was badly stained throughout the hallway. I couldn't help thinking about some of the pictures here on tripadvisor and the bad experiences people had. I held my breath and opened the door. There was a smaller hallway/foyer inside with the other door to the "A" unit. We walked inside and I was amazed to how beautiful the room was. It was spacious and clean. The kitchen had all the necessary things that you could possibly need to prepare a meal, but it didn't have a dishwasher. There was a washer/dryer in the unit. I layed on the pullout sofa to make sure it was comfy for the kids and it passed the test. The master bedroom was very nice. The bed was so, so comfortable that I didn't want to get out of it. The bathroom had a regular DEEP tub and it was very clean. They even made decorations out of the towels. I have to complain about the shower head, though. It wasn't all that great, but it gets you clean. From our balcony, we had a view of the pond and the playground. We could see the main pool and the 1800 building in the distance. Our building was directly across from one of the pools, nice size and was never crowded. I have a few other complaints..............our unit had tiny ants everywhere but a can of raid solved that. Also, there was NO plasma TV. According to the floor plan that was emailed to me, a plasma TV should have been in the unit. We overlooked that since the kids had a TV to watch and my boyfriend and I had one in our room. Since we were harldy at the resort because of Disney, we really didn't get a chance to see what the resort had to offer. We did go swimming at the main pool and had a nice time. We checked out the arcade room and the kids loved it. FYI, because we were staying at the resort for 1 full week, we were offered a "free" middle of the week maid service. If you have any other questions, please email me.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ejwendeler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silver lake for 4 days and 3 nights, from July 21st - 24th 2007. We had a room in the 200 building. It was a 2 bedrooms suite with full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, one directly connected to the master suite, huge living/dinning room. We were 4 adults, but we could of easily slept 8 people. We booked threw Carson Travel (Ebay) and although I was very disappointed with them, the vacation was pretty good. We assisted a timeshare presentation. I was personally NOT impressed. Lots of BS!!! The resort in itself was clean, well kept. The staff was curtious and kind. In all we had a great time. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: FL_Kimmy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation in Orlando and you had better believe Ive come here to share our story regarding Silver Lake Resort & the Carson Travel (Ebay) package we won and expected. I had been researching a nice place and deal on a resort stay in Orlando. What I found was a "Luxurious" 2 Bedroom Condo via Carson Travel on Ebay. Lets just say that Luxurious was definately NOT what we got. "Dump" would be a much better description word which they should have used. Heres my story start to finish as to my experience here: We arrived Friday the 13th of July expecting a wonderful stay in this "Luxurious" room at this Five Star Resort. We were greeted quickly because it was late when we arrived and given a room in the 900 building. I had checked here via Travel advisor and saw someone elses stay in the 900 building was very good so I assumed to myself at that point....ok....we did good. We should have no problem and that we got "lucky" getting a room in one of the newer buildings and all should be good. NOT!! I probably should have known better than to book a vacation stay starting on Friday the 13th....but hey I was never suspicious until NOW! We headed up to our room in the 900 building. We used one of those luggage carts and got all of our stuff together and went up to the room. We walked into this "Luxurious 2 bedroom Condo" described on Ebay to find the Dump of Dumps! The room had black scuff marks all over the walls in the living room area when you first walked into the place. In the second bedroom which was suppose to be for the kids had the air conditioned vent exposed and falling down. The bathroom in which the "jacuzzi" tub was in the Master had black marks all over it as if someone had walked all around in there with dirty feet or shoes. The "Jacuzzi" tub itself was a complete joke in size. We've stayed at Westgate Vacation Villas b4 and was expecting the Jacuzzi tub like they offer there....which is a huge mini pool size Jacuzzi tub. This one was a regular size bathtub (maybe a touch bigger) with Jacuzzi jets. Blah! NOT what I expected at all. I had read up on the resort prior to going there and on their website they explain that there is DVDs in the rooms. NOPE! There was a VHS player in that one! 5 star??? Hmmmmm.... LOL! Kinda made me mad too cause I had rented some DVDs for the trip which we never could use. Ok..going off subject let me get back to the room. The furniture in the living room was OLD and WORE. Definately NOT what I was expecting. The bed in the Master looked as if someone had jumped up and down on it. Needless to say I sat down on the old chair in that living room and just started crying. My husband called down to the front desk and explained to them our disgust over the room they had given us. We were told that they would send someone up to check out the place. They sent up a security guard and the man in charge of housekeeping and they both said how they couldnt believe that they could give someone a room in that bad of shape and disarray. They said they would go down and tell them at the front desk and that they were sure something would be done. We waited 45 minutes in that "dump" of a room with no calls from the front desk. Finally my husband called down there again and was met with "Im sorry there are no other rooms". Can you believe that??????!!!!! They were not going to do ANYTHING to fix this situation and expected that we were just going to sit back and stay in that place. NOPE...not me. We hadnt unpacked anything and still had all of our stuff on the luggage rack. We just rolled it back downstairs and packed everything back into the van. We then proceeded down to the front desk where my husband went in and tried again to get this worked out because we were not going to stay in that room. The 2 girls at front desk were both rude and explained there were no other rooms and that there was nothing they could do. We tried to call Carson Travel on the "Emergency" number and nobody answered or called us back. We were just stuck. I was extremely angry at this point and moved all of our things into the lobby there at Silver Lake and proceeded to camp out there until something was done to fix this. The kids made a bed out of the couch there in the lobby. They put on their pajamas via the bathroom there in the lobby. My husband went to McDonalds and got the kids dinner which they sat and ate prior to laying down to sleep. They had their DVD players out watching them and just completely makeing themselves at home in the lobby. While it was a bit embarrassing, I didnt care...those people needed to know that we were not going to take this from them and that they had better give us another room. Our original check in time was approx 9:30pm that night....by the time all was said and done....it was now approx 3am in the morning and my family was still camped out in the lobby there at the resort. Finally a shift change of sorts happened and they had a new guy at the front desk who had no clue what was going on. My husband went to him and told him how the other girls would not offer us another room. He checked his computer and BAMMO guess what -- there WAS another room. He was kind enough to get us into that room which we inspected prior to dragging the kids up there who btw at this point were sleeping on the sofa there in the lobby. The room was acceptable. It was in the 800 building. It was a lock off 1 bedroom room with the other section we could use as well for the kids. Not very good considering they were two 11yr olds and were in the other lock off away from us. Sure they liked it, but not really something that should have been offered. My husband said we would take it for no other reason than the kids needed a place besides a sofa in the lobby to rest their heads and it was around 3am. That room was clean, but no DVD player, not even a VHS player in this one. Minor detail I know, but they advertise on their website that they have them in the rooms. They even go further to say that there is a place there in which you can rent DVDs. No such place exists there, so dont expect it. The first girl who was so rude told us that there were no DVD players at the resort at all...which I knew was a lie because of reading right here in Trip Advisor of some people mentioning them who very recently had gone to the resort. I really hate being lied to. We stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights. Things did seem to get somewhat better after that first night in the lobby, but I was still really upset over the way I was treated and lied to. We let the kids check out the ammenitys around the resort, they liked them. There were several pools and all were pretty accessible. They checked out the game room, which was a place they enjoyed however the website from this resort makes it seem that air hockey and pool were free for guests..its not. Make sure ya bring plenty o' money. The kids wanted to use the work out room and were met with a NO your too young. My husband had to specifically go down there with them to use it. They have a sauna useable from that area. The kids did like that...but again, a parent must be with them to use that area of the resort. The Computer area was free for guests but very small and you had to get on a waiting list to use it and kids were not allowed to use without an adult with them. Let me tell you, my kids can use a computer better than I can...but ok...we went with the rules there. You have to put your name on a list for a time you want to use the puter, and come back at that time to use it. They limit you to half hour at a time...so you sure better use it fast! They offered Karaoke on Friday night by the pool which sounded like alot of fun but we were camped in the lobby at the time and missed out on all that. The resort website mentions a Theatre for the kids. Saw the theatre but it was being used by the Timeshare people....not for what it was intended. Didnt see any time that a movie was offered for the kids. They tell you there are alot of activities for the kids and even have an activities center, but dont give you a list or call or anything telling you what they have for the kids. We had to call down ourselves to find out and were met with ....I think this is what they have available. Bah! Whatever. They had ice cream sundaes for 2.00 down at the main pool at 2pm daily. They did have that. They had a scavenger hunt Sunday night at the main pool but our kids were just a couple minutes late and there was nobody there that could tell them how to get involved in it. Overall once we were moved FINALLY to a new room, the resort stay was ok....but honestly it was the worst vacation I have ever had. The staff was mostly rude but the manager that next morning was nice...Ill give them at least that. The man giving the timeshare presentation was nice and he didnt try to pressure us at all considering the time we had the night b4. I told him right off the bat I wouldnt buy at that place EVER because of what I went through the night b4. He understood and explained to us that the first room we had is one owned by Carson Travel and that it only looked bad because it was one of their rooms. I dont know how much to believe of that considering each owner in the resort pays maintanace fees on the condo's/villas...but hey...I let the man talk. He explained to us that Carson Travel would no longer be allowed to have Silver Lake access...but Im willing to bet if I checked ebay right this second they would still be offering vacations there. In closeing.......your takeing a gamble in setting up a vacation at this resort. My advice is to ONLY get a Villa. They seem to be the newest and the nicest from my checking around while there. Dont pay attention to the pictures on the websites because those are ONLY the villas...they are NOT the condos. The condos are pretty generic overall. Read between the lines as to what you really are getting and expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: dolphingirl31
Reviews.Content: We (my friend, and 3 children ages 7,8,and 14) we exchange through RCI and saw that it was a gold crown resort. When we looked at the pictures on the website we thought it would be a nice resort. We were orginally placed in the 800 building in a B unit which was an 1 bedroom lockout unit meaning that it was suppose to be part of a three bedroom. We had a small master bedroom the pullout sofa was awful the children could barely sleep on it and w did not have a plasma tv, or dishwasher or a full-size kitchen our patio set only had one chair. On that Sunday we went on a tour of the resort and the sales people were really mean when we told them we already owned through RCI and we had just bought at Westgate Palace resort the day before (which by the way is beautiful, if you are interested in doing a 4 day 3 night visit for $99 at westgate please contact me) anyway we did the tour and was shown this beautiful model room. We immediately went to the manager and she changed our room that evening to the 1000 building we stayed in room 10106G which had all of the amenties on the website. Other then that the pool was nice. I will never stay at silver lake resort again the staff with the exception of the manager Federline was not all that friendly. Stay at Westgate Palace it is much prettier.

Reviews.Title: “1 week stay at SLR in 200 building, 2 bdroom unit”
Reviews.Author: oakmhr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Silver Lake Resort from June 23-30th, 2007. 2 bedroom unit in older 200 building. Check-in We were already in the area that morning so we called ahead to see about what time we could check in. They said the earlier we get there puts us on priority list, which we did. Check-in was a snap, very friendly service reps, and a quick stop at the time-share coordinator desk to get some coupons, our parking pass and get signed up for a time-share presentation. It was 10AM, and our room was not ready, but 2PM the room was ready. Check-in is 4pm so we got in a little early, which was great. Initial room tour Wow, huge 2 bedroom, we called it the "house of mirrors". Every vertical surface is covered in full floor to ceiling mirrors, and I mean everywhere. Somewhat dated decor, wicker chairs, simple counter tops and cabinets in kitchen, wicker entertainment center. Missing was a DVD or VHS player, don't know if it was just omitted or not available in the 200 building. Our patio, as all are, was screened in with a big ceiling fan, and the back of the unit looked out upon a nice greenbelt with a shared BBQ downstairs. We were on the 2nd floor, (stairs only) of a 3 story building. Kitchen was fully stocked and well appointed. This is a fully non-smoking resort, not voluntary, definitely non-smoking, not even an ashtray in sight!!! Unit was very clean. Master bedroom is huge with a pool like whirlpool tub, with more and more mirrors, and a separate walk-in shower. There was also a doored toilet, very private. Plenty of counter space in the master bedroom. The 2nd bathroom was a tub-shower combo with a toilet and vanity in one room. Good water pressure throughout!! No low flow shower heads! 2nd bedroom was a little small with 2 full beds. Very comfortable, pillow top mattresses, and more mirrors. We had a small flat screen TV in the 2nd bedroom, another TV in the master bedroom, and a 3rd in the living room. The 2nd bedroom lacked a decent night stand but had a 4 drawer chest that was old wicker but was functional. Combo laundry machines were just outside the 2nd bedroom and were in their own closeted/lighted area. The entire unit had no carpet, so watch out on slippery floors. The bedrooms had some rugs. The dining room table is glass as is the coffee table. A lot of space to spread out!! The patio was nice as well. No WI-FI available, but you can get in-room internet for $50 for the week, or $10 per day. No DVD or VHS! Cable TV had HBO, and the Disney Closed Network loop showing all resort stuff to do. Pool area Huge, free form pool. Actually the unit has 3. One big one with an island, a smaller one adjacent to it, and a 3rd pool a short walk across the parking lot to another building. There is just one rather small hot tub, which was way too hot. It felt hotter than 104'!!! Lots of chairs, tables and chaises. Karaoke was going on a few nights, there is a bar, pool side. Inside the main building there is a well equipped work out room, no kids under 16 were allowed. There is no restaurant at the resort, however at the poolside bar you can get burgers, salads and sandwiches. Pool says closed at 11pm, but I was swimming with other people at 1145 some nights. Location Its just a stone's throw to WDW. Just out the secondary exit/entrance, its about 1 minute to the Disney World property, and 2 minutes to Animal Kingdom entrance. We rented a car but shuttle service is available for a hefty $10 pp. The Silver Lake has very good security. 2 gates, both controlled and I saw roving patrols at all hours. Quiet at night. I-192 is just out the other gate. A winn-dixie type grocery store is right outside on I-192 and a Publix just a mile or so away on 192. Plenty of eateries on 192. The location could not be beat, unless you were actually on the property itself!! Notes on the week. The business center was quite small and not very useful. Maid service is available mid-week for a fee. They provide 1 trial box of laundry soap and dishwashing powder and additional will cost you $.75, buy some at Winn Dixie for the week. We went to the timeshare presentation which was about 1.5 hours, with provided breakfast which was good. Very low pressure, and since we already had our WDW tickets, they gave us $80 cash. Staff was very friendly and professional. The 200 building is showing its age, on the inside but outside was bright and cheery. I hope Florida recycles, we put many many plastics and cardboard out in the trash and hopefully it wasnt just dumped. Overall Overall a very nice timeshare resort. Clean units, worked well for us and we had not a single complaint. Older in some buildings. The staff said the buildings we were in were due for renovation sometime soon. They are 16 years old now. Other buildings are newer or have been recently renovated. We stayed at Bonnet Creek resort the previous week, so look for that review and photos as well.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: melloyello1
Reviews.Content: I must say, I was a bit skeptical staying at Silver Lake Resort after reading some of the reviews. My husband and I as well as our children checked in on Sunday, June 24, 2007 and checked out Sunday, July 1, 2007 and paid a great price for the time we were there. Yes...it was a tour we had to take for 90 minutes, but it was worth it for the price we received. The breakfast wasn't so great, but we normally ate breakfast in our room anyway. The room was excellent. I was doubtful after reading the reviews, but our room had been updated in March of 2007. We had new carpet, ceramic tile, a nice clean bathroom and all new furniture. I did not see any bugs/roaches as I had read on a few reviews. As a matter of fact I did not see any creepy crawlers! I was very satisfied. If you are anything like me, I took bug spray just in case! I also took antibacterial items to clean a little myself just in case they did not wipe down certain items in the room. The pools were nice and that was the highlight for my children because they are swimmers. We stayed in the 1700 building. As a matter of fact we stayed in 1740 B to be exact. Had no problem with guest services, they were very nice/helpful. I had a few post cards to be sent to family members and they took care of sending them out for us. We called for new towels and they brought them immediately. I am not sure how the other rooms looked around me, but the unit we were in was great. Also, the parks were not too far from the site, approximately 20 minutes. We went to Island of Adventure and Universal Studios, however the traffic the first day was heavy on 192 and I-4 so leave a little early to avoid heavy traffic. My husband and children had no complaints. I would recommend Silver Lake Resort. The Gibson's in Huntsville, AL

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay says: Family from Tennessee”
Reviews.Author: kimmy353
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Orlando. Silver Lake Resort was much better than I expected. I had read some reviews that wasn't very good, but for my family and I; it was great. We had 4 teenagers with us, and they could go and do whatever they wanted on the resort. The pool was awesome, and also the hottub. They had a computer room, so they could check their email, and a game room to play pool, ping pong, etc. We felt really safe letting them go out together bytheirselves as long as the 2 girls were together or the 2 boys were together. Security was always on the property; so that made us feel much better. We did have one problem. Our central unit tore up and we had to move to a different condo at 12:00 midnight one night. But a very nice security guy came and helped us move and we only had to move over one unit and up one floor. The condo was identical to ours. It was beautiful, with mirrors everywhere. Our kids loved it too. We also had the big jacuzzi tub. Thanks Silver Lake for making our stay GREAT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Rooms Need Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Patti4554
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed at the Silver Lake Resort and was somewhat disappointed in our room. The location was great and the pool was splendid; however, our rooms left something to be desired. The bathtub faucet in the master bathroom had mold or soap scum underneath it, the air conditioned froze up on several ocassions leaving me miserable and uncomfortable for most of my stay. Upon reporting for my timeshare tour, I advised the sales associate of the problems and she simply stated that the best rooms were saved for the owners and that I was staying in one of the older units. She went on to say that I was lucky to be staying at the resort and that the older units were going to be renovated over a period of time. This did nothing for my vacation during this year. I reported the problem with the air conditioner to the front desk and they sent out repairmen. The repairmen supposedly fixed the problem, but the air conditioned froze up again. Also, if you need to use the internet, you can, but there is no way to print anything. The front desk will print your boarding passes for you, but nothing else. It was really a poor performance for a resort trying to sale timeshare property! If it were not for the great time we had at the Disney and Universal parks, our vacation would have been ruined by our resort accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zachmb
Reviews.Content: The resort is in a great location to Disney. We could see Animal Kingdom, Blizzard Beach, and part of what I believe was Epcot. At 10:00, you can go out on your patio and watch Disney's fire work show. We stayed in the 1000 building which was very nice. The plasma T.V.'s made me feel like I was at home. If planning on going to Disney buy your tickets at the ticket counter, but make sure you call prior to ensure that your tickets will be there when you arrive. The secuirty here was great. The resort could need some help with their trash issue, instead of placing cans on each level for guests to place their trash. This causes the level to have a bad smell. On our last night at this resort at the pool next to the 1000 building, there was a snake on the pool deck crawling arround.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Disney”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: We were in a 1-bedroom unit in the 10000 building. Although technically not a lockout (as both units enter through a common foyer with no direct door between A & B units), it didn't have the complete amenities of the big room (large flat screen TV, dishwasher) and as someone else posted, the layout is awkward (the kitchen is basically a hallway and bathroom door opening both into bedroom and directly into small living room means absolutely no privacy for more than 2 people). We had three adults and the space wasn't laid out in a way that worked well. Having said that, the room was clean and maintenance quickly fixed a burned-out light bulb. The grounds are well-kept and the pool areas appeared clean. I was surprised to see a washer/dryer in this small a unit, but it was definitely welcome. We are theme-park commandos so spent very little time in the room or at the resort. One poster commented on the availability of wireless, but it is $10/day. The "business center" had three PC's running basically in a large closet (not terribly pleasant), but for goodness sake, it's the 21st-century. If you're going to offer online access, do it right and offer free in-room wireless. For visiting the Disney parks, the location is fantastic. My only other beef with the property is that we reserved by exchanging through RCI Points. I already own vacation property. So why do I get badgered about coming to a sales presentation? After quick checkin, got directed to an 'associate' who made small talk for FIFTEEN minutes before asking us about attending a breakfast 'tour' of the resort. Perfectly pleasant, but it took several refusals before he would stop. We received two phone calls during the week again inviting us to breakfast, each time with a more lucrative offer. I didn't book this resort off EBay and I didn't get a 'special' rate for attending a sales presentation. Someone else is using our very nice resort in Kauai while we're here in Florida and I don't want my time wasted by sitting in a lobby chit-chatting when I could be getting some serious Mickey time. I expect better of a Gold Crown resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Oriented Resort”
Reviews.Author: mickeychickcanada
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here thru RCI Points. This is a great family oriented hotel. WE stayed in the smaller half of the 1 bedroom lock off, and it was okay for a family of 4. Bedroom had a King bed and living room sofa pulled out to a bed for the kids. Kitchenette was adaquetely stocked with necessities. Main pool area was wonderful - arcade very large - free movies and activites for the kids every day. GREAT place to stay. Cabana bar beside the main pool serves drinks and light snacks. OH, and we LOVed THE BACK GATE out of the resort which takes you out pretty much at the Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge so it's practically on the Disney property! Very easy access to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: buppa6805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a week and it was neither great nor horrible. We booked this as a timeshare last-call vacation so I can't complain about the price. I was, however, expecting a gold crown resort and it didn't meet those expectations. We had a one bedroom unit but it was extremely small. The kitchen was a hallway and in the living area was crammed a dining table, a coffee table and a pull-out couch. Both the kitchen table and coffee table were glass which wasn't kid friendly and there just wasn't enough room to walk around comfortably. We also didn't have a dishwasher which is something I have come to expect with gold crown resort. The kitchen and living room was tile, which isn't bad, but it was filthy. As soon as you walked across the floor your feet were soiled. We also did not have any maid service for the entire week but could have for a price. The resort also charges for the use of a crib. I have never heard of this before and we weren't informed of this when we called to request a crib in our room. The resort did refund us this charge but blamed the timeshare company for not informing us even though we spoke directly with the resort. The pool near the 900 building was beautiful. It was warm, clean and not crowded at all. The towels were horrible but they dried you off. We only went to the main pool once because the other pool was so nice. I wouldn't have gone back to it even though they had a nice little poolside bar. It was cold and the kiddie pool was filthy. There were napkins or some sort of wet paper products floating around it. The location of the resort was great. It was very close to Disney and Rte. 192. It was also far enough off the main drag to seem secluded. I really wanted this resort to be special, I had heard good things, but I was kind of disappointed with it. I would still recommend it if you could get a good deal I just wouldn't buy a timeshare there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay even with small children”
Reviews.Author: mintelf
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why any one would give this property a bad review. The rooms are nicely decorated. There is some glass if you have children but our 3 year old was fine with the glass. It is like everything you just have to keep an eye on your kids and not let them go crazy. The staff was very good with anything we needed and everything was very clean. The Location cannot be beat except Disney properties themselves. Great Location does not begin to describe it. I have been in Timeshare Opertaions NOT sales and we got the good deal as long as you tour the propery. I went set on not buying timeshare and we actually bought. It is much different here because Silver Lake is not owned by a large company. But it is a single property. If you are going to the Orlando area and Disney is the key to your vacation. You cannot go wrong with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jmsquared
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Lake resort in March of 2007 with family. I actually had booked the initial vacation through a company that solicits using E.Bay, so as I'm sure many can well imagine, I was quite nervous. I do consider myself to be a fairly seasoned traveller, and have experienced both wonderful and horrific vacations. Before actually leaving, we read several reviews on this resort both positive and negative. After experiencing the resort for ourselves, we both felt compelled to share our experiences. When we booked, we were under an agreement that required my Fiancee and I to attend a timeshare presentation. We had attended one before in Mexico and it was terrible, the sales associates were forceful and rude. This was quite the opposite. We actually enjoyed the timeshare presentation, it taught us a lot about timeshares and all representatives were friendly and helpful. We felt neither pressured nor insulted. The resort itself is quite pretty, it's in Florida, so of course if you're expecting a beachfront property with beautiful sunsets, you won't get it in Kissimmee. It did, however, offer many of the features that are normally at beach resorts. (i.e. swim up bar, daily activities, etc.) Our room was absolutely beautiful, there were zero insects, which is unheard of in Florida, ceramic tiles, fully equipped kitchen, clean and newly renovated bathroom, screened patio, and huge windows. All pools were clean and big, and sturdy lawn chairs were scattered everywhere. Towels were easily accessible both in pool areas and at the front desk, and all staff was friendly, polite, and helpful. We never struggled for a parking spot or for a spot by the pool. It seemed that because there were several pools, children seemed to stick to one and adults to another, which was perfect. The only thing that we could think of that was negative was that it was very difficult to get some time on the internet in their public computer area, however, that being said, wireless internet was available in the room, we just did not bring our laptop. The drive to Disney was so easy, it was basically one street and one exit and the signs are everywhere. We had read several negative reviews for Silver Lake before leaving, and all I can say is that it's not the Hilton, or the Hyatt. It was 100% to our satisfaction and exceeded the expectation for what we paid. I have paid more than double in the past for less than half the experience. If you read about insects or bad customer service, that simply was not the case for us. We try not to visit the same place twice, but if we do go back to Florida, Silver Lake would be number one on our list of places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake....it's so so”
Reviews.Author: jms2773
Reviews.Content: Went with another family for the first week of April. Check in was fairly smooth. We were assigned to the 1800 building, and our friends to the 1700 building. Our room was very outdated. No flat screen tv's, old appliances, jacuzzi didn't work, dirty floors, but we made due. Our friends in the building next to us had a newly renovated room with nice furniture, flat screens , and new appliances. On the 3rd day of the trip, our friends were informed their bathroom was leaking water into the unit below and they had to move. After messing them around for a day, they finally put them in a very nice new unit. Anyway, the good: the pools are nice and aren't crowded. The bad: service. I would rate this resort a 5 on a scale of 1 to 10. If you can get a good deal, it's ok for the money, but don't overpay....you'll be sorry. BTW, we paid $510 for 6 nights ( had to do the timeshare pitch).

Reviews.Title: “Looooooooooooooved Silver Lake!”
Reviews.Author: cfrosthair_123
Reviews.Content: Checked out of a 5 night stay at Silver Lake on March 31. My husband and I had a 1 bedroom 3rd floor pool-view unit in 1800 building. We had lots of pool noise till 11pm but I DID love the view. We ate EVERY meal on the balcony, a lovely screened in and private nook. Our unit was immaculate and the AC worked perfectly. We would have enjoyed a stereo for music. The main pool was busy so we used the corner pool next to it. Water was at least 85 degrees or so. We never used the hot tub since our unit had a wonderful jacuzzi-for 2 which we filled every night. Walls were so quiet that we never heard any neighbors for days on end! Same goes for above and below us! Our room smelled like someone cooked fish in it on day 1 but we went out to Publix and bought fresh salmon and broiled it in the unit! haha We just added to it! No big deal. We used the computers to check our mail~ handy but slow. We enjoyed the exercise room just once, too busy doing theme parks otherwise. We went on the $5 p.p. gambling cruise and loved it except for the smokers. Loved meeting fellow vacationers there. Everyone was having a great time. We had tons of parking at all times. The front desk was very professional. We made $80 cash by viewing a time-share. All in all it was a perfect stay with perfect weather! we would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It At ANY Price!!”
Reviews.Author: Madcapsjs
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The good? We were able to stay at SLR for 6 days/5 nights for $170, including sales tax. The bad? I would have been better off just chucking my money out the window on our drive down to Florida. Right off the bat, I want to tell you that if you have small children, or toddlers, you really need to stay away as almost everything in the villas is GLASS! Perhaps it's because I have been in customer service for most of my professional career that people who have NO business in the service industry stand out to me. That would pretty much be everyone who works for SLR, with very few exceptions. Now, you may read other reviews that tell you that the staff at this place is exceptional and so forth and so on...it may very well appear to you like that is the case if you are someone who sets the bar pretty low on your expectations. So, please tell me if I am asking too much... I expect that when I am asking about checking in at a front desk that the person behind the counter not act as if I am interrupting a phone call they are having with their boyfriend. I expect that when said person is finally done with their conversation, that they not address me by saying, "Yea...what?" I expect the security guards at the front gate to see my valid parking pass and not stop me each and every time wanting to see 3 pieces of ID as if they are undercover agents of Homeland security and allow me on the property. I expect my room key to work more than 2 times in a row. I expect that on an 85 degree day, that my air conditioner work at least a wee bit. I expect to not have to park a 1/2 mile from my building because there are not enough parking spaces. I expect to have a TV that is actually hooked up and remotes that do work. I expect to walk into a nonsmoking room and not have the place smell as if the Marlboro Man just died in there. I expect to be able to open a cabinet and NOT have a huge glass punch bowl break near my 14 month olds foot because it was stacked so that it was BALANCING on a sugar bowl, which was BALANCING on the cover to a serving dish. I expect that at least a few members of the staff have more than a limited familiarity with English. I expect the "Business Center" to have more than 3 dial up computers that run on something a bit more current than Windows 95 and I.E. 4. I expect to not have holes in my sheets, have mildew in my tub & shower, or have to bag and toss my own trash and then find out where the dumpster is. Finally, I expect that when I call the front desk to express concern or ask for something to be fixed, that it does not take 3 hours or that they actually write it down and not verbally shout it from department to department so in the event the travel agent calls up to inquire about all of my "complaints," that there is an actual record of them so that I don't look like a complete putz who just likes to make things up. You know that you are in the wrong place when you need to have a vacation from your vacation. Other than that, it's a great place to stay. I hope this helps you in some way.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back!”
Reviews.Author: Keha16
Reviews.Content: We also booked through Carson travel on Ebay. We arrived and had absolutely no problems. I loved this place. We were in a gorgeous 2 bedroom. We were in the 1700 building and it is being renovated. The room was like new. The furniture and everything. It was so great and I would love to return. I especially like my jacuzzi tub!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Fabulous Room!”
Reviews.Author: pjonbread
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to set the record straight for this resort. My husband & I booked through Carson Travel and would do it again in a second. We got to the resort late and the front staff were pleasant and friendly. Had a little bit of key trouble and they were there to service us in minutes. We had requested a newer building and had been given our request. WE stayed in the 800 building, I highly recommend this building. we had unit 8203, it was a one bedroom unit and it was breath taking. We came in to the unit and were so impressed, it was not like any of the pictures on here, the owners of this resort really should update their photos of the resort because it far exceeded our expectations after readings the reviews on this website. It was very very clean, well supplied and very trendy and new decor. We had a plasma tv that was a delight to watch, a gorgeous bathroom that was wonderful to relax in, and the best bedroom I've ever seen for a hotel room, it was so spacious, it wasn't huge but the 12 foot (maybe) ceilings really took away from any crampyness. The liani was great, it was nice to leave the doors open at night an feel the breeze and hear the water fountain in the little lake it backed out onto. now of course every place if you want to be petty, has a negative so lets get to it. THe Toilets sounded like a jet engine, their was no keeping your hubby sleeping while you flushed, the couch was a little hard to relax on, the hall outside our room smelled of urine one of the days we were there, but it was only a short lived time of it so it may have been resolved. A swim up bar woud be great :) the buffet meal for the timeshare was very lacking. don't hold out and miss a meal becasue you think your gonna have something good there, becasue it won't happen. they could stand to have an individual basketball court and an individual tennis court instead of it sharing the same area, hard to play a good game otherwise. Other than that it was a great time and a great stay and My husband & I were sad to go. WOuld definetely stay there again Paula & Jimmy

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect location and resort!”
Reviews.Author: nabe-chan
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews here on TripAdvisor, I decided to take the plunge and book a fantastic rate on eBay for the Silver Lake Resort. Yes, it required I spend 90 minutes in a timeshare presentation - but I wasn't pressured AT ALL. In fact, it was kind of interesting...but my husband and I already knew the whole timeshare thing wasn't right for us. We brought along my mother and 2 1/2 year old daughter and stayed in a two bedroom, two bath unit. And although I took the advise of other reviewers here and requested a newer building, we were placed in the 100 building - the original. As it turns out, I was SO PLEASED...and I'll tell you why: we had a 1st floor unit, which was a blessing due to the fact my daughter loved to run around the place - had we been on the 2nd or 3rd floor, neighbors would have definately complained; and we had the most wonderful views of a beautiful nature/tree area that was so peaceful - we enjoyed a couple of meals and quiet reading time in the veranda area off the living room. Many other units have "views" of the pool area or, worse yet, the parking. After the first few nights, I returned to the front desk and shared my delight about the 100 building with the staff. Unfortunately three days into our stay, other guests were placed in the unit above us. There must have been six or so college-aged young men in the unit and I'm not being sarcastic when I say it was LOUD! Every footstep could be heard (likely due to the ceramic tile flooring) I did complain directly to the guys after a couple of days and they immediately turned down the music/noise level. However, there seems to be very little noise insulation between the floors - so you may want to take this into consideration and request the upper level. My only other "complaint' is the noise level from the pool area. On many afternoons and evenings they conduct various activities - which is a big plus for a lot of people - not those of us with a child who needs to nap or who you try to get to sleep by 8:30 p.m. The 2nd bedroom faced the parking area, adjacent to the main pool. The stereo blasted a lot of music that was wasn't so pleasant...but like I said, this might be something others don't mind and actually enjoy! We were there the first week of March, 2007. Weather in Orlando was lovely, mid 80's the first part of the week and a bit cooler in the lower 70's the last part of our week. Both the air conditioning and heating (yes, we did turn on the heat one night) worked just fine, as did all the very new appliances and washer/dryer. The unit was well stocked with all the needed utencils/pots/pans, etc. The pools were very nice, but not as heated as perhaps I would have preferred. The kids activities were a nice touch, though mostly geared toward kids above the age of five. Other good features include the nightly movies in the theater and the gift shop - well stocked and reasonably priced last-minute items. I couldn't agree more with other reviewers about the location of SLR...literally in the back yard of Animal Kingdom! It was so convenient to visit all the Disney parks and be able to come back for lunch and an afternoon break. We saved a ton of $ by cooking our own meals in the unit - but you will need a car. We shopped at Publix just a mile away (or less) and only ate out once - lots of choices of chain restaurants on highway 192. All in all, I'd definately come back again (especially given that we had a GREAT rate through eBay). I would not hesitate to stay in one of the older units, though probably in an upper floor. Feel free to contact me with any questions. I love this site and would be happy to give my 2 cents worth to others traveling to Orlando with a toddler!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: david7621
Reviews.Content: Stayed a 5 night stay for a great price thru Ebay and it was well worth it...I did have a newer 2 bedroom and it was very well equipped and decorated very nice....Pool is huge and was nice to lay out by just chilling....Lots of activities for kids and some for adults as well.....had to do the timeshare presentation and have to say wasnt too bad at all, our salesman tried but wasnt too pushy and we were there just over the 90 minutes...only problem had was no hot water one day but the problem was taken care about an hour later....Would recomend to people looking for a nice play to stay

Reviews.Title: “SO CLOSE TO MICKEY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NotAHooiser
Reviews.Content: Our family was there the week of Feb 26th. My husband and I booked our stay through E-bay and Carson Travel after doing much research. I had read the reviews of Silver Lake before purchasing the trip through Ebay. I had seen mixed reviews, but figured we would give it a shot. We were really enticed by the closeness of the place to Disney. We traveled with our 3 yr old son and 4 1/2 mth old daughter. I must say overall, the stay was very pleasant. We stayed in the 1800 unit right next to the very large pool that our son LOVED to swim in. Though while there, the heater in the large pool was not working, the water was still warm (though on the chilly side) to swim in. The other pools were nicely heated. The 1 bedroom/1 bath condo was nicely decorated. All the appliances worked. The stackable washer/dryer was very useful. There was a screened in patio that was especially nice given our 3 yr old son. The bed was VERY comfortable! We did not have a DVD player in our room but I think I was told some rooms have them and some rooms do not....no biggie as we had no time to watch movies as we were too busy going swimming and to Disney. Speaking of Disney, this place is soooo close to Disney it is unbeliveable. We literaly made it to the different theme parks within 5 min! Plus the way you come in, you beat allot of the traffic. Location of this place is a HUGE plus....and it is on the West side of 192/Irlo Bronson so it is not as busy. There is pleanty of shopping and food options. Actually it is off of Sheberth Rd which is the road between the end of Disney property/Orange County and Osecola County. In fact, Disney casting and wardrobe across the street. While we were there, they were doing refurbishment to the 1700 buidling....lots of workers around and huge semis that took up part of the parking lot....again no biggie as we were on vacation. They did not bother us and we were able to get a good parking spot. My husband and son enjoyed the game room. They have a computer room that you can use for internet by the game room. If you want to use the wireless if you have a laptop, you have to pay a fee. This was a little annoying as we did bring our laptop and I don't understand why hotels just provide it, but would not prevent me from staying there. We attended a time share presentation as a part of our package. For the most part is was low-key, though the manager had 'access' to inventory that our salesman did not and the price came down dramatically. We did not buy the timeshare and after saying no a couple of times we were let go. We were t here about 2 hrs, but we did not push the 90 min time limit either. They provide a supervised playroom for kids 3 and up which was very helpful as we have a very active 3 yr old. We kept our dauther with us and it was not a problem at all. Though the timeshare offer they have based is on a point system through RCI is interesting, just not a good fit for our family. Overall, we will keep this place in mind for future travel to Disney due to its location. The place was clean and people were friendly. It is not a 5 star resort, so do not expect that. If you are looking for something reasonablly priced and close to Disney, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds nice, condo smelt - on small side”
Reviews.Author: fla4funOntario
Reviews.Content: The grounds are nice - pool area very large. The room itself (1 bedroom condo) was small and had a strange smell. Not much place to put clothing or luggage. Luckily we were only there 2 nights. Took part in the time share presentation - they want at least 3-4 hours of your time. Thery are very persistent and barely let us leave the presentation after the our 90 min. obligation was fulfilled. Disney tickets are higher priced here (by $5.00/child) so wait and buy at the gate. We were in the older building by the large main pool - other reviews state new area much nicer. NO signage to tell you have arrived at Silver Lake - seems rather odd if vast development underway. Staff pleasant. We won't return. Not really horrible - just not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Worst-Worst -Worst”
Reviews.Author: susanlt1
Reviews.Content: We had paid extra for upgrade- it was Christmas. Room was filthy-so we called front desk. They could of cared less. We were to get $500.00 worth of coupons- no such thing happened. Service non-existant from front desk, management and housekeeping. Would never never never have anything to do with resort or Joe Hannah again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: pruec
Reviews.Content: Having read some rather negative reviews, we were very pleased with our very spacious 2-bedroom/2bath unit 625.
