Although it was one of the original units, it had apparently been recently refurbished. The king size bed was very comfortable. All the appliances worked including the washer/dryer. The front desk personnel were very pleasant and helpful. It is very convenient to DisneyWord and nearby shopping and restaurants. In return for attending a 1-hr time share talk, we were offered $70 cash or discounted dinner show or theme park tickets. The heated pool was very pretty. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I expected”
Reviews.Author: BluEyes-TRIP
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at SLR. I booked a one bedroom with full kitchen in the 1800 bulding overlooking the pool. This building has been recently revovated and I believe they took studio units and turned them into one bedrooms. There were no end tables in the master bedroom and barely enough room to walk around the bed (I am a trim woman). Only one tiny closet in the entire unit, no storage in living area. Very small TV in living room. The whole place felt cramped except the bathroom, which had a huge jacuzzi tub and separate shower. My unit did have a full kitchen and a washer and dryer. Publix is a few miles west on I92, and many shops and restaurants in the area, but you do need a car. Pool is beautiful and comfortably heated, but had no chlorine in it the entire week. This is a safety issue that needs to be addressed! Other than feeling very cramped, the unit was beautiful and the king bed was very comfortable. There are other one bedrooms there that are much roomier, be careful when you book. The older 500 building has huge units and the 800 and 900 building are new and spacious. I chose the 1800 building because I wanted to be right next to the main pool. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved This Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TrixieWI
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a beautiful property! The pools were great, heated even! The cabana bar at the main pool was a big plus...fun activities, good drinks, great sandwiches. We were here late November, FL had a cold spell, but the pools were heated and the hot tub was great! Nice to see that these didn't close due to colder weather. Front desk staff very helpful, kind, courteous and informative. SO, SO close to Disney, it was a breeze getting in and out of the parks. The room was immaculate and had everything we could have possible needed for our stay. The front desk staff called and left a message every other day to make sure that all was well and we had what we needed....gave temperature updates and information on guest activities for the upcoming week. So handy to have a washer and dryer in the room, going home with clean clothes instead of dirty so nice! Beautiful marble countertops, the jacuzzi was great after long days of walking at Disney. Extremely large and comfortable beds. Will stay here again and again and again. We had 5 people in a 2 bedroom in the 1000 building, had way more room than we needed and even the sofa bed was comfy. Don't miss this resort!!!! Security was highly visible in all areas day and night, kids and adults felt secure walking to activities at night.

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETE DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: LR9
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we had problems with the phone, TV & the safe. These problems were eventually solved, but our camcorder disappeared in the confusion and has yet to be resolved. Mgr has blamed us for allowing someone to walk out of the unit with our camcorder "right under your noses". I guess we should have kept a better eye on HIS employees. Hmmm The plumbing fixtures in both bathrooms were not anchored to the wall. If you walked around the unit in socks, they were soon black with filth. Master bath wreaked with the smell of urine. Cockroaches in the kitchen. I think you get the point.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: love2travel321
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week long stay at Silver Lake Resort and to say the least I was nervous about the stay. I had been checking the reviews for a while before our trip and taking the advice of others I had called ahead to see about being changed to the newer buildings. I was told that there were no openings available to be moved into, but was assured that our condo was very nice. When we got there check-in was a breeze - in and out of the lobby in less than 5 minutes. We were put in the 700 building which had been remodeled and it was GREAT! We had 2 bedrooms, 2 bath and it was HUGE! We had plenty of space to spread out, the master bathroom was awesome - the tub was HUGE as was the shower. Our kids used the tub as their own personal hot tub!! On one of the nights our son got sick, when we called housekeeping they rushed right over with clean linens for the bed. I didn't get a chance to see any of the other units but ours was very clean, had all the comforts of home and then some. The main pool and the cabana were awesome, HUGE!!! Check out was great, same as check in, in and out in less than 5 minutes. My family and I will definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort”
Reviews.Author: abhetrck
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews of Silver Lake, I was very leary of what we were going to find. We stayed in the 1000 building for a week and it was great. The staff at check in and also when we left was extremly helpful and checkin and out was a breeze. The Cons. Carla and the other one (don't know her name) was also great. Any prob. we had (which were few) where taken care of immed.I can't say to much about the amenities there as we didn't have time to do anything with all the other stuff we did. The whole area and our condo was very clean. I don't know about any of the other buildings but ours and it was great. I will say, I was glad we didn't go the week before as the love bugs were out big time and I don't like bugs of any kind. We came in on 10/1 and they were just about gone. Thank you Staff, you made a very pleasant week for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and great resort,But some quirks”
Reviews.Author: broadwayyguyy
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the resort after a weeks stay, will divide up review into negative and positives. I was given a one bedroom unit in the 800 building. The 800 building is one of the newer buildings(along with 900 and 1000. Negatives- 1) We saw two giant roaches and one waterbug the first day, We called the front desk and reported the problem,granted they sent someone up to spray right away and we didnt see anymore, and this was after the rain storm, but the thought lingered,they need a much better extermination contract. 2) They have some kind of keyboard with wireless service but there is no manual to explain how to use it and what its for, calls to the front desk found them totally clueless. In addition, i was charged for a movie i didnt watch (like i would spend 12.95 for Garfield)and a day of internet use that i never used (prob from playing with the impossible to understand wireless internet trying to understand it.) Despite calling the front desk and being told someone would get back to me about the overcharge, they went ahead and charged me and i never heard from them. The front desk people need to be more accountable. 3) The Jacuzzi in the newer units is very small compared to the older units. 4) The pillows are as hard as rocks. 5) They have 3 pools, but no adults only pool.which is good if you have kids, if you dont. they are all over the pools. An adults only pool is desperately needed 6) Internet access is expensive 9.95 day or $49.99 for the week. should be free or much cheaper. especially since they have only 2 computers working in the business center. Positives 1) It has the biggest and best pool in all of Florida ,and its open until 11 pm every night. There are also 2 other smaller, quieter pools 2) The resort is very quiet and convenient to disney world. 3) Staff is very friendly 4) Plasma television in the newer units is a nice touch, but other 2 TVs in unit were tiny. Summary, overall nice resort with a great pool and a great family atmosphere, i did have a great time .it may seem like i nitpicked, but i expect more in a RCI gold crown resort.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry Excuse for a "RESORT"”
Reviews.Author: crjpilotswife
Reviews.Content: Stay w/ my family during Labor Day weekend. What a disaster! Arrived and check-in smoothly at 4pm. We were given a unit 1700 bldg. Should have know something was "up" when I saw what was in the hallway outside our door (see photos). Proceeded to get settled in and noticed there was no hot water, thought it was "no big deal" at the time. So we headed out for dinner. Upon returning around 8pm wanted to bathe my younger 2 children and STILL no hot water. So no bath for them, (Day # 1 no hot water). The next a.m. my older daughter took a shower fine, then when I go to get in, hair full of soap and THE WATER GETS CUT OFF!!!!!! (Day # 2 no hot water). If this resort expects to keep guest coming back they better step up their effort. The full mirrored walls went out with the 80's and the tropical wicker funiture has to go. If you've never seen a flat screen TV and it's a BIG DEAL for you and want to spend your vacation watching one, then stay here. But there are much better places in the orlando area to stay. If I could give this place a -0 I would. Be sure and check out the view from our room, it's GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION/GREAT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: jpjande
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! I would give it a 4 1/2 star rating. We were a bit nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews posted on this website. In order to avoid some of the complaints (old decor, cockroaches, dirty carpets), we requested a newer building via email to the reservations department (there were no complaints about the rooms in the newer buildings (800, 900, 1000). I received a response within 24 hours of my initial request from Kristi, the reservation manager (she was so friendly and accomodating), stating that I would need to "downgrade" to a different floor plan in order to make the change to a newer building. We were originally assigned a room in building 500 (2 bdrm), which had 2 full beds, queen sofa, and king bed. The floor plan differed only slightly and we lost the 2 full for a king, so we went for it, based on the reviews here. I was glad we did, although I never got to see the 500 building to compare. I did see some photos online of the older buildings and thought we'd go for the newer. We were placed in the 900 building, which I understand is a newer building. We were a family of 6 (2 small children and 4 adults). The unit was a "lock-off" unit, which was great since we were traveling with my husband's parents. This gave us the extra privacy, but we left the door open so that they could use the kitchen when necessary. The smaller part of the unit (H, I think) had a microwave and refrigerator, king bed, bathroom and screened in porch (much like a regular hotel room, with a little extra). The rest of the unit had a full size kitchen (fully stocked with all we needed), bathroom w/jacuzzi bath/shower, bedroom (king), living room w/pullout queen size sofa and plasma tv (nice), and screened in porch. Here are the positives: 1--EXTREMELY close to Disney (you're right in Animal Kingdom's backyard, practically). If you follow the hotel's directions, it's the best, going through the back gate. 2--Nice decor--tiled floors throughout, except in the bedrooms, where it's carpeted. 3--awesome pool--they just opened one right next to the 900 building and it is zero entry (like a beach) on one end w/spray fountains--great for the kids. This one is much less crowded and more low key than the main pool. The main pool is nice too, but it's a bit noisy (there's a bar there and they play loud music) and more crowded. 4--FRIENDLY staff. We had the nicest staff check us in and help us w/reservations. We were part of the RCI reservations and were never pestered for a time share presentation, which was a plus! Our room was missing the cookie sheets and they delivered them right away. 5--All the comforts of home. We were able to cook dinner in the room each night and pack lunches for days in the park (they never stopped us from bringing lunch in each day at Disney--a great money saver). We were able to do laundry as we needed to, so we always had fresh towels and clothes to wear. I don't mind doing these things if it saves us money. NEGATIVES: 1--Although the unit overall was clean, the carpet did have some rubber bands on them (like the kind you use in braces), which means they didn't vacuum very well, in my mind. They should have a vacuum or carpet sweeper available for guests, because waiting a week without maid service, the dirt on the carpet accumulates. 2--The jacuzzi tub was a bit nasty. We let the kids take a bath in it and as the bubbles were running, clumps of mold shot out into the bath. We didn't use it again after that. Gross. I did report this to the front desk at check out and she said they would have someone look at it. 3--The unit needed to be painted in a few places. There were scratches and chips out the paint in the closet in the master bdrm and livingroom; but this isn't that big of a deal. It still looked beautiful overall. I would stay here again and you can't beat the price! We stayed at Vacation Village at Parkway last year, which was a definite 5 stars, but this was was a close second. We were very happy w/our stay.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: paxess
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March on our honeymoon. We received a deal for a timeshare with a tour. It was so worth it. If it had not been our honeymoon we would have bought a timeshare. The rooms were really nice. We stayed in the old part but were given a tour of the newly remodeled rooms. Even our old decor was in good shape and kept well. The pool is large and kept up. If given a chance we would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Silver Lake”
Reviews.Author: davisw4
Reviews.Content: I purchased our Silver Lake package on Ebay through Carson Travel. I had some concerns after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, and I contacted the resort directly. The resort assured me that the concerns mentioned had been corrected, and we would enjoy our stay. Shortly after contacting SL, Carson Travel contacted me. They also assured me that SL would take care of us, and that I could contact Carson if any problems occured. Both SL and Carson Travel lived up to their claims. Our check-in was quite easy. I had booked a 1bedroom condo, but we were upgraded to a 2bedroom 2bath condo. We stayed in the 1800 building which has been totalled renovated, and has direct access to the pool. The carpet was replaced with tile thru-out the condo. Our unit overlooked the pool. DW tickets were included in our package so we had to do the 90 minute tour. Our tour was actually about 2 hrs, but it was quite informative and no pressure to buy. Once we completed the tour, we were given our DW tickets and told how to use the back gate. The back gate allowed us to get to DW and Animal Kingdom without the traffic. I would recommend SL to families wanting to stay close the parks without paying the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel, not the front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: merrysunshine
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Silver Lake Resort the first week of May, 2006. I loved the hotel, but was treated poorly or without concern by the staff at the front desk. Our check out time at another RCI hotel in the same city was 11:00, and we came straight over to this hotel. I told the front desk staff that I had two bags of groceries with icecream, etc., which would melt if I couldn't put them into a refrigerator. I had called the night before concerned about this situation. No one seemed to care. I didn't need to have a room, just a refrigerator or some means of keeping things cold. I was told to wait--which I did for over two hours. I had to remind the front desk several times that I was concerned about my groceries. No one seemed to care. I decided that even though I liked the hotel, the treatment by the staff would make me not use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Silver Lake Resort from June 24 until July 1st 2006. Resort grounds are nicely kept, pool is very large with alot of lounge chairs. I was a bit weary about staying at this resort, due to the reviews that I had read online. Low and behold......the reviews couldnt of have been more on the money. The first night that we were there......we got some unexpeceted visitors.....COCKROACHES...a whole family of them. Immediately went down to customer service, was told that they were going to send someone from maintenance up. Five minuetes later, doorbell rings, it's the maintenance worker with a can of raid.....My husband immediately told him that he didnt believe that spraying would resolve the problem, the maintenance worker said he would send an exterminator, this was on 6-24 when we arrived, until the day we left, never saw an exterminator show up. Needless to say, the whole time that I was the room was spent killing cockroaches. My husband returned a couple of days later, once again complaining about the unwanted visitors and the manager said that she would have someone take care of the problem....even offered to move us to another room. Another room would of been ok, if they would guarantee me that there were no cockroaches in there, even though it would of been a nuisance, as we had a family of 7. I dont understand how Silver Lake Resort is in RCI's gold crown list. I already sent RCI an email. Needless to say, going back in August, and surely not staying at the Silver COCKROACH Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Pool, Great proximity to attractions”
Reviews.Author: mrkleennh
Reviews.Content: We booked this through TNMCORP on eBay for $240 (total was 300 after tax was charged at check in), we had to do a 90 minute tour/sales pitch with moderate pressure. We also received 2 free SeaWorld tickets We (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed in a 1 bedroom condo with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, jetted tub, pull out sofa bed. It had a great little screened in balcony overlooking the pool. We stayed in the 1800 building that has just been re-furnished and apparently just reopened June 1st. I was quite nervous about staying there after a number of pretty bad reviews on this site. It was very clean and odor free. For our stay: Pros: 1. Great Pool 2. Very close to the parks, gate to gate, we were: - 3 minutes to Animal Kingdom - 10-12 minutes to Magic Kingdom, Epcot, MGM, water parks. 3. Nice new furniture 4. Had Food and Drink available poolside 5. Large Room 6. 1700 and 1800 buildings are right at the pool 7. Clean Cons: 1. Carpet in hallway was in dire need of replacement 2. Some jets on the tub did not work Indifferent: 1. Staff could be a little more welcoming, but I guess not everyone can be as happy as the cast members at the Disney parks. 2. No plasma television as stated in the listing at purchase. Newer buildings have the plasma, but I will take proximity to the pool over that. 3. Rooms could use a little work All in all we had very little to complain about. When we got there the cable on the television did not work, they had maintenance there within 15 minutes and it was fixed. You should keep in mind that it is a condominium, not a full service hotel. There is no daily housekeeping service. You have to wash/reuse your towels, do your own dishes. On our last night in Florida we stayed in a standard Hilton hotel room and I cannot imagine vacationing with kids in anything other than a condo. Would happily return to Silver Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, BUT a few improvements needed!”
Reviews.Author: ashrat
Reviews.Content: My sister and I found Silver Lake Resort through ebay for $630/week (included 4 adult theme park tickets of our choice) with the mandatory attendance of a timeshare presentation. We were 4 adults (my sister, cousin, aunt, and me) in the 800 building in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath. I emailed guest services prior to the trip to request the 800 building and I guess it worked - they did not email me back, but upon check-in I was given a room in that building. POSITIVES *This resort is COMPLETELY kid friendly. So, if you're traveling with the kids, there are activities scheduled daily to entertain them. There is a great game room and the staff in the activities center seemed nice for what we could tell. *The room we had was HUGE, we had more than enough space for the 4 of us. Room amenities were GREAT, we had all we needed to feel like home. TV's in all rooms and the living room had a plasma screen. *Resort has a great ticket desk to buy tickets (though shop around because we got a better deal for Universal tickets at another vendor) to any park, show, museum, etc. *Location to Disney is phenomenal and the access to highways, shops, and restaurants is great. *Check-in and check-out are smooth and the front desk staff was quite attentive. *Pool side bar serves snacks and the drinks were really good. IMPROVEMENTS THAT WOULD BE NICE *Better staffing at pool - we saw a number of children pulling down the volleyball net (which is broken/lop-sided because of this) and no one approached them about this. Also, the basketball court is also the tennis court - SO, if someone is playing basketball, others will not be able to play tennis or vice-versa. Separate courts need to be made. *The room we had had bugs (quite a few gnats and we saw 2 waterbugs/roaches). We did call for extermination service and didn't see anymore, but the thought lingered. They need a MUCH better extermination contract. *The TV remote controls had non-working batteries in all of them, which caused us to feel that they are not completely checking all aspects of the rooms before people check-in. Once we called about the problem, a technician came immediately and replaced the batteries. *The resort only had 1 pool available during our stay - GRANTED it IS a HUGE pool, they needed to have the other one open, which is right next to the big pool. A third pool is being build in another location of the complex, which is great because the complex is big enough to need another pool location instead of having people walk further than necessary to the one. *Carpets in the bedrooms needed to be desparately changed. The carpet was unraveling at the ends and was an out-dated brown color. All in all, I would HIGHLY recommend the Silver Lake Resort for those traveling in a group with kids who need space, resort activities, and amenities of home. Though, anyone can have a good time at this property. The price we got was great and the property is comparable to other resorts I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Silver Lakes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were staying from may 27th to june 3rd in silver lake resort, kissimme...We really enjoyed staying there. we got our condo in 800 building. that was awesome. We enjoyed stying in the resort rather than visting parks. We called the resort 2 weeks before and said that we want a room in 800 building. They told that they will note that as our preference and gave the same to us. To our surprise, we were given 2 bedroom condo. But we have booked 1 bedroom only. We were over joyed by our condo. the pool was really really very nice.. Hospitality was very good. All shops r nearby. Very nice resort for a week stay.I would recommend anyone to stay there and make sure u get a room in 800,900 buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Fell In Love! Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after reading reviews here. I got to stay at the Silver Lake Resort for a bargin for an entire week from a winning bid on Ebay. I loved this resort. I did not even need all of the activities since we were doing Disney and the beaches. Our room was in the 500 building and was great. I was ready to be disappointed upon opening the door but was in love. We had soo much room along with a HUGH flat screen TV. The staff was good. Our daughter got sick in the middle of the night and they brought sheets to us twice in a row. Anything that needed attention was fixed within 10 minutes. I really had no complaints. We were there doing a timeshare tour and that was NO PRESSURE. We said NO and were sent on our way. The pool was very nice and they are in the middle of building their OWN water park. They have wireless internet all over the lobby and pool area at no charge as well as a computer center to use at no charge. Our room had a Washer and Dryer, Large bedroom, Sitting area, Living room, Screened in patio, Large kitchen with all the extras such as a can opener, blender, etc. We even had 2 full bathrooms. We loved it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lake Resort Was Better Then Expected! 2 Thumbs Up !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and i just got back from silver lake resort. We were there from May 15-19 and it was awesome. I have been following reviews on this website for 2 months and have read absolute horror stories. I just don't see how those stories could have been possible. We arrived after hours (7:00pm) on a sunday to a very friendly host. A security guard drove us and our bags to our condo in the 800 building. (yes, after reading some stories about the older buildings i sent an e-mail to silver lake resort [----------------------]) here is a copy of my message and there reply which i received the same day: To Whom It Concerns, Hello! My name is Autumn Ahlers. I have a confirmed stay at your resort from May 14-19, 2006. (Confirmation #896560) My family and I are very excited as this will be our first vacation. However, I due have one concern regarding the condo in which we will be staying. It seems there has been a great deal of negative feedback left by people who have stayed in buildings 1700 & 1800 which i gather are the oldest buildings. If there is any way we can stay in a newer building it would be greatly appreciated.There has been nothing but wonderful feedback left by those who have stayed in buildings 800 & 900. I am aware of the fact that the newest rooms are reserved for timeshare owners and it is on a first come first serve basis. My fiance and myself will be attending a timeshare presentation, as we are interested in purchasing. We would like to see what your resort truly has to offer. Your response will be appreciated and will relieve me of a lot of pre-vacation anxiety. Thank you in advanced. Sincerely, ~Autumn Ahlers and Silver Lake Resort's Reply: Good morning, I have received your request and moved your reservation to the 800 building which shows available at this time for the dates you are traveling. I will do my best to keep you in that building. I cannot guarantee any specific unit number, but have noted your record to please keep this reservation in the 800 building. Frank Mathews, Marketing Fulfillment Manager Silver Lake Resort as you can see they are very hospitable. Our condo was just as described and was very clean and beautiful. We overlooked a pond with a water fountain. We got a 2 bedroom, 2 bath even though it was supposed to be a 1 bedroom, 1 bath.(master bedroom had the oversized jacuzzi hot tub as described and the living room had a flat screen plasma TV. kitchen had all the amenities described including dish washer and washer and dryer) I walked to the Winn Dixie grocery store (.07 miles) and took a cab back ($5.00) with all the groceries we needed for the week. Now for the dreaded time share presentation. We had agreed to a time share presentation for a discounted stay at the resort (6 days 5 nights plus 2, 1 day adult Disney Passes for $189). I've heard horror stories about time share presentations and was expecting the worse. THIS WAS A PIECE OF CAKE. I was whole heartedly interested in the presentation but told the guy flat out we wouldn't be buying today under any circumstance. He went through the presentation in 45 minutes and left us alone to look through the brochure for the remaining 45 minutes. (he isn't allowed to let you leave before 90 minutes although i checked my watch and our meeting was 75 minutes). We then grabbed our 2 free Disney Tickets, grabbed the kids and took a 7 minute cab ride to Animal Kingdom (the closest park) and upgraded or free tickets to a 3 Day Park Hopper ($120 credit for the free tickets). Once at Disney World, with the Hopper Tickets, we got free shuttle to all 4 theme parks, downtown disney (disney quest and pleasure island) and 2 water parks. Ate breakfast and dinner at our condo and had the most affordable time our lives. Hope this was helpful. I think in the future I WILL be purchasing a timeshare at Silver Lake Resort. Oh did i mention the pool side bar that is open from 10:00am to 11:00pm daily ?? Cheers ~A

Reviews.Title: “Miserable staff and sub standard accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by one assisstant who couldn't care less about our visit. We had booked 5 nights with an agent and found we had only been entered for 4 meaning we had to pay for an extra night and downgraded to just a single room for us and 2 toddlers. The rooms were clean but shoddy, considering we were there to purchase timeshare the effect of the room put us in a bad mood; pieces of appliances were hanging off, lightbulbs were burnt out, taps dripped constantly,bedding was cheap and nasty,the same picture was on 3 walls and the unit(1800) smelt like a swimming poll 24\7. The pool was good and the proximity to Disney was good but i would not recommend this resort if you want to be in a place where people care about your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was very inviting for my family. The pool is huge with additional pools currently under construction. We stayed in the 1800 unit and it was very clean, no oders and perfecy for my wife , 2 and 6 yr old. We stayed there under the promotion of the time share presentation and it was VERY low pressure. We actually would've purchased had we been able to do more homework before we had to check out. My advice for first time Disney trvelers or any other theme parks is to stay there under the promotion.....6 nights for under $300!! It's not a Disney resort or the Hilton, but your not paying their prices either!!!! Keep in mind the plasma tv's and the new units are for CURRENT owners.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Silver Lake Resort is very close and convenient to the Disney Theme parks. It has a back exit that allows you to avoid much of the Disney traffic. We stayed in a first level Unit in the 700 building. Our unit was very spacious. The building consists of older units that were a bit wore. The unit that we stayed in was constructed in the early '90s but appeared much older. Our bathrooms had a terrible odor coming out of the toilets. The complex has newer units. I would recommend staying in a newer unit. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I was very shocked!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at this resort in March of 2006. It was unacceptable! My wife almost stepped on a rattle snake as soon as we walked out of our building! The room was very dirty and the employees at the front desk were not helpful. All we asked for was to change to a clean room. We were in the room only 20 minutes and had to pay for a whole week (again!) at Wyndham Palms resort and country club. I spoke with a lady named Jean after returning from vacation and she refunded all of our money. She was very apologetic! We were in the 1700 building so if you reserve a room at this place ask not to be placed in that building! I'm sure the rest of the resort is not as bad. This was the oldest building...

Reviews.Title: “~~Please read!! This place is a dump!!!!!~~ Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a complete dump! Photos look NOTHING like the resort! I have stayed many places over the years but this by far is the worst! We were in the 1700 building and it smelled like it had wet carpet that dried out and it also smelled like mildew was in the air conditioning units. It was very nasty and dated. Even the pool area was gross. The woman at front desk were very unpleasant. They all seemed to HATE their jobs! PLEASE BEWARE OF THIS PLACE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine.”
Reviews.Author: CypressPatterson
Reviews.Content: My family of four just spent Feb. 25 - March 4, 2006 at the Silver Lake Resort in the 1700 building. We do not own a timeshare. We were simply staying there after a friend stayed there 2 years ago and had a good experience. So, we went on the internet and checked into it and made a reservation. THEN, After reading the reviews, I was very nervous about what we were getting into, but everything worked out great. Here are the pros and cons of what we experienced. First, the pros: We were given a bigger room than we had reserved. We were thrilled to be in a 2 bedroom instead of the one bedroom that we had booked, with 2 full baths. It was immaculately clean. The beds were firm, which is what we prefer. Everything worked -- jacuzzi tub, washer/dryer, appliances, tv, etc. Best of all, the location was absolutely perfect because we were doing Disney all week. The back exit of the resort onto Sherberth Road put us literally 5 minutes from our door to the Animal Kingdom. That was GREAT. It was very easy to navigate Hwy 192 for restaurants and an unexpected trip to buy athletic shoes (SOMEONE forgot to pack theirs....) There was one of everything on 192. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We had to listen to the timeshare presentation and the salesman was very nice and not pushy at all. We were out of there in 90 minutes with no pressure. The pool was beautiful and it was warm enough to swim the last night there. There were towels provided for the pool so we didn't have to use room towels. There were ample diversions at the resort, if we would have wanted to take advantage of them (such as a small movie theatre and a game room) but we were too busy at theme parks to use these amenities. Security seemed to be on the ball. These are the cons: Our room's air conditioner did not work. We called about it and it was checked out, and they said someone would fix it the following morning. The following evening when we returned from our day out, we were told that they could not repair the unit but we could move to another room. So we packed up everything and moved to a room with AC 5 floors up at 10:00 at night. That was a big inconvenience, but no harm done. Also, there was one problem with the keys. Our "neighbor" couldn't get his key to work, so security had to reprogram all the keys in a certain area, including ours. Again, just an inconvenience. All the rooms we saw (4 in all) were all solid white walls, white tile, mauve blinds, and slightly dated tropical print furniture. But it was all very clean and very comfy, and we weren't there to look at the pretty pictures on the wall or admire fabric on the couch. There is construction on site, but it appears the work is going on inside the new building, so there was no noise from that. It just looks a little messy on that side of the resort. No Big deal. The back gate onto Sherberth road was a bit tricky to get back in, but only once did we have to give up and go all the way down to Black Lake Road to get back on property. Again, not a big deal. Although the washer/dryer worked and I was very grateful for them, we apparently had the world's slowest dryer -- I had to dry even small loads for a very long time. So, if you're a family going to the area primarily for the theme parks (especially Disney), I would recommend Silver Lake resort. It's clean, spacious, friendly, comfortable, and close to the action. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 nights with my wife. the employees and owners couldn't speak proper English. I think they are arabs! however; the suite was clean.

Reviews.Title: “family hols at silver lakes”
Reviews.Author: holidayfun-63
Reviews.Content: We Have recently come back from a fantastic trip to florida staying at the silver lake resort in kissimmee for 14 days. As we had booked our trip on the internet using discount hotels, to get a good deal we had to go to a "presentation" which was to be honest very painless and pressure free, On our arrival at sliver lakes we checked in and was given directions to our accomodation which would be home for our family of 2 adults and 2 children, we chose to have a 2 bedroom apartment . When we got up to the rooms we looked out of the window and was facing a building site, we immedietly asked to be moved to a more suitable room with a nicer view . We were offered room 1835 with an ajoining room for the kids which was very nice and had all the mod cons described in the brochure except for the plasma screen, but we still had a great room with a 28" screen tv. so there was no problems there. the view was of the fantastic heated pool where my kids played every day, it was hard to get them out some days to go to disney !!. on the day after our arrival we had a been given an appointment to go to our timeshare presentation so we thought we would go early at 8.30 and have our free breakfast as well. the meeting as i said before was no problems and after we told them we were`nt interested, there was no pressure at all and this left us to get on with our fantastic holiday, incidently the silver lake resort is about 5 minutes from Animal Kingdom and it backs on to the Animal Kingdom lodge, so it was real easy to get to all the parks in no time at all with very little traffic, so if your looking for good accomodation close to all the parks , then i would strongly suggest this property. It may not be Marriot or 5 star accomodation but for value for money this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed Owner”
Reviews.Author: HilaryBrown
Reviews.Content: We purchased here back in 1992. We have seen a steady decline in the upkeep of Silver Lakes. When we stayed here Sept 2005 it all started going wrong as soon as we tried to check in at 4pm our allocated room was not ready. The room was still not ready by 5pm we decided we would just go for it and let ourselves in as the door had been left open. The room still was not ready - unmade beds, all the drawers in the bedroom were on the floor, also the drawers in the kitchen had been removed and they had been put on the work tops. So okay they may be giving it a clean but they should also think about cleaning the floors and the entrance door as they were just caked in dirt.The windows at the back of the apartment were filthy (we reported dirty windows when we stayed here in 2003so they still have not got their act together on the dirty windows, the shower in the master suite was not too clean and the shower head was hanging off the wall. The whole unit needed re-furbishing. So it happens to people who own here as well as people who rent the week. The security safe had been left locked so we had to call security to come and open it, the guy who came over just did not have a clue how to open it. Eventually after about 2hrs of different guys trying to open the safe hey presto one of them managed to do it. I personally feel that Silver Lakes just does not live up to its Gold Crown status, although I am an owner here. Silver Lakes just does not look well kept at all. Even the outside of the buildings looks shabby, we wrote all this down on the review sheet that they give you on check-in. ( I wonder if anyone ever reads them) We also own timeshare at Westgate Town Centre and it is far better there than Silver Lakes. But the exchange company over at Westgate is run by Interval International and through our experience you get far nicer resorts with Interval than you do with RCI. But having said all that we are hoping to stay at Silver Lakes March of this year I am hoping it will be a better experience than we had in September.

HotelInfo.Name: Silver Lake Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 7751 Black Lake Rd., Hwy. 192 and Sherbeth Rd., Kissimmee, FL 34747
